loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina, de 40 años, es una mujer que siempre a luchado por sobre salir en la vida, vive sola en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Los arduos trabajos que realiza Marina en su chacra, han hecho que sus plantaciones estén muy bien cuidadas y que los días de venta, sus productos sean rápidamente comprados. Su principal fuente de ingresos, es la venta de café, el cual vende en los mercados de la ciudad de “La Merced”. Disfruta mucho de la temporada de cosecha, ya que siente que su trabajo le esta devolviendo los esfuerzos que dio sobre sus cultivos. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden afectarlas. Con el tiempo, desea adquirir nuevas tierras, para ampliar sus cultivos. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, y siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y nunca ha tenido problemas en su grupo comunal, en donde es la encargada de mantener unido a su grupo. Con los setecientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar la productividad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Marina is 40 years old and is a woman who has always worked hard to succeed in life. She lives alone in her own home and what she wishes for most is to improve her quality of life. The hard jobs that Marina does in her small farm have made her crops very good and when she sells them, they are sold quickly. Her main source of income is selling coffee and it is sold in the markets of the city “La Merced.” She enjoys harvest time since she feels that all her hard work is returned. She has worked for 15 years and says that the most difficult part of taking care of her crops are the plagues that affect them. In the future she hopes to get new land to increase her crop production. This is her second loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and she has always been very punctual in her payments and has never had any problems with her communal group since she is in charge of keeping the group united. With the 700 nuevos soles, she will buy more manure to improve the productivity of her fields.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure to improve the productivity of her fields.

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.en:
Leocadia C. is from the village of Greenheights, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 54 years old. Leocadia is married and has nine adult children. Leocadia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Leocadia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Leocadia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Leocadia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Leocadia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: buying additional products to sell

location.town: Green Heights, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis O

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia P. is from the village of Brgy. Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 42 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Emilia owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling cosmetics and personal products in the local community. Emilia has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2007, Emilia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Emilia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Emilia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
In 2007, Lolita joined ASHI, a Kiva partner in the Philippines, in order to secure access to capital for her business, which consists of raising hogs. This loan is her third, and she has repaid the previous loans on time and made good use of them to expand her business and her income.

Lolita has applied for a new loan of PHP 13,000 to buy sacks of feed and vitamins and to pay for transportation expenses.

Lolita dreams of expanding her business into a full-fledged pig farm. She also dreams of sending her grandchildren to school until they finish college and find good jobs. Until that happens, she is pleased at the way in which ASHI and Kiva have changed her family's life and given them the potential to make their dreams come true.

loans.use: To buy sacks of feed and vitamins and to pay for transportation expenses

loans.name: Mean

texts.en:
Mean S. was born in 1986 and is a resident of the rural area of Kompong Tom Province. She is married and has a young kid who is still not enrolled in school. 

To make a living, Mean S. built a medium store in front of her home where she sells different types of merchandise to people who live nearby. She sells items such as cooking ingredients, cleaning goods, soft drinks, sweets for kids, and gasoline. She has been engaged in this sector for over four years ago, earning about $10 per day. Mean S. receives help from her husband.

Mean S. is committed to make her business more successful and increase her income, so she is applying for this loan to buy additional supplies and ingredients to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies and ingredients to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase 20 gallones of scallops, 200 pounds of shrimp with heads on, and 80 dozen crabs

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita T. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Tagasa, Brgy. Bitoon, Daanbantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a fishing  business.  Her husband, Cesario T., aged 40, is a fisherman, and works with Nenita to earn a living for their family. They have five children who are aged between five and 20 years. The two older ones have started working and the two youngest ones are currently going to school. 

Nenita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 2,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 11,000 which she intends to use to pay for repair work on her fishing boat and minor house repairs. 

She hopes to earn enough so that she can continue to save up for her children's future education and have enough to invest in other business activities such as poultry and livestock-raising.  Nenita T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'Honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To repair her fishing boat and for minor house repairs

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida C. is from the village of Divisoria, Santiago. She is 55 years old. Zenaida is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Zenaida owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling health & medicinal products in the local community. Zenaida has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Zenaida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zenaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Zenaida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Denise

texts.en:
Denise is 26 years old and she is married.  Denise is commonly known in the business of selling foodstuffs, mainly beans, and this is her fourth year in this business which she works at from 7 am to 8 pm every day.  

Denise needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a.  With this loan, she will hopefully expand her business through purchasing a large quantity of foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, Irish potatoes, peas, etc.  With these additional foodstuffs for sale, Denise will hopefully earn more profits than previously and these profits will allow her to keep reinvesting for a better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: a large quantity of foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, Irish potatoes, peas, etc.

loans.name: Harriette

texts.en:
Harriette is 49 years old. She is a widow and has three children between the ages of 20 and 29. Her first born got married and the other one dropped out of school. Harriette has one dependent. 

Harriette sells soft drinks. She has had this business for 13 years. With this loan she will buy more drinks to sell and the profit from this business will help her renovate her house. 

She is happy with her business because it has enabled her to meet the needs of her family. In the future, she would like to be a sole distributor of soft drinks.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Nikol

texts.en:
Nikol I. is 25 years old; he lives in Vazashen village, Ijevan area with his mother. After college he served in the Armenian Army and after that he got a job as a policeman. Simultaneously with his direct work, Nikol engages in farming. In his farm he breeds pigs and rabbits. His mother helps him in this work, and so they kept their family, paid for Nikol’s education and bought necessary furniture for their house. In addition Nikol has a hobby: he breeds pigeons and parrots in his farm. 

Nikol intends to increase his farming and therefore he is asking for a 350.000 AMD loan to buy two calves and fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy two calves and fodder for his farm animals.

loans.name: La Paz Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “LA PAZ” iniciará su  primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, en el Centro Focal de Senkata.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la presidenta, tesorera y secretaria de actas. Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados: venta de comida y fundición de fierros y metales, viajera con mercadería de uso doméstico, venta de papa, servicio de decoraciones de salón para eventos, venta de mochilas, venta de productos de belleza y juguetes.

En el caso de la presidenta, señora Maria Luisa  tiene un hogar conformado por su esposo y 6 hijos, aprendió el negocio de fundición de metales de una amiga y el de comida fue comenzado por iniciativa propia desde hace un tiempo, realiza sus ventas en la cancha de la zona en la que vive.  Le colaboran en su trabajo sus hijos.
Cuando se le consulta sobre lo que le gusta de Pro Mujer ella indica que le gusta el tipo de ahorro, la atención en el consultorio y la capacitación.
texts.en:
The “La Paz” community bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer in the Senkata Community Center. La Paz is comprised of eight members. The board is formed by a president, treasurer and secretary. The businesses represented by its members vary: food sales, metal casting, door-to-door sales of household goods, event decorating, backpack sales, beauty products and toy sales. 

In the case of the president, Maria Luisa lives in a household comprised of her husband and six children. She learned the metal casting business from a friend and has been self-employed for some time. She conducts sales in the main square of the area where she lives. She works with her children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Maria says that she likes the savings capabilities, and access to consulting and training.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for food preparation and metals to cast

loans.name: Danny Tawil

texts.es: Solicitante, tiene 28 años, es soltera, vive en casa familiar,  se dedica al negocio hace mas de 4 años, señor tiene la meta de tener negocio propio, y cumplir con sus sueños y objetivos, solicita credito para capital de trabajo ya que piensa invertir en el negocio.
texts.en:
Borrower is 28 years old, single, living in the family house.  Has been in business for over four years and the goal is to have his own business and reach his dreams and objectives.

He’s asking for funds to use as working capital since he plans to invest in the business.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es:
Rosa Mercedes tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector Victor Raul Haya de la Torre, una zona marginal que se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de Lambayeque, una zona comercial situada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la trabajar en la crianza y comercialización de animales menores desde hace tres años. Ella cría animales como aves de corral en la parte posterior de su domicilio, los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando estos alcanzan un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general. Ella es conocida en el rubro y cuenta con una clientela fija. Adicionalmente cuenta con una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado para brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros que consiste en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina), la cual alquila para agenciarse de ingresos.

Rosa desea un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más animales y alimento balanceado de modo que pueda percibir mas ingresos que le permitan ayudar a su familia a salir adelante. Su esposo trabaja como cocinero en uno de los comedores de la universidad de la zona y juntos tratan de sacar adelante la economía de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Mercedes is 32 years old, married and lives with her husband and children in the Victor Raul Haya de la Torre neighborhood, a deprived area located in the city of Lambayeque.  It is a commercial zone more than 20 minutes from city of Chiclayo.  

Rosa has been raising and selling small animals for three years.  She raises animals like barnyard fowl in the back part of her house.  She feeds them natural grains and grasses.  When they reach a good level of development, she sells them to the public.  She is known in this area and has a fixed customer base.  In addition, she has a mototaxi  (a motorcycle with a cab that has been added, that she uses to offer cargo and passenger transportation) which she rents to bring in more income.   

Rosa is requesting a loan of 1000 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] to expand her business.  She will buy more animals and balanced feed to increase her income and help her family get ahead.  Her husband works as a cook in one of the university dining halls in the area and together they try to provide for their family.

loans.use: To purchase more animals and balanced feed to expand her business and increase her income

loans.name: Bolivianitas Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal BOLIVIANITAS está ingresando al ciclo Nro. 3,  este es un grupo en crecimiento, en proceso de consolidación.   Forman parte del centro focal de Villa Exaltación, está integrado por 8 mujeres y 1 varón.
Cada una de los integrantes ya tiene negocio propio, entre los cuales se tiene: venta de cereales, comercio de víveres, Internet, macramé, venta de cosméticos, y artefactos, artesanías, expendio de comida, venta de chinelas, y venta de comida. La Banca Comunal  Bolivianitas está dirigida por una presidenta, una tesorera y una secretaria de actas, las mismas fueron elegidas por el grupo de socias y el socio.
La  presidenta, la señora Marianela ha participado  durante siete años en otras Bancas Comunales y en la Banca Comunal de Bolivianitas ya cuenta con dos años.   La señora Marianela actualmente se define como "soltera", pues debe cuidar de sus hijos sola, madre de cuatro hijos, tres viven con ella y uno ya tiene pareja y tiene su propio hogar;  el negocio de la señora Marianela es la venta de productos del hogar, tanto comestibles como electrodomésticos a pagos, comenzó con un capital muy pequeño hace 18 años.  El crédito que está solicitando la señora Marianela  le servirá incrementar el capital de trabajo y comprar lo que sus clientes solicitan ya sea víveres o electrodomésticos. Cuando se le consulta por que está en Pro Mujer ella responde "por que le gusta participar en el grupo”.
texts.en:
The Bolivianitas Communal Bank is entering its third cycle. It is a growing group in the process of consolidation. They are part of the Villa Exaltacion central office. The group is made up of 8 women and  1 man.
Each of the members already has their own business, such as: grain sales, supplies sales, Internet, macrame, cosmetics sales, and appliances, crafts, food packaging, slipper sales, and food sales. The Bolivianitas Communal Bank is managed by a president, treasurer and a secretary, all of whom were elected by the group members. The group president, Marianela, has been part of other Communal Banks for seven years, and has been part of the Bolovianitas Communal Bank for two years.
Marianela is currently single, so she has to take care of her children alone. She has four children, three of whom live with her and one of whom has a partner and a house. Marianela's business is selling home products--food and home electronics. She started with a very small amount of capital 18 years ago. 
Marianela is requesting a loan to increase her working capital and purchase what her customers are asking for, whether it be food items or home electronics. When asked why she is part of Pro Mujer, she replied "because I enjoy participating in the group".

loans.use: the purchase of supplies and home electronics on order

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.en:
Eduarda A. is from the village of San Vicente Bajo in Oroquieta City. She is 65 years old. Eduarda is married and has four adult children. To make a living Eduarda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialised retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Eduarda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Eduarda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eduarda is requesting a loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Eduarda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jeane

texts.en:
Jeane F. is from the village of Bangahan, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 36 years old. Jeane is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jeane owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling assorted products, such as shampoo, soap, candies, biscuits & breads, in the local community. She also makes and serves Filipino snacks, like bachoy. Jeane has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jeane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Jeane is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP,  which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods & snack foods. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jeane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods & snack foods

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta A. is from the village of Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 61 years old. Crisanta is widowed and has two adult children. To make a living, Crisanta makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Crisanta has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Crisanta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Crisanta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Crisanta is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Crisanta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Chum P. lives with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorean temples. P. is a weaver, earning an income of $2 USD per day. Her husband sells palm products, earning an income of $4 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend $25 USD on food and $50 USD on other necessary expenses. P. is requesting a loan of $1,000 USD to purchase groceries to start a new business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy groceries to start a new business

loans.name: Melva Nelly

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Esperanza y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Melva, Tiene 45 años de edad y está casada, fruto de esta relación tiene cinco hijas de 20, 19, 16, 14 y 10 años, todas sus hijas estudian en Universidad, colegio y escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica.

Es una muy buena ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar vende productos de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, perfumería, cosméticos y accesorios), trabaja todos los días sobre todo por las tardes, ya que en las mañanas está vendiendo ropa americana negocio que empezó muy recientemente y que le está dejando muy buenas ganancias, ella entrega todos sus productos a crédito y  cobra cada quince días.

Este crédito es para comprar cremas, perfumes, bisutería, ropa americana y otros productos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 13 ciclos y le gusta por los beneficios y por la ayuda que les brinda la Fundación Espoir, ella se desempeña como fiscal de pagos del Banco.
 
Su sueño es llegar a ser una gran empresaria.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Esperanza y Progreso" meets every two weeks in the Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and crafts and renown both nationally and internationally.  It is the place of the famous "panama" straw hat.

Here we meet Mrs. Melva, who is 45 years old and married.  She has five daughters, ages 20, 19, 16, 14 and 10, who are all either in college, highschool or gradeschool.  Her husband works in a factory.

She is a good homemaker and helps her husband with the household expenses by selling Avon and Yanbal (beauty products, perfume, cosmetics and accessories).  She works every day in the afternoons since she sells American clothing in the morning.  She began this business recently but making a good income from it.  She delivers the products on a credit basis and collects payment every two weeks.

This loan is to buy creams, perfumes, costumer jewelry, American clothing and other products.  She has been in the communal bank for 13 terms and enjoys the benefits and support received from the Espoir Foundation.  She acts as Collections clerk at the bank.

Her dream is to be an important businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy creams, perfumes, costume jewelry, American clothing, etc.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Greetings from Chantal in her beauty salon in Kimironko, Rwanda. Chantal is 26 years old and married. She has adopted three orphans.

Chantal, who has been in this business for two years, also works in the African Library. In addition to that, her salon business in Kigali attracts many working-class clients. She employs three people in her salon. She is open from 8am until 7pm every day. One of the challenges in her business is not having enough equipment in the hair salon, especially for her women clients.

Chantal has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase more essential materials for her beauty salon. With this profit, Chantal will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase essentials for her beauty salon

loans.name: Gorette

texts.en:
Gorette is 50 years old and married, with one child who is 21 years old.  She earns a living by selling men's clothes. This is her sixth successful year in business. Her business is well-organized. She operates her business from 6 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day except on Saturday. She employs one person to help her. 

Gorette has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy men's, women's and children's clothes to expand her business. By adding more products and workers, she hopes to earn more profit.  With the profit, she will save for her future and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia, de 58 años, es una mujer sabia y con experiencia, vive con su hija Katy, de 20 años, en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Palcamayo. Desde que era niña se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería; “cuidaba a los chanchos de mis padres y ayudaba a la cosecha”, menciona. Con el tiempo ella invirtió su fuerza y su tiempo en progresar, por ello cuando era joven se dedicó a la pastelería durante 10 años; vendiendo pan, pasteles y demás productos; tiempo suficiente para juntar dinero y comprar su propio terreno de cultivo, donde sembraba hortalizas; productos que vendía al por mayor en la capital. Con el tiempo adquirió una pequeña tienda en su casa y decidió buscar una socia para poder sembrar y tener más tiempo para dedicar a sus otras actividades. Ella colocaba el terreno de cultivo y el abono, mientras su socia las semillas y mano de obra para la cosecha. Como mujer trabajadora y muy hábil pudo invertir todas sus ganancias en la construcción de una casa en la ciudad de Chanchamayo (selva central peruana), donde alquila cuartos a diferentes personas, cobrando un dinero extra cada mes. Ahora ella desea incursionar en la compra y venta de terrenos y seguir apoyando a su hija en sus estudios de Agroindustria. Ella pertenecen al banco comunal “Patrón San Cristóbal” y este es el décimo crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que le proporciona su banco comunal en el desarrollo de sus objetivos durante todos estos años. Celia, con el crédito solicitado comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico para su próxima cosecha. De esa manera podrá obtener una buena cosecha en la próxima campaña agrícola.
texts.en: Celia is 58 years old, and is a very wise and experienced woman. She lives with her 20 year old daughter Katy, in their own home located in Palcamayo. Ever since she was a little girl, Celia, has worked in agriculture and cattle breeding, “I took care of my parents’ pigs and helped them in the harvest,” she mentions. With time she invested her strength and time to get ahead, when she was younger she worked in a pastry shop for 10 years selling bread, cakes and other products. That gave Celia enough time to raise money to buy her own plot of land where she grows vegetables that she sells wholesale in the capital. Later she was able have a small store in her home and decided to look for a partner to be able to sow her land and have more time to work on her other activities. She put the plot of land and manure while her partner put in the seeds and labor for the harvest. As a hardworking and clever woman she was able to invest all of her profits to build a home in the city of Chanchamayo (in the central jungle of Peru) where she rents rooms to different people collecting rent each month. At present, Celia wishes to buy and sell plots of land to keep supporting her daughter in her agribusiness studies. Celia belongs to the “Patrón San Cristóbal” Communal Bank and this is her tenth loan with MFP, where she is grateful for the support given to her by her communal bank in developing her goals throughout the years. Celia will use the loan to buy various sacks of organic manure for the next harvest season to have a good one.

loans.use: buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is 62 years old, married and has three children. She works hard to help provide for her family by running a sari-sari (or variety) store where she sells items such as canned goods and groceries. She has applied for a loan for PHP 18,000 from NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers. She has been running her store for 14 years and also runs a business on the side raising pigs. Her goal is to save enough money to send her grandchildren to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari (or variety) store

loans.name: Norbibi

texts.en:
Norbibi is a hardworking woman. She is married and the mother of two children. Her husband works as a worker. She engaged in selling of biscuits, sweets, chocolates, sugar etc. Her store is located in the central market of Panjikent city. 

Nobibi purchases her goods from Khujand and Istaravshan city. She has many customers and she makes a good profit. Norbibi would like to get a loan of 12,000 Tajikistan somonis (TJS) to purchase new goods in order to increase the assortment of her products. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International 

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History 

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy a new assortment of foods

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 40 years old and married.  He has 4 children, aged 4 to 14.  He runs a fiberglass service shop providing resin, hardener, mat, accelerator, erosil (filler), lime, sandpapers, and air cleaners. Most of his customers are technicians working in the area. James has been running this business for 7 years and employs 1 person. He intends to use this loan to buy more materials in large quantities. 

James hopes to be the largest distributor or materials to technicians. He describes himself as honest, hardworking, and humble.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials in large quantities for his business.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 52 years old and lives in Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a widowed mother of three adult children.

Adelaida is a farmer; she plants and harvests corn to earn a living.  She owns and operates her own agricultural business venture. Adelaida has been engaged in this business for over 15 years. Every quarter, she earns PHP 12,000 from this production. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 from GDMPC to purchase fertilizers and corn seeds.

Adelaida has been member of GDMPC for six months. She hopes to increase her profit in the future and purchase farming equipment and buffalo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and corn seeds.

loans.name: Tsuma

texts.en:
Tsuma has operated a medical clinic business for the past nine years. His customer base is comprised of neighbors and passers-by. His major challenge is a low number of customer turn-out. He dreams of expanding his medical clinic to incorporate outpatients in the future.

Tsuma and his wife have three children, all of whom have graduated from school. He lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is medical bills.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan he is requesting, Tsuma wants to purchase medicines for his clinic. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase medicines for his clinic

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 29 years old, married to Mary, and they have one school-going child. He has practiced farming for the last three years.   

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ollantay 2 Group

texts.es:
(En la fotografía la socia Nelly está levantando la mano). 

La señora Nelly, tiene 48 años D. edad, nació en la ciudad D. Ollantaytambo (Cusco) y ahora vive en la ciudad del Cusco  del departamento del Cusco, ella radica hace varios años en la ciudad del Cusco y donD. realiza sus actividades económicas. 

Nelly  es una madre trabajadora, emprendedora y responsable que atienD. a sus dos hijos, ella para dar D. comer a sus hijos se dedica a la elaboración D. artesanía que consiste en armar muñecas pequeñas, medianas y grandes, ella no tiene un puesto D. venta pero distribuye al por mayor y menor a revendedoras. Ya son 25 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Nelly requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo telas, botones, hilos y muchas cosas más. Su sueño D. la socia es abrir una tienda donD. pueD. vender sus productos. 

Las reuniones D. las socias del Banco Comunal “Ollantay II” son cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco. El banco comunal está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los demás socios se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas como por ejemplo venta D. comestibles, venta D. comida, venta D. papa pelada, venta D. cosméticos y otros brindan servicios D. trasporte D. taxi y mototaxi.   

Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una D. las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Sra. Nelly is 48 years old and was born in the city of Ollantaytambo (in the Department of Cusco), but now she lives in the city of Cusco in the Department of Cusco. She relocated to the city of Cusco several years ago and this is where she performs all of her business activities.

Nelly is a hardworking, enterprising, and responsible mother who takes care of her two children. She is able to support them by making crafts, which consists of handmaD. dolls in small, medium, and large sizes. Nelly does not have a vending post, but she distributes her goods in bulk and in smaller amounts to retailers. She has been in this business for 25 years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. Nelly is taking this opportunity to request a loan for buying materials such as fabric, buttons, thread, and other items. Her dream is to open a shop where she can sell her products.

(In the photograph, Nelly is the woman who is raising her hand.)

The members of the Communal Bank “Ollantay II” conduct their meetings every thirty days in the city of Cusco. This group consists of hardworking and enterprising individuals who take every moment to look for opportunities to get ahead. Through their daily efforts, they are able to proviD. a better future for their children. The members engage in different business activities such as selling food products, selling meals, selling peeled potatoes, selling cosmetics, and providing transportation services using taxis and motorcycle taxis.

Cusco is known for being a tourist and commercial area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, thread, and other materials for making dolls.

loans.name: El Trebol Magico Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama "EL TREBOL MAGICO" debido a que se tiene la creencia de que el trebol de cuatro hojas da buena fortuna. El grupo esta ubicado en el estado de Hidalgo en Mexico. El grupo esta conformado por 12 integrantes. La señora Ana es una las mujeres emprendedoras que integran el grupo. Ella tiene 26 años de edad, estudio hasta la secundaria, esta casada y tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad. Ella es comerciate, tiene una polleria que abrio hace 2 años y desde la fecha sus clientes han ido en aumento por lo cual solicita el prestamo para comprar pollo fresco y así seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y asi poder cubrir la creciente demanda de su polleria. La señora esta muy contenta con su negocio ya que los ingreos que obtiene son un importante aporte para la economia de su hogar, ella comenta que gracias a su trabajo ha podido comprar mas muebles para su hogar, pero sobre todo puede brindarle un mejor futuro a su hijo.
texts.en: The communal bank is called "EL TREBOL MAGICO" (The Magic Clover) because it is believed that a four-leaf clover brings good luck.  The goup is located in Hidalgo, México and is comprised of 12 members.  Mrs. Ana is one of the entrepreneurs in the group.  She is 26 years old and has a secondary level of education.  She is married and has a 3-year-old son.  She earns her living through the chicken shop she opened two years ago.  Since then her customer base has been increasing gradually, so much so that now she is requesting a loan to buy fresh chicken and continue investing in the business.  This will allow her to meet the growing demand.  She is happy with the business since the income she gets from it is an important part of the household economy.  Thanks to her work she has been able to buy more furniture for the home and give her son a better future.

loans.use: To buy fresh chicken.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with six children, four girls and two boys, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  
For the past two years, Rose has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Rose dreams of expanding her business to improve her living standards in the future.
With this loan of 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and rice. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and rice.

loans.name: Jantsandorj

texts.en: Jantsandorj, 37, lives with his wife and children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Tsogttsetsii soum, Umnugovi, Mongolia. His two children are high school students and his wife is unemployed. In 2010, he started a business producing bricks. This year, he started another business, a tire repair service. His family supports him and the business. He is a diligent and hardworking man who says, "Although making bricks is a profitable business, it is hard to make them in winter. So, during the winter, I want to run this car and tire repair service." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to buy equipment for the tire repair service.

loans.use: to buy equipment.

loans.name: Budiriro Group

texts.en:
Fana is 36 years old and for the last three years he has been selling clothes, plates, shoes, and blankets in the local market. He buys them by travelling extensively to neighboring countries where costs are lower. He has no other sources of income. He lives in Masvingo with his wife and five children, ages 4 to 13 years old. Three of them go to school.

Fana has orders that he cannot meet because he does not have sufficient capital. He also needs cash to bring his goods across the border.

In the future, he hopes to buy a house for his family and to expand his operations around the Masvingo province.

loans.use: To buy clothes, plates, shoes, and blankets.

loans.name: El Halcón Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Halcón lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Miriam de 41 años quien se dedica a la compra y venta de cosechas. Este negocio lo inicio desde hace 20 años y su centro de comercialización es el Mercado del municipio.
Ella tiene dos hijos de 19 y 13 años de edad ambos estudian y junto a su esposo le ayudan en el negocio. 
Los otros integrantes son Cristina  de 71 años quien compra y vende cosechas de tamarindo, mamon...etc. y José Isabel de 55 años desde hace 20 años vende frutas.
texts.en:
The 'Halcón' group is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial people.  One of them is 41-year-old Miriam who buys and sells harvested crops.  She started this business 20 years ago and she sells her products in the town market.  She has two children, aged 19 and 13, who are both in school.  Together with her husband, they help her in the business.

The other members of the group are 71-year-old Cristina who also buys and sells harvested crops (tamarind, papaya, etc.) and 55-year-old José Isabel who has been selling fruit for 20 years.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Dolores Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Dolores Mercedes tiene su propia vivienda en el municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón y actualmente está atravesando dificultades porque se ha visto afectada por los fenómenos naturales y por eso su vivienda ha estado en malas condiciones. Por este motivo es que está acudiendo a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de algunos materiales de construcción tales como cemento, arena, entre otros. Está consciente que Ceprodel apoya a este tipo de personas y espera que dicho crédito sea otorgado para así iniciar su obra de mejora en su humilde casa de habitación.
texts.en: Dolores Mercedes owns her own home in the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón and she is currently experiencing some difficulties because she has been affected by natural phenomena and so her home is in a bad state of repair.  For this reason, she came to Ceprodel to request a loan with which to buy some building supplies such as cement, sand, etc.  She is aware that Ceprodel support this type of person and hopes that this loan will be awarded so that she can start her improvement work on her humble home.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand, and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Amor Y Amistad Group

texts.en:
Paula is a married mother who lives in the beautiful town of Samana with her three children. This area is a nascent tourist zone, surrounded by the Atlantic ocean and mountains, rivers and natural breezes. Paula says her most important challenge is to keep her business stable and sustainable. She enjoys working and serving the needs of her family and friends.

Paula is receiving her 9th loan with Esperanza Internacional, after having successfully paid all her previous loans, and after 5 years of investments, she is ready for higher loans and bigger investments. She will invest in this loan by purchasing different clothes like pants, skirts, blouses, and shirts, and she also wants to sell shoes. With her business profits she will reinvest in her business, because Christmas season is coming and all the businesses make better sales.

In the future, with her savings and profits, she is planning to have a better clothing store and a better house.
 
Thanks for supporting this group of entrepreneurs!

loans.use: To buy clothing to resell.

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy is 18 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child.

Christy has a shop that sells fish like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.

Christy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Christy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en:
Jacinto is a hard-working married man from Trinidad, Bohol. He is 49 years old and has a 21-year-old child.

Jacinto has been farming for five years. He primarily grows rice crops to sell, and he works hard to improve his harvest. 

Jacinto has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. He hopes that this loan will help him achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung, a 35-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has a daughter. Nhung runs a general store that sells a variety of basic goods and newspapers to people in the local community. She started this business four years ago. 

Nhung requires a loan to purchase a range of different products, such as snack foods and beverages to stock her store. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase a range of different products such as snack foods and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Myrian Azucena

texts.es: Miriam Azucena tiene 37 años, su actividad es la venta de ropa. Desde hace mas de 12 años que tiene este medio de vida. Ella es una persona muy responsable por lo que disfruta de tener un trabajo estable que le genere ganancias diariamente. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos, trajes entre otros productos. Miriam siempre está pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan y así poder ofrecerles.
texts.en:
Miriam Azucena is 37 years old.  She sells clothes and has done so for more than twelve years. She is a very responsible lady and as such enjoys the benefits of a stable job, which provides her with a daily income.  

She has asked for a loan to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses and suits, amongst other things. 

Miriam is always mindful of what her customers ask for so that she is able to provide these items for them

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses and suits, amongst other items

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 43 years old, married and has four children. She has been running a retail shop for the last ten years and earns a monthly income of 21,000 KES. She is requesting her fourth loan with Kiva partner KADET for 50,000 KES. She will use the loan to buy stocks of sugar, cooking oil, maize flour and soft drinks. With the anticipated profits, she will educate her children.
Susan's hopes are to be able to cater for her family.

loans.use: to buy stocks of sugar, cooking oil, maize flour and soft drinks.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 58 years old and lives in Mohon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. 
Mercy has a general store business and earns approximately 7,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. 
Mercy has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for six years.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Maria Adela

texts.en:
Maria Adela is 24 years old and single.  She has a four-year-old son and lives alone with him in the Salcedo area of Latacunga, Ecuador.  She describes herself as happy and friendly and has been working with dairy cows for six years.  Maria Adela started out with a single cow but has been expanding her business and learning the trade as time goes by.  

She now hopes to take out her first loan, which will help her buy another milk cow, something which she believes can help her raise her income level so that she can better provide for her small son.  Maria Adela's only wish for the future is to make enough to provide her son with a good education and a decent home.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Eben Ezer (#1) Group

texts.en: Sinclair, age 33, is married with 2 children ages 2 and 6 years old. He is representing the Eben Ezer (#1) group. He operates a small grocery store in a local market, a business he's had for 8 years. Sinclair will use the loan to buy inventory for his store, including rice, powdered milk, cans of sardines, and assorted drinks. His business strategy is to offer competitive prices and have regular sales to attract new customers. Sinclair has received 3 previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record. He wants to continue to grow and eventually have a large grocery store one day. Sinclair hopes to be able to help his extended family with their needs with the extra profits from this business.

loans.use: to pay for rice, powdered milk, cans of sardines, and drinks.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa 2 Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por 16  mujeres de la ciudad de Encarnación. El comité ya tiene un poco de experiencia en trabajo grupal, ya que hace meses que trabajan juntas y se han ayudado en estos ciclos.
Una de las integrantes, Porfiria, es madre soltera, tiene 1 hijo. Ella comenta que se dedica a la venta de ropa, se  integro al comité de su barrio para que con la ayuda que le brinda la Fundación Paraguaya pueda iniciar alguna actividad para ayudar a mejorar sus ingresos y así por medio de su trabajo sacar adelante a su hijo, ya que ella se encuentra sola.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de jeans, camperas, buzos, remeras, pantalones y demás prendas, con las cuales podrá estar bien surtida para ofrecer una buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee consists of 16 women from the city of Encarnación. They have a little bit of experience working together as a group. The members have been together for a few months and will help one another in their upcoming loan cycles.

One of the members is Porfiria, who is a single mother with one child. She says that she sells clothing and joined her neighborhood committee so that she could obtain the supported offered by Fundación Paraguaya. Porfiria started her business so that she could improve her income and help her son get ahead since she is raising him alone. She is requesting a loan in order to buy jeans, jackets, sweatshirts, T-shirts, trousers, and other garments. This will help her remain well-stocked so that she can offer a wide variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy jeans, jackets, sweatshirts, T-shirts, trousers, and other garments.

loans.name: Khushnid

texts.en:
Khushnid is 26 years old. He lives in a small village with his wife and little child. The family’s only source of income is from agricultural activities. They raise milking cows and sell milk at local markets. Khushnid and his family have two hectares of land which is hardly enough to provide food for the family. Khushnid is a young and purposeful man who wants to develop his business but he does not have enough money to buy more cattle. He has requested several loans from local financial institutions to fund a family business start-up, but without any success. Khushnid’s requests have been rejected because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

Khushnid is requesting a loan to buy cattle to sell. His loan will help him to increase his business and he plans to use the profit to improve his family’s living conditions. Khushnid awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Nanias

texts.en:
Nanias is 35 years old. He is married with 3 children aged 2 and 9 years. 1 of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 8 years. While his wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Joselyne's Group

texts.en:
Joselyne is a 41-year-old proud mother of 7 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Chwele District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Joselyne has noticed that she has learnt a lot from farming trainings.

Joselyne described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Joselyne’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is married and has seven children. Her four children are in Primary and another three in secondary school. She is a trustworthy, hard working woman and this is why the group members decided to elect her as their Treasurer.

Eunice started her small business in 2001 with the help of her husband who provided start up capital. The business has been growing and at least she is able to pay school fees for her children and provide for her family’s basic necessities. She no longer waits for her husband to buy some of the household items and food.

loans.use: She would like to add more stock into her shop such as sugar, maize flour, Wheat flour and rice. Maize being a staple food for the Kenyans once you stock maize flour and related products, you must make a sale every day. Therefore, she expects to increase her sales which will generate more income in

loans.name: Siamoi

texts.en:
Siamoi was born in 1982 and lives in a household of 5 in district of 8 Kabul, Afghanistan.

Siamoi does not have an education. She took a loan from AFSG so that she can improve her tailoring and embroidery business.

To begin with she had lots of difficulties coping with the family expenses and the fees for her children's schooling. Then she took a 2nd cycle loan and bought lots of materials like fabric, a machine, etc. Now her business is going well.

loans.use: To buy fabric, a sewing machine and cotton

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The money will be invested in buying wood and other materials which will allow him to fill orders from his clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy school supplies and other products for her general store.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. Keo S. is 32 years old and lives with her husband and her three school-aged children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To support her family’s expenses, Keo S. runs a small store selling grocery products and vegetables to the people in her area, where she earns about $5 each day. Her husband can only make a meager sum each day from working as a teacher. This loan will be beneficially used to expand her business by adding more grocery products to meet her clients’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en:
Melisa’s husband has a very good job at the Central Bank but because of the high cost of living (especially with four kids to feed and put through school), she got the idea of starting up her own business to improve her family life.

Her grocery shop opens seven days a week from 6am- 8.pm daily. She focuses more on foods and her prices are very competitive and fair. There is a high demand for her goods from her customers, who mostly come from the local village. It also saves her customers the trouble and expense of having to travel all the way from the village into town.

She makes about $72 USD per day after all expenses of restocking, bills, and looking after her family. Her aim is to expand her shop into a mini-mart.

loans.use: To restock her shop and for home improvements

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier, a young man with great desire to better himself, is a native of the Valley of Mantaro. He has the unconditional love of his mother, who each day encourages him to continue and not settle with what he has achieved. Thanks to this advice, Javier applied to Huancavelica University and was accepted to study the career of agriculture engineering, which filled his mother and himself with pride. In order to continue to study, he is dedicated to farming. In sowing season, which coincides with mid-year vacation, he has taken advantage to sow his lands with many products. He hasn’t finished his job because on the weekends he travels to the lands that still need to be treated for future cultivation. He wishes to finish his career successfully to be able to continue to help his mother. In order for him to earn a profit from the harvest, he needs fertilizers to obtain excellent products from his hard work. Let’s support this young promise. Together we can achieve the amount he solicits.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva volunteer.

Javier, es un joven con muchos deseos de superación, es natural del valle del Mantaro y cuenta con el amor incondicional de su madre, quién cada día lo alienta a seguir adelante y a no quedarse atrás ni conformarse con lo que alcanzó. Gracias a estos consejos Javier postuló a la Universidad de Huancavelica e ingreso a estudiar ingeniería agropecuaria y llenó de mucha satisfacción a su madre y por supuesto a él mismo. Y para sostener sus estudios se dedica a la actividad agrícola, en este tiempo de siembra que coincidió con las vacaciones de medio año él ha aprovechado para sembrar en sus tierras con innumerables productos y aún no culmina su labor pues los fines de semana se traslada desde muy temprano hacia las tierras que aún faltan acondicionar para su posterior cultivo.Desea terminar con éxito su carrera para continuar ayudando a su querida madre y para tener considerables ganancias en su cosecha necesita abonos a fin de obtener excelentes productos como fruto de su arduo trabajo.Apoyemos a esta joven promesa, juntos podemos lograr la acumulación de la cantidad que solicita.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers to increase the quality of his products and completely satisfy the needs of his mother.

loans.name: Raya

texts.en:
Raya is 24 years old and is the mother of 2 children. She lives with her husband (pictured) and children in the Khachmaz region of Azerbaijan. She has been in farming business for 7 years.  Raya currently  needs a loan of $725 to buy seedlings and pesticides.

Note: Raya's husband is pictured, as Raya did not want to be have her photo taken for cultural reasons.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and pesticides

loans.name: Rosa Corina

texts.es:
Mrs Rose belongs to the Community Bank “New Eden” located at Virgen D. Lourdes Mz street Lot number 6 in the district of Yarina Cocha, department of Ucayali. She is 47 years old, has 4 children under 18, is married and her husband is a motorcycle rickshaws driver.

She already received a first loan of 300 soles (100 USD) from the association Manuela Ramos which she invested buying wood that she later sold for a profit.

She has continued selling wood of all types and sizes. She wakes up everyday at 5am to go to the sawmill, where she meets her clients.

With the loan of 1800 soles (625 USD), that she will pay in 5 months, she will buy different types of wood as cedar and other Latin American tropical species (like capirona, shihuahuaco, zapotillo and quillobordon).

Rose feels good about the business; she is economically independent and has a stable situation. She can manage her income without depending on anyone. All thanks to the first loan she got from Manuela Ramos and its staff that advised her well.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuevo Edén, ubicado en el pasaje Virgen D. Lourdes Mz A Lt 6, distrito D. Yarina Cocha, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 47 años y es madre D. 4 hijos, todos menores D. edad, es casada y su esposo es motocarrista.

Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300 que recibió D. Manuela Ramos deciD. invertir en la compra y venta D. madera. En la actualidad se dedica a la compra y venta D. madera en sus distintas modalidades y D. distintas especies, para ello se levanta a las 5 a.m. para ir al aserradero para buscar a sus clientes.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,800, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra D. diversas especies D. maderas, tales como capirona, cedro, shihuahuaco, zapotillo, quillobordon, etc. Rosa se siente bien, económicamente estable e independiente porque pueD. manejar sus propios ingresos sin depender D. nadie, todo ello gracias al apoyo D. Manuela Ramos y a sus promotoras que la orientaron bien.

loans.use: Buying wood to sell

loans.name: Abdulstar

texts.en: Abdulstar lives in district 12 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is educated: he has a degree in business. He has a small business as a real estate agent, renting and selling houses. He has a good number of clients in Kabul, but he wants to enlarge his business so he has requested an individual loan to expand his business. He wants to help his family be well-cared for, and he is happy that he can further his business with this loan.

loans.use: to expand his little real estate business

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina Q. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Aghdam, Nagorno Karabakh. Her nephew lives on the border with Turkey, where there’s a big market where prices are lower than in Baku. Amina’s business is simple. She places orders for goods that are fast to sell, her nephew sends them to her, and she does door-to-door sales.

Women who need to purchase a dowry for their daughters know how to find Amina khala (khala is translated as aunt). She always has doilies, towels, blankets, etc. that are not too expensive and it’s possible to buy on a couple of month's credit from her. Amina needs this loan to purchase more inventory because the season has started.

loans.use: Increasing her inventory for door-to-door sales

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Mrs. Victoria is a member of the Communal Bank "Señor D. Mayo". She sells groceries for a living; her business based out of her home in the district of Catac, Recuay province, department of Ancash. With this loan of $575 US, which she will repay in 6 installments, she will purchase: 2 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar, 2 boxes of tuna fish, 2 boxes of oil, 1 box of milk, 3 boxes of soda (individual serving size), 3 packs of 3 liter sodas. She is 58 years old; she is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a farmer and both help each other in order to cover household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Victoria, pertenece al Banco Comunal Señor D. Mayo, se dedica a la venta D. Abarrotes, su negocio sé ubicado en su domicilio del distrito D. Catac y provincia D. Recuay, departamento D. Ancash. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará: 2 sacos D. arroz, 2 sacos D. azúcar, 2 cajas D. atún, 2 cajas D. aceite, 1 caja D. leche, 3 cajas D. gaseosa personal, 3 paquetes D. gaseosa D. 3 litros. Ella tiene 58 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 6 hijos, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y ambos se apoyan con los gastos del hogar.

loans.use: With this loan, she will purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Resuscitate her business.

loans.name: Keang

texts.en:
Mrs. Keang P., 42 year old mother of six, lives in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. One of her children is a taxi driver, while four others are studying in state school. She currently sells vegetables, while her husband, Mr. Nhim Keo, is a subsistence farmer. Mr. Nhim Keo’s plantation can earn a small revenue because he owns a small rice field. At present, her economical situation is dire because her husband has appendicitis and he will need an operation costing $375.

Mrs. Keang P. is asking for a loan to buy more land in order to increase her husband's rice plantation revenue. Previously, Mrs. Keang P. obtained a loan from AMK to buy a calf for breeding.

loans.use: To buy more land in order to increase her husband rice plantation revenue.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk and electrical goods for a small business

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco Javier R. Martinez lives in a modest home with small rooms. He lives with his wife and young son. There is a specific space in their bedroom for a closet, the problem is that he does not have the resources needed to take on this project. As you can see in the photo, what he is using as a closet is an iron rod. He wants to take advantage of this space and put in a new closet.

Mr. R. works in a barber shop in the city and in his free time paints houses. He is going to use the income from both of his jobs to repay the loan. He is requesting $500 to complete his project.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Francisco Javier R. M. cuenta con una casa que es pequeña y los cuartos en ella también. El vive con su esposa y su hijo pequeño. Hay un cierto espacio para colocar un armario, la cuestión es que el no cuenta con el recurso necesario para llevar a cabo este proyecto. Como pueden notar en la foto, el tiene como closet un tubo de fierro. El quiere aprovechar ese espacio para colocar su nuevo armario

Sr. R. trabaja en una maquiladora de esta ciudad y en su tiempo libre también se dedica a pintar casas. El va a contar con los ingresos de sus dos empleos para poder pagar el préstamo. El solicita $500 dólares para llevar a cabo su proyecto.

loans.use: Construct a closet for his bedroom.

loans.name: Jesús Enma

texts.es:
La señora Jesús Enma R. Benítes tiene cincuenta años, vive en la avenida Los Incas 325 en el distrito de Mache, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió educación primaria completa y ya no continua estudiando debido a que sus padres pensaban que era suficiente con la primaria, preferían educar a los hijos hombres ya que ellos servirían a la patria.
Se casó a los veintitrés años y tienen tres hijos de los cuales uno todavía es estudiante, los otros dos ya trabajan.
Empezó su negocio comprando animales y vendiéndolos en carne, así se obtiene mayores ingresos, comenta.
De Manuela Ramos obtuvo un primer préstamo de 300 soles con los que compró animales para venta de carne, los devolvió en cuatro meses.
Con el préstamo que obtendrá de Manuela y será de 1000 soles comprará una ternera la que venderá en carne.
Pertenece al Comedor Popular Corazón de María, a la Asociación de Padres de Familia del colegio de su hijo y al Banco Comunal Progresistas y en todas sus Instituciones es tesorera.
Sueña con pasear viajar y conocer diversos lugares de Perú y el mundo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jesús Enma R. Benítes is 50 years old and lives on Los Incas 325 Avenue in the Mache district of La Libertad, Perú. She completed her primary school education, but did not continue her studies given that her parents thought she’d received enough schooling. They preferred educating their sons, as they would be serving their country. She married at 23 years of age, and had three children. One of her children is still in school, while the other two are now working.

She started her business buying animals and selling their meat which, she tells us, is how she generated greater income for herself. She received a first loan of 300.00 soles from Manuela Ramos, with which she bought animals. She repaid the loan in four months. With this loan from Manuela for 1,000.00 soles, she will buy a calf whose meat she will then sell. She belongs to the Corazón de María dining hall, to the Parents Association at her son’s school, and to the communal bank Progresistas. She serves as Treasurer at all three institutions. She dreams of traveling and getting to know other areas of Perú and the world.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a calf.

loans.name: Chailim

texts.en:
Mrs. Chailim S., 36, and her husband, Mr. Srun Chum, 36, live in a small village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married for eleven years and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of their children study in a local school.

Chailim has been a silk weaver for six years and has been a rice farmer since she was young. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Srun is a wooden houS. builder and rice farmer as well.

Chailim is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchaS. silk materials for her weaving and a water pump for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and a water pump

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
Yaneth es socia del Banco Comunal Yachay Wasi que significa casa del Saber en quechua.
Yaneth es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 2 hijos, Yaneth junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de madera, sus productos los adquiere en la selva Ayacuchana, a donde viaja semanalmente, sus ventas los realiza a las madereras al crédito y contado.
Yaneth necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de madera tornillo.
Yaneth sueña con tener una casa propia, un carro para transportar sus productos y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Yaneth is a member of the community bank Yachay Wasi, which means House of Knowledge in Quechua. Yaneth lives in a common-law relationship, is 23 years old, and has 2 children. Yaneth and her husband sell lumber. They acquire their products in the Ayacuchana jungle, where they travel weekly. They sell their wood to lumber yards on credit and account. Yaneth needs a loan of 1000 soles ($325 USD) with which she will buy tornillo lumber. (Tornillo, also known as white mahogany, is a hardwood tree, 100 to 160 feet tall with a trunk over 4 feet in diameter). Yaneth dreams of owning her own home, a truck to transport her product, and that her children will grow up to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber (specifically, tornillo)

loans.name: Raquel Marie

texts.es: La Sra. Raquel, casada, de 44 años de edad, con 2 hijos de 19 y 22 años (mujer y varon), ambos trabajan y estudian la universidad, recibe el apoyo de su esposo, quien trabaja en la Policica Nacional, ella trabaja en las universidades UNAN y UNA los dias jueves, viernes, sabados y domingos, con 10 años de trabajo en la docencia superior; esta solicitando su credito # 5 el que utilizara para ponerle el piso de ceramica a su casa, ya que es una casa de proyecto y se se las entregaron embaldozadas, ademas pintara toda la vivienda si el presupuesto ajusta.  La profesora Raquel ha pagado sus creditos en tiempo y forma demostrando responsabilidad con sus compromisos adquiridos, esta catalogada como clienta "A" de esta institucion.  Manifiesta que no ha trabajado con ninguna otra financiera porque no le gustan las politicas, mientras que con AFODENIC ella se siente bien atendida y las politicas son mas flexibles, ademas dice que continuara trabajando con sus creditos hasta lograr dar todas las condiciones a su vivienda que es lo que siempre han soñado ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Senora Raquel is married, 44, and has 2 children ages 19 and 22, a girl and a boy. Both children work and attend the university. She receives the support of her husband who works for the National Police, and she has been teaching at the upper level for 10 years in UNAN and UNA Universities Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday. She is requesting her fifth loan, which she will use to put down a tile floor in her home, since it is a work in progress and the tiling has been started. She will also paint the whole house if the budget allows. Professor Raquel has paid her loans on time, demonstrating her responsibility to the commitments she has undertaken. She is rated as an "A" client of this institution. She has demonstrated that she has not worked with any other financial institution because she does not like politics, but she feels very well-served with AFODENIC and the rules are more flexible. She says as well that she will keep working with her loans until she has completed all the improvements to her home that she and her family have always dreamed.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Lay tile and paint her house

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
