Cristina is a member of the Desarrollo (“Development”) Village Bank.  She is 53 years old and married with four children. Cristina lives in the city of Pichari, in the Ayacuchan jungle. Cristina has a seafood restaurant called Palacio D. los Mariscos (Shellfish Palace). Her son administers the restaurant, and has two employees to help him. Cristina also has a clothing store in a rented location, where she sells baby clothing.  Cristina needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy baby clothes.  Cristina dreams of buying a plot of land, of having her own store, and of buying a car. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Cristina es socia del Banco Comunal Desarrollo. 
Cristina es casada, tiene 53 años y 4 hijos, Cristina vive en la ciudad D. Pichari que esta en la selva ayacuchana, se ubica a 7 horas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, Cristina tiene una Marisquería llamado Palacio D. los Mariscos, su hijo es quien se encarga D. al administración D. este negocio, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo D. 2 personas. Además Cristina tiene un bazar en un local alquilado,  en donD. venD. ropa D. bebes. 
Cristina necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ropa D. bebe. 
Cristina sueña con comprar un terreno, tener local propio y comprar un carro.

loans.use: Buy baby clothes

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: Курбонова парвина проживает в районе Гиссар. Возратс 32 года , не замужем. Имеет среднеспециальное образование. По профессии медсестра. Но работает вмагазине . Торгует парфюмерией и подарками. Кредит планирует получить и использовать для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Parvina K. lives in Tajikistan's Gissar region. She is 32 years old and is single. She is a high school graduate. She is a nurse by training but she sells perfumes and presents in a store. Parvina is applying for a loan in order to increase cash flow. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es: El grupo " Las Divinas" esta conformado por 14 miembros y están representados por el señor Carlos, dentro del grupo existe un parentesco entre la señora Lizeth y Liliana que son hermanas pero ambas tienen sus ingresos totalmente independientes por lo que no existen riesgos en el grupo. Entre las actividades que realizan los miembros del grupo esta la D. construcción D. viviendas, el servicio público D. transporte y la venta D. productos como juguetes, cosméticos, ropa, comida, bolsones, Abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio y otros. La competencia en la venta D. productos es muy dificil por eso que la mayoría D. las socias realiza un servicio puerta a puerta con sus clientes. El destino del crédito es para el incremento D. mercadería y la compra D. herramientas D. trabajo más modernas para brindar un mejor trabajo. Entre las socias hay quienes tienen experiencia con grupos solidarios y otras que reciben su primer financiamiento pero se sienten capaces D. poder cumplir con su grupo y con la Fundación Agrocapital que les brinda la oportunidad D. un financiamiento con grandes ventajas
texts.en:
The group "Las divinas" (The Divine) is formed by 14 members and is represented by Mr. Carlos. Within the group there is a relationship between Ms. Lizeth and Liliana, who are sisters. However, their incomes are independent so there exists no risks to the group. Among the activities the group carries out, the members build homes, work in public transportation, and sell products like toys, cosmetics, clothes, gym bags and shopping bags, food items, groceries in neighborhood stores and the like. The competition in selling the products is very difficult because many of the entrepreneurs go door to door to offer their products. The loan will be used to purchase more merchandise and more modern tools which will help them to do better work. Among the members there are some that have experience working in groups to get loans and others who are doing so for the first time. However, they all feel capable to be able to work well in the group and with Agrocapital Foundation, the organization that is helping them to to get financing will huge advantages.

(Translated by Elliot of San R. High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for Businesses

loans.name: Yim

texts.en: Mrs Yim M., a 50-year-old mother of five children, lives in Sophy village in Takeo province. Three of her children are employed and the others are enrolled in the local school. Yim M. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr Orn Sarun, is a construction worker. Although they work hard, they earn insufficient income to support their household. Yim M. has therefore decided to ask for a loan to buy a breeding cow to earn more income. She and her husband are both shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy S. est mariée avec 05 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Bayouf Palal. Son activité est la vente de petit déjeuner.  Elle veut  acheter du pain, du lait, du sucer et du café pour préparer et vendre le petit déjeuner. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Amy S. is married with 5 children in her care. She is a member of the village loan group Bayouf Palal. Her business is the sale of breakfast. She would like to buy bread, milk, sugar, and coffee to prepare and sell breakfast. The loan she is asking for will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell breakfast

loans.name: Leng's Group

texts.en:
The group leader of four borrowers in this loan is Mrs. Leng S., age 31. S. and her husband make their daily income by fishing in and around Tunle Sap Lake. Since 1998, they have been operating their job. The couple now lives with two teenage children who are school age. The children help their parents' fishing business when they are not studying. S. is applying for a loan in order to buy a machine to connect to the boat so she can go fishing more quickly. The other three borrowers are:
V. is a local fisherman, asking for a loan to buy nets for fishing.
S. is looking for a loan in order to purchase fishing tools for her business.
S. earns a living by fishing and is requesting a loan to decorate her house.
They all live in Chong Kneas Commune, in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy a machine for her boat

loans.name: Sugra

texts.en: Sugra (her husband is pictured)is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, settled in Fuzuli region, in the Kayidish settlement. They have 4 children. They have been in this business for 5 years. Now they need a loan of 2000 Azerbaijan New Manats to buy fruits and vegetables for improving their business.

loans.use: Fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Anju

texts.en:
Mrs. Anju T., 22 years old, is a tailor in the town of Kulashwor.  She opened her tailoring shop more than a year ago. Before she opened her own shop, she took six month of training for tailoring work. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls. She prefers to make popular dresses like the Kurta Sulwar, Blouses, Ladies long dresses, Makhshi, and others. 
She plans to use her Rs 20000.00 loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. 
Mrs. Anju T. lives with her husband, two brothers-in-law and one sister-in-law. Her husband, Mr. Hari, went outside of the country for work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring work

loans.name: Jesús Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Jesús Antonio C. es padre de familia y tiene un hijo para el cual quiere la seguridad.
      Con un crédito anterior que tenia en FVP pudo construir unos cuartos pero le está haciendo falta el techo, desea ponerlo de concreto para que sea más seguro y duradero. Pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder realizar la mejora lo más pronto posible.
     Don Jesús Antonio trabaja en una maquiladora en el departamento de técnico, son los ingresos de su familia y con el cual una parte será para pagar el  crédito.
texts.en:
Jesús Antonio C. is the father of a family and has a son for whom he wants security. With the previous loan he had with FVP, he was able to construct a few rooms, but they are still missing a roof. He would like to make the roof out of concrete so that it is more secure and durable. However, he does not have enough money to be able to make these improvements as soon as possible. Jesús Antonio works in an assembly plant in the technical department, which provides the income for the family, a part of which will be used to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a concrete roof

loans.name: Walid

texts.en: Walid is a 46-year-old married man living with his wife and two children. He has owned a food market named "Lord" since 1998 with which he services the neighboring areas. Today, Walid is requesting to borrow $1,200 to increase his inventory.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Genaro Carlos

texts.es: El sr. Genaro se dedica a la costura de chamarras, chalecos, deportivos para niños y su esposa los lleva a vender a Potosí y Oruro, donde tiene clientes fijos, tiene también su minibús que trabaja en las noches para tener algunos ingresos extras, tiene dos hijos que le ayudan en la costura y estudian, es un cliente muy puntual, invertirá el crédito en la compra de tela polar para costurar chamarras por los pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Genaro works sewing jackets, vests, sport clothing for kids and his wife sells them in Potosi and Oruro, where they have set clients, he also has a minibus and works at night to have some extra income, they have two kids that help out with the sewing and study, he is a punctual person and will invest the loan in buying fabric to make jackets and cover the orders he has.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Jumoke

texts.en: Jumoke sells provisions and frozen food like fish, chicken and turkey. She has been in the business for the past two years. Jumoke lives in Lagos. She is thirty-five years old and married with four children. She is requesting a loan in the amount of N100000 to purchase more provisions and frozen food to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and frozen food to sell

loans.name: Jinky Mabelle

texts.en:
Jinky Mabelle B. is from the village of Gata Diot in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Jinky Mabelle is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jinky Mabelle raises pigs for sale. Jinky Mabelle has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Jinky Mabelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jinky Mabelle is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jinky Mabelle from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Dely

texts.en: Dely is 45 years old, married to Wilfredo, and has children. Her husband works as a farmer in their village of Palao, Solana, Cagayan, while Dely is a banana dealer. She buys bananas from her co-villagers or from banana farmers then brings the bananas to market to sell. Dely wants her business to grow and is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP through Kiva that she will use as additional capital for her fruit vending business. She hopes that her business will expand and that by persevering she will become a productive entrepreneur.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Ergash

texts.en:
M. Ergash is 48 years old. He is married and has 5 children. Ergash is a market vendor. He has been selling the fruits for 18 years already. For these years Ergash had acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business. For instance, he knows how to store the fruits so that to keep their marketable conditions and not to lose the taste and useful properties. He is selling fruits such as: apple, peach, pomegranate in the center local market. In the market he is known among people because of the attractive prices and friendly characteristic feature. All this allows Ergash’s business to generate the stable considerable incomes for his family. Due to the season now Ergash’s selling goods are in high demand. For this reason he is planning to purchase the more fruits for selling. He is requesting for a loan of $1500 USD that will allow him to expand his business. Ergash thanks everyone for supporting him.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing of the range of fruits

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora es socia del Banco Comunal Capuli.
Dora es casada, tiene 45 años y 2 hijos, Dora junto a su esposo tiene un Bar Resturante llamado El Dante, en donD. venD. bebidas y la especialidad del restaurante es el Cebiche, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. 4 personas.
Dora necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, arroz, y licores.
Los sueños D. Dora son mejorar su negocio, construir mas pisos en su casa y que su hija culmine sus estudios.

loans.use: Para la compra de azúcar, arroz, y licores.

loans.name: The Young Generation Group

texts.en:
This is Mamusu B., Ramatu B., and Zainab T.. They call their group Tataisumpa. 

Mamusu B. (right) is the leader of this group. Mamusu is a 36 year-old widow with 2 children. Mamusu owns a small store selling general household goods such as pots and pans, bug sprays, and cosmetics. She has been in business for 4 years.

This is the first loan these entrepreneurs have requested from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods into their businesses so that sales and profit will increase. Consequently their standard of living will also improve. They will be in a better position to look after themselves and their children in terms of feeding, clothing, sending them to school and providing them with medical care in case they fall sick.

loans.use: Expansion of business.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina K. is married and has one child. She has received a senior high school education.  Paulina sells secondhand clothes, body lotions, hair weaves, and so on at Elmina, which she has done since 2007. Her husband is a carpenter.  Paulina uses her income to help pay school fees and utility bills.  Paulina will use the loan to purchase a bale of secondhand clothes and some cosmetics for resale. Paulina plans to save the new profits from her expanded business and reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of secondhand clothes and some cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty is a fashion designer; she is 35, married, and has two children. She wishes to expand her business by adding the sale of tailoring materials and sarongs; she believes that having an assortment of sarongs that are of good quality will increase her sales. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Luluofe

texts.en:
Luluofe is 52 and married with 6 children (ages 8 - 23).  She owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has  years of experience in this business.    Luluofe needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.  

In 2009, Luluofe joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Luluofe's 1st loan with SPBD. 

In addition, SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a "3 out of 3" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a "2 out of 3" = secondary/high-school, and a "1 out of 3" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

Luluofe's Overall Social Metric Score:               1.6 out of 3

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD:
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma V. owns a small sari-sari store. She sells a variety of goods and earns an income for her family. She said that the greatest dream she has is for her children to graduate from college. She is working very hard to be the best mother for her two children. Her eldest child is 19 years old. She is doing the best she can to provide for all of her children's needs.

She would like to request a loan of Php 20,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. If she gets a loan, she will use it to buy farm supplies to grow a crop. In this way, she could earn a higher income to better support her family.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Araham

texts.en:
Araham J. sells bread and groundnut paste. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of groundnuts for making paste.  Araham is 37 years old and is married; her husband is a driver. She has 6 children, all of whom are in school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a wholesale shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Ingredients for groundnut paste production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of rice

loans.name: Maria Adelaida

texts.es:
María tiene 48 años de edad, es separada y vive con el último de sus cinco hijos de doce años de edad en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ha trabajado como obrera agrícola desde muy joven. Las labores que suele realizar son la recolección de ají escabeche, de espárrago y de maíz. Gracias a estas actividades ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos y ahora la mayoría de ellos ya son indepedientes. Actualmente trabaja desde las seis de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde en la recolección de cebolla en una chacra cercana.

María se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de material para techar su casa, ya que las continuas lluvias propias del mes de verano están haciendo estragos en su  vivienda cuyo techo está construído de material rústico.

Ella es una madre de familia luchadora y bastante trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es darle a su hijo una educación de calidad que le garantice un futuro prometedor. En la fotografía aparece mostrando el techo que desea cambiar.
texts.en:
María is 48 years old, separated from her husband, and lives with her twelve year old son who is the youngest of her five children. They reside in the District of Paiján, Province of Ascope. This community is in the region of La Libertad, which is three hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

María has been a farm worker since she was a young woman. Her tasks include harvesting peppers, asparagus, and corn. Thanks to her work, her children have been able to get ahead and most of them already live on their own. María currently works from 6am until 5pm harvesting onions at a local farm.

She is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles so that she can purchase roofing materials for her home. The continuous summer rains are wreaking havoc on her house, which is made of basic materials.

María is a determined and hardworking mother who desires to provide her son with a quality education that will help him secure a promising future. The photograph shows the roof that needs to be replaced.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to replace her roof

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en:
Remegia R. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 38 years-old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Remegia owns and operates a sari-sari (general) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Remegia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Remegia joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remegia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory  and to provide working capital. Remegia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Remegia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Jadambaa

texts.en: Jadambaa is 25 years old and lives with his wife and a son in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Jadambaa operates a carpentry business in his own yard. He started his carpentry business with his father in 2006, and successfully expanded the business with a loyal customer base. Jadambaa has gained experience in past years and he has good communication skills. He has been planning to expand his business and to create a carpentry workshop in the future. Besides his carpentry business, Jadambaa works as a plumber for a private company and earns monthly 120,000 tugrugs (~ 85 USD) from this job. He is a very hardworking person and says, “I would like to stabilize and expand my business.” Jadambaa is requesting a 550,000-tugrug loan to purchase more timber for his carpentry business.

loans.use: To purchase timber

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase maize, beans and rice in bulk

loans.name: Yoselin Virginia

texts.es: LA SRA. YOSELIN ESTA CASADA Y TIENE 2 HIJAS,  SE DEDICA A LA REPOSTERIA, VENDIENDO LOS PEQUEÑOS BOCADOS DULCES COMO POR EJEMPLO QUEQUES, ALFAJORES, EMPANADAS Y REPARTIENDO A LAS TIENDAS DE LA CIUDAD Y COLEGIOS. ELLA DESPUES DE MUCHO TIEMPO SE ANIMO A ABRIR UNA TIENDA DONDE PUEDA EXPONER SUS PRODUCTOS Y ADEMAS A LA VEZ OFRECER PRODUCTOS DE CONSUMO MASIVO, ESPERA ELLA QUE TENGA MUCHO EXITO, YA QUE EMPEZAR UN NUEVO NEGOCIO PARA ELLA ES CUMPLIR UNO DE SUS SUEÑOS, QUE GRACIAS A LA ISTITUCION ESTA HACIENDO REALIDAD, Y QUE A  FUTURO LE PODAMOS SACAR UNA FOTO EN SU NUEVO NEGOCIO, ESTA MUY COTENTA DE TENER UNA TASA KIVA, ES MUY TRABAJADORA Y POR AÑOS SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE SUS QUEQUES Y TORTAS, SUS HIJAS LE AYUDAN EN SUS TIEMPOS LIBRES YA QUE ESTUDIAN EN LA UNIVERSIDAD Y OTRO DE LOS DESEOS DE LA SRA. YOSELIN ES DE VER A SUS HIJAS PROFESIONALES, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRAR MESAS Y SILLAS, ANAQUELES, ETC Y TAMBIEN INSUMOS PARA LA ELABORACION DE SUS QUEQUES, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yoselin is married and has 2 daughters. She does baking, selling the sweet pastries like cakes, candies, and empanadas (filled pastries) and distributing them to stores in the city and to schools. After some years she decided to open a store where she could display her products and also offer them to the general public. She hopes to be very successful, now that she has started her new business. This is a fulfillment of one of her dreams, and thanks to the institution, it has become reality. In the future we can take a picture of her in her new business. She is very happy to have a loan from Kiva. She is hardworking and for many years has made cakes and pies. Her daughters help her in their free time from studying in the university. Another hope for Mrs Yoselin is to see her daughters become professionals. With the money from the loan she will buy tables, chairs, shelves, etc and also ingredients to make her cakes. She is very grateful to EMPRENDER and KIVA for the confidence they have shown her in the issuing of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The furnishings for a bakery

loans.name: Kezia

texts.en:
Kezia is 32 years old, married with five children, aged between 5 month and 12 years old. Kezia owns a small shop, which sells tomatoes, water, cooking oil, rice, and so on.  Kezia’s husband is a farmer and they both work hard for their family. This is her 10th year of success in her business. The hours of her shop are from 8 AM to 6 PM every day except Sunday. 

Kezia is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through adding other products such as  clothes and cosmetic products which can help her to attract more customers for her shop. This will be one way to obtain more profits, which will allow her to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: adding other products such as  clothes and cosmetic products

loans.name: Tolib

texts.ru: Кодиров Толиб проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст, 31 год. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Образование высшее, программист. Работает по профессии в ЗАО ТК - мобайл. Кроме того у него интернет кафе. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 5 лет. Кредит берет для обновления компьютеров.
texts.en:
Tolib K. lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is 31 years old, married and has 2 children. His wife is a homemaker. Tolib has a higher education as a programmer. He works in his profession at ZAO TK - mobile. Besides this work, he has an internet cafe. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. Tolib is requesting this loan in order to refresh the computers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refreshing computers

loans.name: Tening

texts.fr: Téning W. est une femme de 38 ans, elle mariée et mère de 4 enfants en charge et aussi tutrice d’un garçon et d’une fille. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINTHIANG COUNDARA depuis le 22 janvier 2003 et a 14 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et a toujours remboursé sans difficulté. Elle fait de la transformation et vente de pate d’arachide. Elle vend son produit dans les marchés hebdomadaires des villages environnants. L’objet de son prêt est de renforcer sa production pour réaliser plus bénéfices et son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille par exemple la santé, la nourriture et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Téning W., 38, is a married mother raising four children as well as being guardian of one boy and one girl. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of SINTHIANG COUNDARA since January 22, 2003, has received 14 consecutive loans, and has always reimbursed them without difficulty. She processes and sells peanut butter. She sells her peanut butter in the surrounding weekly markets. The goal of her loan is to increase production to make more profit; her intent is to help support her family, for example helping with healthcare, food, and her children's school fees.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Lucy Margarita

texts.en:
Having mastered the wonderful art of tailoring, Lucy runs a micro-enterprise in which she makes all types of clothes for women, men and children. For her, the skill was a family tradition she perfected over years of practice and study, along the way making a bit of a name for herself in the neighborhood, thanks to the high quality of her work. 

Lucy came to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo one year ago and has now applied for her second loan, this time with Kiva, that she plans to use to buy primary materials such as fabrics, thread, and buttons to turn into dresses based on her clients' measurements. Since she started with FMSD, Lucy has bought her materials in an efficient manner, without needing to maintain a special inventory that could potentially deteriorate over time in the humid climate. 

Lucy's biggest challenge is that her workspace is cramped and is located within her family's home (a condition which currently leads to longer work days than she'd prefer). She dreams of setting up a workshop completely separate from her home so as to put a bit of space between her professional and personal lives. She also envisions her children (aged 15 and 21) becoming professionals and for that reason she and her husband work hard to encourage and finance their studies. 

[EN ESPANOL]
Lucy S. Domínguez domina el maravilloso arte de la confección, por eso creó su microempresa donde fabrica todo tipo de ropa en  las líneas  femenina, masculina e infantil; ella aprendió a preparar, cortar y ensamblar piezas por tradición familiar y poco a poco, mediante el estudio ha ido perfeccionando sus técnicas, por eso hoy tiene muchas personas, que reconocen  su trabajo de calidad y se han sostenido como sus clientes. Desde hace un año pertenece a los programas de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y este es su segundo crédito por valor de $2.000.000 COP, con el cual va comprar materias primas, como telas e hilos y botones que le faciliten elaborar vestidos sobre medidas que le han solicitado sus clientes. Desde que ella accedió a créditos con esta organización compra de manera eficiente, sin necesidad de mantener un Stock de inventarios que puedan deteriorarse, porque ahora se ha organizado en este sentido.
Su sueño más importante es establecer un taller totalmente separado de su medio familiar, para no mezclar sus responsabilidades productivas y domesticas y  muchas veces extender sus  jornadas de trabajo. Igualmente visiona a sus hijos de 21 y 15 años como unos profesionales de calidad y por eso ella con su cónyuge trabajan persistentemente para conseguir esta meta. Su mayor desafío es lograr algún día tener un amplio local donde establecer su taller, porque el que actualmente tiene es muy estrecho.

loans.use: to buy primary materials such as fabrics, thread, and buttons

loans.name: Hefseba Group

texts.en:
Isaac M., age 37, is single with one daughter aged 6 years. Since 2010, he has had a business selling water wholesale. He works from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily and he is able to earn a monthly profit of about $27.

This will be Isaac’s 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loan to increase his stock of water and has paid back the loan successfully. He hopes for a new loan to again increase his stock of water and also to start selling juice.

Isaac will share this loan with his loan group called Hefseba, which totals sixteen members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

In the photo, Isaac is in an orange shirt, first on the left in the front row.

loans.use: To increase his stock of water and to start selling juice

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita V. is from the village of D'ban Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Clarita is widowed and has three adult children. To make a living, Clarita owns and operates a retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, sugar, milo, and nescafe  in the local community. Clarita has been engaged in her business for more than 12 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Clarita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Clarita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Clarita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Clarita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Djelika's Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Dembagnouma I sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et  en  moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles polygames à Wobougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz, le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé
Avec ce nouveau prêt, DJENEBA F. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare d’arachide et de haricot.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40.000FCFA environ en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Dembagnouma I group are married women with an average age of 39 and an average of 3 children. They live in polygamous families in Wobougou, one of the villages in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region, the second administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their rainy season activities. They grow, among other crops, rice, pearl millet, peanuts, and beans. They are on their second season loan and their previous loan was repaid in full. With this new loan, Djeneba F. plans on buying fertilizer, small farming equipment, and paying for the labor costs involved in maintaining approximately 1 hectare of peanuts and beans. The harvested crops are sold in Dioïla and Massigui to a client base made up of both men and women. The group members hope to make an average profit of approximately 40,000 francs CFA by the end of the season.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and small farming equipment

loans.name: Richard Njoroge

texts.en: Richard is 36 years old and married, with a 4-year-old son who is in school. He runs a real estate agency in Nairobi called Glory and Virtue. His customers are tenants, and he has been in the business for 8 years. He wants to use his loan to buy a computer and printer to help further establish his business. Since becoming a client of Faulu Kenya, Richard says he is more business-focused. He hopes to expand his business to be the major agent in his district.

loans.use: A computer and printer

loans.name: Agapito

texts.en:
Agapito C. is from the village of Tagodalo, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 53 years old. Agapito is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Agapito raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting, harvesting, and selling squash and other vegetables. Agapito is just starting this business.

In 2008, Agapito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agapito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Agapito is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer. This loan will be Agapito's fourth loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation.  Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template that allows the Field Partners to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Beviana

texts.en:
Beviana G. is a widow who lives in Brgy. Tabagak, Madredijos, Cebu City. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: hog raising, water supply and fishing businesses. She has four children who are aged between 33 and 39. Beviana joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired to something better for her family. 

With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Beviana has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 20th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 which she intends to use to purchase more pigs to raise and rice for her business so that she can continue to save up for her future plans of buying a small piece of land where she intends to put up a sari-sari (general) store. Beviana G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'Honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy additional pigs and rice for her business

loans.name: Tusitukirewamu Nanziga Women's Group-Mpigi

texts.en: N. Winnie is a 40-year-old married woman with six children. Diligence is a virtue to her. In order to put food on her family’s table and manage the  costs of her children’s education, she has made painstaking efforts to oversee her fuel sales business at a local petrol station in Mpigi. Over the last 18 years she has built strength of character through integrity in her operations. Her customers have mostly been commercial motorcyclists. In a week, this happily married mother says she can make as much as 84,000 UGX. With this loan, she will buy more jerrycans of fuel for resale. Winnie belongs to Tusitukirewamu Group, Mpigi.

loans.use: To purchase more jerrycans of fuel for resale

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El señor Jorge O. tiene 60 años de edad, está casado desde hace muchos años con la señora Alicia González de O., tienen hijos ya adultos que viven todos de manera independiente cada uno de ellos con sus respectivas familias. Viven en su propia casa situada en Barrio Santa María Cambyreta.

El señor Jorge y la señora Alicia poseen una amplia propiedad en donde tienen animales, vacas, caballos, gallinas, cerdos, conejos y otros. Ellos se dedican a la venta de leche y huevos, y eventualmente cerdos y gallinas, tienen mucha clientela de la zona a quienes diariamente les distribuyen leche. La señora Alicia es la encargada del cuidado de la casa y de atender a los animales, mientras el señor Jorge es el que se encarga de salir a distribuir la leche todos los días. Gracias a esta actividad ellos pueden mantener su hogar y solventar todos los gastos e imprevistos que se les presente.

Ellos han solicitado este crédito para la compra de más vacas ya que tienen oferta.
texts.en:
Jorge O. is 60 years old and has been married for many years to Alicia González de O..  They have adult children who all live independently with their own families.  They live in their own house located in the Santa María Cambyreta neighborhood.

Jorge and Alicia have a large property where they keep animals: cows, horses, chickens, pigs, rabbits, and others.  They work selling milk and eggs and will eventually sell pigs and chickens.  They have many customers in the area where they sell milk daily.  Alicia is in charge of the housekeeping and caring for the animals and Jorge is in charge of selling milk every day.  Thanks to this activity, they can maintain their home and settle all of their expenses.  

They have asked for this loan to purchase more cows that they have already bid on.

loans.use: Purchase Dutch cows for milk production

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La Señora Maria Elena tiene la edad de 58 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Maria tiene 4 hijos y trabajan de manera independiente. Su actividad económica es el servicio de salón de belleza. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a este negocio ya que por medio de su familia fue que obtuvo este negocio y ahora su interés es seguir con este medio de supervivencia. Ella es una mujer muy luchadora a pesar de la edad que posee, es una mujer que le gusta este tipo renegocio. Sus propósitos para su negocio son de invertir lo suficiente para que mantener a sus clientes ya que es la única que ofrece un buen servicio. Este el motivo por el cual solicita financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo y comprar los productos necesarios para su salón.
texts.en:
María Elena, 58, is married.  She has four children who work independently.  She has had a beauty salon for over 30 years.  She got the business through her family and she wants to continue with this source of support.

She is a very hard working woman despite her age; she likes this type of business.  Her goals for the business is to invest enough in it to keep her customers because she’s the only one providing good service.  This is why she’s asking for a loan which will be used as working capital to buy needed supplies for her salon.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Bayram

texts.en: Bayram I., 23, is a farmer who raises sheep in the Internally Displaced People Settlement. He gained experience from his father who is also a farmer but has decided to have his own farm only a year ago. Now he has 30 sheep and spends all day looking after his herd. It is not easy to look after 30 sheep alone, pasturing them every day and vaccinating and his brother actively helps him in this hard job. Now, Bayram has applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN to buy 10 more sheep.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sheep

loans.name: Claudio Miguel

texts.es: El señor Claudio dedicado al servicio de taxi desde muy temprano inicia su trabajo recorriendo todo el radio periurbano durante toda la jornada, este trabajo lo realiza para otorgar una mejor vida a sus pequeños hijos y a su querida esposa con la que usualmente trabajan por las noches, ella le hace  compañía para mayor seguridad del conductor, ahora desean el crédito para la compra de un motor nuevo que necesita su vehículo, ya que el motor esta presentando fallas y no permite realizar un buen trabajo, y quiere su auto en buen estado ya que estas fiestas de fin de año tendrá mucha clientela, es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo.
texts.en:
Claudio works as a taxi driver.  He starts work very early in the morning and works the whole peri-urban area throughout the whole day.  He is doing this work to provide his small children and his beloved wife with a better life.

Claudio's wife usually works with him at night.  She keeps him company and provides him with more safety as a driver.  He would like this loan to buy a new engine for his vehicle as his current one isn't working properly and doesn't allow him to do his work well.  He would like his car to be in a good state of repair since he will have a lot of customers in this end-of-year festive period.  Claudio is a responsible and very hard-working person.  He is very grateful to the institution for their support.

loans.use: To buy a new engine for his vehicle

loans.name: Ligia Aracely

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

Para la señora Ligia este es su séptimo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y está muy contenta ya que los créditos le han ayudado mucho en su negocio. Tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene  5 hijos, los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, pero dos de ellos aún viven con ella en su casa. Su marido es comerciante.

Tiene un negocio de venta de ropa interior y  camisetas deportivas, ella junto con su esposo atienden su local que tienen en su propia casa, trabajan desde las 8am hasta las 6pm, venden al por mayor a comerciantes de la zona a los cuales les dejan a crédito y a buen precio. La mercadería la adquieren en Guayaquil ciudad a la que viajan una vez al mes y en otros casos solo hacen los pedidos y se los envían, en esta época están vendiendo también juguetes y adornos navideños.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar ropa interior, adornos navideños y juguetes. Sus metas son tener buena salud y comprar un buen carro.
texts.en:
The 3 de Mayo Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo.  This place is known for being a very commercial area, for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo fiestas, and for its happy people.

This is Ligia’s seventh cycle in the communal bank.  She is very happy because the loans have helped her a lot in her business.  She is 55 years old, married, and has five children.  The children are now adults, but two of them still live with her in her house.  Her husband is a merchant.

She has a business selling underwear and sport shirts.  She and her husband take care of the business, which is in their own house.  They work from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  They sell wholesale to merchants in the area.  They sell on credit and give a good price.  They get their merchandise in Guayaquil city, where they travel once a month.  On other occasions they only make orders and have them sent.  

During this season they are also selling Christmas decorations and toys.  She will use this new loan to buy underwear, Christmas decorations, and toys.

 Her goals are to have good health and to buy a good car.

loans.use: To buy underwear, Christmas decorations, and toys

loans.name: Rosa Esther

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y a sus cinco hijos en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical que produce principalmente  frutas como mango, limón y maracuyá. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra situada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino, vacuno, porcino y aves de corral. Ella cría estos animales en algunos corrales que se encuentran ubicados cerca a su domicilio. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Su esposo trabaja como agricultor sembrando arroz y eventualmente trabajando como jornalero en los campos de cultivo de la zona. Juntos se esfuerzan a diario para sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Rosa desea adquirir alimentos y realizar reparaciones en sus corrales para poder mejorar la crianza de sus animales. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los que espera realizar su meta y poder aumentar sus ingresos producto de la venta de sus animales mejor alimentados y criados.
texts.en:
Rosa is 34 years old, married and lives with her husband and five children in the agricultural district of Tambogrande. Tambogrande has a subtropical climate that allows them to grow fruits such as mango, limes and maracuyå. It is located in the Piura region that is located more than four hours from Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.
Rosa raises sheep, vacuñas, pigs and domesticated birds. She raises these animals in corals next to her house. When they have reached a certain level of development she sells them to brokers that always visit the area where she lives. Her husband works as a farmer raising rice and also works as a day laborer on other farms in the area. Together they work daily to help their family move forward.
Rosa would like to buy animal food and repair her corrals in order to improve the growth of her animals. In order to do this she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 new soles. With this loan she hopes to reach her goals of increasing the sales of her animals, as they will be well fed and well raised.

loans.use: She will buy animal food and repair her corals in order to improve her ability to raise her animals.

loans.name: Terisita

texts.en: Terisita is 56 years old and married. She supports her family by operating three business ventures: a general store, videoke and computer games, and raising livestock. She lives in Brgy. Jaguimit, Naga, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 15,600 Philippines pesos (PHP). Terisita is borrowing PHP 25,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Terisita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Yoem Sokyin's Group

texts.en:
This loan group consists of six members, all of whom are located in the Preaek Samraong village in Kandal province. 

The group leader is Mrs. Yoem S.. She was born in 1962 and was selected as leader by the other members. Yoem earns a living by selling rice in the local market. Her business is currently doing well and she would like to expand. Thus, she is requesting a loan to buy more rice to sell. Yoem’s husband, Mr. Hass Soban, is a soldier who receives a small salary to supplement his wife’s income and improve their standard of living. The couple does not have any children.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo F. is from the village of Turod, Quezon, Isabela. He is 46 years old. Bernardo is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Bernardo owns & operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Bernardo has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 25000 PHP per harvest.

In 2011, Bernardo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernardo is requesting a loan of 19000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Bernardo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Kipeitwan

texts.en:
Kipeitwan O. K. is 24 years old and married with one child. He is a farmer who has farmed his own piece of land for the last five years.  

He learned about KADET LTD from the KADET staff. This will be his second loan with which he intends to buy farm inputs. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to improve the living standard and education of his child, as well as for business expansion.

Kipeitwan's dream is to thrive in farming. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime M. is 47 years old. He is currently living in Poblacion Salimpuno with his wife and ten-year-old child. Jaime manages his farm as his means of income. He grows assorted crops to sell in the local community. He was also elected as Barangay Councilor in his community.
In 2011, Jaime joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting his first loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Belgica Nieve

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Valle Verde. Esta localidad se la conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
Z
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Belgica, tiene 46 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 8 hijos, 5 de ellos mayores de edad y tres de 12, 10 y 8 años los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela.
 
Ella tiene un pequeño comedor en San Jacinto frente al mar, en el cual prepara deliciosos platos, su especialidad son los mariscos y el pescado apanado con ensalada y patacones. Trabaja todos los días desde las 06h00 hasta las  17h00 con la ayuda de sus hijos. Nos cuenta que tiene su comedor hace año y medio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado, plátano verde, yuca, mariscos y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 5 ciclos y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos pudo empezar en su negocio y está muy agradecida por esto.

Su meta es sacar a sus pequeños hijos adelante.
texts.en:
The Valle Verde (Green Valley) communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto.  This locality is knows for its traditional culture and for being just a few minutes from two of the province’s best beaches: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

We met Bélgica, 46, here.  She is in a common law relationship and has 8 children.  Five of them are adults and the other three are 12, 10 and 8 years old and go to middle and elementary school.

She has a small eatery at the seashore in San Jacinto where she prepares delicious dishes.  Her specialty is seafood and breaded fish with salad and fried plantain.  She is open for business from 6am until 5pm every day; her children help her.  She tells us that she’s had the eatery for a year and a half and does very well. She will use the loan to buy rice, meat, fish, green plantain, manioc, seafood and other ingredients to prepare her dishes. 

She’s been in the communal bank for 5 cycles and she likes it because thanks to the loans she was able to start her business and she is very grateful for this.  Her goal is to see her younger children get ahead.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish, green plantains, manic, seafood, etc.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en: Emelita M. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 38 years old. Emelita is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Emelita operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling fruits like apples, oranges, guava and mangoes in the local community. Emelita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2009, Emelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Emelita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fruits like watermelons and apples. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Emelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits like watermelons and apples.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 31 years old and is married with two children; 3 and 7 years old. He sells various goods such as lotions, soap, sugar, soft drinks, etc.. He works from 7am to 6pm every day except on Saturday. He has been in this business for 2 years and employs one person to help him. 

Emmanuel has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy more goods such as lotions, soap, sugar, soft drinks, cooking oil, etc. for his business. Emmanuel will be able to earn more profit, which will allow him to reinvest in his business and save for his future.

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as lotions, soap, sugar, soft drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: Alba Luz se dedica al negocio de venta y elaboración de tortillas. Hace más de 15 años que tiene este negocio, lo inicio por su Mama quien anteriormente se hacía cargo del negocio, pues al ver que le generaba ganancias Alba decide establecer su propio negocio ubicado en su vivienda, ella se siente feliz pues la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a comprar las deliciosas tortillas que ofrece. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de leña, comal, bolsas, servilletas, cal, maíz, entre otros productos. Sueña con aumentar su inventario y además proporcionarle mejoras a su lugar de trabajo.
texts.en:
Alba Luz makes and sells tortillas. She has been in this business for more than 15 years; it was started by her Mom who used to be in charge. Alba saw the income that it was generating and decided to establish her own business in her home. She is happy because the majority of her customers come to her to buy the delicious tortillas that she offers.

The purpose of the loan is to buy firewood, a cast-iron skillet, bags, napkins, lime, corn and other things. She dreams of increasing her inventory and making improvements to her work area.

loans.use: to buy firewood, a cast-iron skillet, bags, napkins, lime, corn and other things

loans.name: 4373 Umucyo Group

texts.en:
Immaculee is 36 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 6 and 10 years old. She is the president of a group which called “Umucyo”. Her business is well-organized. she sells charcoal in her market. She has seven years of experience and works from 6 am until 10 pm every day.

Immaculee and her group have requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase more goods like charcoal to sell. With their profits, Immaculee and her group will reinvest in their businesses and to build their own houses.

loans.use: To increase her business for buying more sac of  charcoal.

loans.name: Rosalind

texts.en:
Rosalind has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last three years. She is 52 years old, the single mother of five children. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan. She repaid her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to plant potatoes in her farm, and so she plans to use the loan amount to buy the seeds and fertilizer for planting. 

In future, Rosalind hopes to become a leading farmer in Olkalou area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Basilica Antonia

texts.es: La Señora Basilica Antonia tiene 68 años. Se dedica a la actividad económica de una pulpería. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio ya que por medio de su familia fue que obtuvo este negocio y ahora su interés es seguir con este medio de supervivencia. Basilica es una mujer muy luchadora a pesar de la edad que posee, es una mujer que le gusta este tipo negocio. Sus propósitos para su negocio son de invertir lo suficiente para que mantener a sus clientes ya que es la única que posee pulpería bien surtida. Este el motivo por el cual solicita financiamiento destinado para comprar golosinas, pan, refrescos naturales, gaseosas, granos básicos, enlatados y papel higiénico.
texts.en:
Basilica Antonia is 68 years old, and she has a grocery store.  She has devoted herself to this business for over nine years.  She got this business through her family.  Now she is interested in continuing with this way of making a living.

Basilica is a very tenacious woman despite her age.  She is a woman who likes this type of business.  Her intention for the business is to invest enough to keep her customers because she is the only one that has a well-stocked grocery store.

That is why she is requesting a loan to buy sweets, natural soft drinks, basic grains, canned goods, and toilet paper.

loans.use: to buy sweets, natural soft drinks, basic grains, canned goods, and toilet paper.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 56 years old and lives in Cabunga-an, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of four adult children.

Teofila has a small grocery store at home to earn a living. She sells personal products, assorted food products, dish-washing and laundry soap, food ingredients and seasonings in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years. She earns a total of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 at GDMPC to purchase additional products to sell.

Teofila has been member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Teofila hopes to expand her store and extend her store for entertainment.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Georges

texts.en:
Georges is a 39-year-old single man from Lebanon, living with his parents and two siblings. He has owned a bus for the past four years. During the school year, he transports students from their houses to school and vice versa. And during the summer, he serves customers who ask for private transportation such as mountain trips, picnics etc.

Georges works hard and he is the only income source of the family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform the needed maintenance on his bus to make it safer. In the future, he is planning to purchase a new bus.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his bus to make it safer.

loans.name: Filomera

texts.en: Filomera has six children, four of whom are in school. She is married. She is 28 years old. She has a business selling soda and maize flour in Kator branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years. She will use the profits to build another store for her business

loans.use: to purchase more soda and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Hugo Eduardo

texts.es: El Sr. Hugo es un artesano, que realiza rompecabezas de venesta con motivos infantiles, los comercializa al por mayor, realiza sus entregas sobre todo el la feria de la tablada donde ya tiene clientes que le hacen su pedido cada semana, también en algunas ocasiones viaja a la ciudad de Oruro y Cochabamba (esta empezando a relaizar viajes al interior de pais) el Sr.  Hugo vive solo, hace tiempo se separo de su esposa y tiene una hija a la cual no puede ver por motivos de tiempo, actualmente vive en anticrético, con su hermana y su sobrina, el utilizara el crédito para la compra de una maquina caladora y cortadora  que optimizara su trabajo, ya que actualmente realiza su trabajo con de forma manual con una sierra metálica. Su sueño más grande es darle lo mejor a su hija  ya que es por quien trabaja.
texts.en: Hugo is an artisan who makes jigsaw puzzles for children out of laminated wood. He sells them wholesale, making his deliveries above all at the La Tablada fair, where he already has clients who order from him each week. He also travels occasionally to the cities of Oruro and Cochabamba (he is starting to make trips to the interior of the country). Hugo lives alone; he has been separated from his wife for some time and has a daughter he can't see due to time constraints. Currently, he lives in anticresis (an arrangement in Bolivia where a fixed sum is paid at the start of tenancy instead of monthly rent) with his sister and his niece. He will use the loan to purchase a router that will optimize his work, since currently he does the work manually with a metal knife. His biggest dream is to give the best to his daughter, since she is the one he is working for.

loans.use: to purchase a router

loans.name: Fiorella

texts.es:
Fiorella de 21 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por ser agrícola, ganadería y artesanía.

Fiorella tiene como actividad laboral la confección y venta de prendas de vestir, desde hace un año, su negocio lo tiene en el domicilio de sus padres, cuenta con su propia clientela y también realiza trabajos a pedidos, la competencia en el rubro no es mucha, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus necesidades personales.  También cría y comercializa aves de corral y así obtiene otro ingreso para la casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla de 800 para comprar material y alimento balanceado para sus aves de corral,  así pueda seguir brindando un buen servicio y cumpliendo con los pedidos que le han hecho, lo que le permitirá tener más ganancias para mejorar su calidad de vida.  Fiorella con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo a sabido sacar su negocio adelante,  para seguir ayudando económicamente a sus padres y más adelante realizar estudios para mejorar como costurera.
texts.en:
Fiorella is 21 years old, single, and lives in a house that only has electricity with her parents, located in the Tambogrande district in the department of Piura. This area is known for agriculture, livestock and handcrafts. 

Fiorella has been making and selling clothing since last year. Her business is in her parent’s home. She has her own clients and she also takes work requests. She does not have much competition in this area and the income that she gets covers her personal needs. She also breeds and sells poultry as another source of income.

She is asking for an 800 nuevos soles loan ($300.00) from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy supplies so she can continue providing good service and to complete the orders she has, and for food for her poultry, allowing her to have a higher income in order to provide a better quality of life. 

Fiorella has been able to move her business forward with a lot of work and effort, which has allowed her to continue helping her parents financially and to become a better seamstress.

loans.use: to purchase supplies in order to continue making clothing, and to buy feed for her poultry

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with five school-going children: three girls and two boys. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over 10 years, she has operated a retail shop business selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Mwanasiti dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KSHS 10,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
This is Hazel, 25, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to her husband Ruel, a sales representative, and mother to her only child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Hazel buys and sells demo products. What she basically does is buy products from wholesalers, and then sell them with a profit. She sells products such as  chopper, wonder mop, slicer, cutter, sponge, and juicer. She has a stall in one of the well-known supermarkets in the Philippines. Her regular customers are people inside the mall. She earns a minimum of 600 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

Hazel is requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 that will help as additional capital. She will spend it to buy additional products she needs in her business. The more demo product she has, the better because they will result in more sales. Her profits allow her family to enjoy some comforts in life and secure her child’s future.

Hazel dreams of becoming successful in her business. A harmonious relationship with her husband and a good education for their child is her dream for her family. She never fails to attend to the fellowship* every week as it inspires her to grow more spiritually and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of products she needs in her business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a widow taking care of 7 children.  Ama is a fish monger in Elmina, which she has been doing for some time now. In the photo, she is showing some of the fresh fish she will prepare to be smoked. Ama will use the loan to purchase more fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to reinvest for further growth and to take care of her home.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to smoke for sale.

loans.name: Danit Celia

texts.es:
Danit de 30 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona es agrícola,ganadera y artesana.

Danit desde hace 3 años brinda el servicio de peluquería cuenta con su clientela, los que más acuden  por el servicio son las personas en edad escolar, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar sus gastos personales.  Además sea hecho conocida por lo amable que es y el buen servicio que brinda. También confecciona y vende prendas de vestir,lo que le permite tener otro ingreso para su casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar algunos materiales y para realizar algunas mejoras en su domicilio, al incrementarse su clientela podrá cubrir su crédito y mejorar económicamente.  Danit es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa que lo único que desea es que su negocio crezca para seguir apoyando a su familia y poder brindarles algunos gustos a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Danit is 30 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and children. The only service they receive is electricity. Danit resides in the rural section of the District of Tambogrande, which part of the Department of Piura. This area is known for agriculture, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

For the past three years, Danit has been providing beauty salon services. Most of the customers who are in need of her services are people who are of school age. The income that she generates enables her to cover her personal expenses. In addition, Danit is known for her kindness and the good service that she provides. She also sews and makes clothes as a way of earning additional household income.
