Danit is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN so that she can buy materials in order to make a few improvements to her home. This will help to increase her customer base so that she can repay her loan and improve financially. Danit is a hardworking and committed woman who only wants to grow her business so that she can continue supporting her family and provide some nice things for her children.

loans.use: to buy materials for making a few home improvements.

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Ebenezer Group in Western Kenya! Benson is the facilitator of Ebenezer group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Benson takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Benson had a good maize yield harvesting 7 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Benson was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Benson  and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Benson will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Ebenezer group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es: La Sra. Fabiola vive en la zona del plan 3000 en la casa de su madre. Es madre soltera. La Sra. Fabiola se dedica a la venta de ropa (pantalones jeans para hombres y mujeres, conjunto para niñas y niños, poleras y blusas) las cuales vende a crédito. Es cliente antiguo de emprender era socia  en el banco de emprendimiento las progresivas en cinco ciclos. El crédito que esta solicitando es para aumentar su capital de trabajo, compra de mercadería ropa de temporada para estas fiestas de fin de año ya que tiene muchos pedidos, la Sra. Fabiola además estudia en la universidad y ella misma se solventa con la venta de ropa para pagar sus estudios. Ella es una persona trabajadora que tiene como objetivo terminar sus estudios y de esta manera mejorara la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en: Fabiola lives in Plan 3000 district, in her mother's house.  She is a single mother.  Fabiola's business is selling clothes (pants, men's and women's jeans, children's outfits, t-shirts and blouses).  She sells these products on credit.  Fabiola is a long-standing client of Emprender and was a member of the 'Las Progresivas' community bank for five loan cycles.  The loan that she is requesting will be used to increase her working capital, buying seasonal clothes for the end-of-year holiday season, as she has a lot of orders.  Fabiola also studies at university and she pays for her studies through her clothes sales.  She is a hard-working person whose goal is to finish her studies and thereby improve her whole family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes for the end-of-year holiday season

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien is 28 years old and lives in Cho Town. She is married with two children who are still small.

Lien has a shop where she sells computers. She has had this business for five years and now has a monthly income of about 8,000,000 Vietnam dong (VND). 

Lien joined in Kiva field partner SEDA in 2007 and has already sucessfully taken out and repaid five loans.  The last loan she took out was about the same size as this one.   She plans to use the proceeds of this loan to buy videotapes, DVDs, and CDs to sell at her store.

loans.use: to buy videotapes, DVDs, and CDs to sell

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in Uganda. She is married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past fifteen years, Anna has been working hard to manage her bar which serves drinks and sodas to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Anna has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more crates of beer and soda, and will help Anna to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Anna hopes that in the future she will be able to open another bar. 

Anna is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Anna who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and soda.

loans.name: Muhogo Group

texts.en:
Rajabu, who is in his early 30s, is married and has two children who attend school. He has been running a retail shop for seven years now. He works from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans for household expenses and to restock missing items in the shop. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He hopes for a loan to increase stock of  wheat flour, rice, sugar, beans and backing flour. His dream is to one day become an international businessman.

He will share this loan with his group, "Muhogo", which consists of 17 members who will hold each accountable in repaying their loans.

loans.use: to increase stock of wheat flour, rice, sugar, beans and backing flour

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty, de 36 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de servicial y amable, es conviviente con Kiker quien es mototaxista. Vive en compañía de su pareja y sus hijos de 12 y 5 años de edad, instalados cómodamente en su propia casa. El negocio que tiene Betty es la venta de bebidas gaseosas e hielo en pequeñas barras, para eso cuenta con una refrigeradora la cual compraron con ayuda de su pareja. Y ante la necesidad económica decidio emprender éste negocio. Ahora tiene mucha demanda por el clima caluroso de la zona, continuó a lo largo de estos 6 años que viene funcionando su negocio donde ella sola atiende a sus clientes. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, así como también le permite estar en casa para cuidar y atender a sus hijos a los quiere mucho y desea sacar adelante. Por eso tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y abrir un local de venta de comida en su casa ya que ha visto que es una buena zona para esta venta. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues los considera un grupo unido. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en su negocio, comprando más gaseosas al por mayor para así tener mayor margen de ganancias.
texts.en: Betty is 36 years old and is a hard-working woman who is very helpful and kind.  She lives with her partner, Kiker, who drives a moto-taxi.  They live in their own home with their children who are 12 and 5 years old.  Betty works selling soft drinks and ice in small bars.  She has a refrigerator for this business that she and her husband bought.  A need for more money led them to start this business.  There is now a lot of demand because the climate is very hot.  She has worked alone attending to the customers for six years.  She likes the work because it gives her an income to help her husband with the expenses of the home, and it also lets her be home to care for her children, whom she loves a lot and wishes to help succeed.  For this reason she has plans to expand her business and open a business selling food from her home, because she has seen that she lives in a good area for this type of sales.  This will be her third loan with MFP, and she is hopeful that with their help, she can continue meeting her goals.  She comments that she enjoys her community bank because she considers it to be a united group.  She will invest the requested 2,000 nuevos soles in her business, buying more soft drinks in bulk in order to have a greater profit margin.

loans.use: buy cases of soft drinks in bulk

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Ms Hang is 26 years old and has two children. She and her husband manage a business cooking lunch for workers. Hang started her business two years ago and it creates a stable income with which to manage family life. 
Hang joined the credit program of Kiva partner SEDA in 2010, and she has used her loans to buy kitchen equipment and food for the business. For this new loan, she has requested 7,194,000 Vietnam Dong (VND) for the same purpose.

loans.use: to buy kitchen equipment and food for her business.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a Kiva borrower. He has 1 child. He describes himself to be polite. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business.  He will use the anticipated profits to open another business outlet.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.en:
I have had a small grocery store called Oneyda, in my home for three years, I attend to the store alongside my wife. Our clients are satisfied with the attention with which we help them, and also for our quality products at low prices. Our earnings help us to pay our familial and financial obligations.

Loan Use: Buying milk, bread, eggs, cornflour, sodas, coffee, sugar and other items

Tengo una pequeña pulperia llamada Oneyda en mi casa de habitacion desde hace tres años, esta la atiendo junto a mi esposa. Nuestra clientela se siente satisfecha por la atencion que les brindamos, ademas por los productos de calidad y bajos precios. Los ingresos que percibimos por las ventas nos ayudan a cubrir nuestros compromisos familiares y financieros.

loans.use: Compra de leche, pan, huevos, harina de maiz, refrescos, cafe, azucar y otros

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en: 47-year-old Sahib with his 6 children settled in Sumgait city. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Gubadli region. Since 2001 he has been engaged in meat sales to improve his family’s living condition. As he did not have enough funds, he could not develop his business well enough in the beginning. Sahib needs the loan of $3500. He plans to expand his business and to buy a new ax and scales.

loans.use: He plans to expand his business and to buy a new ax and scales.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam V. is a 47 year-old widow and lives with her eight children (one of whom is pictured here) in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  Her husband recently passed away, leaving the family in a very difficult economic situation.  V. stays at home to watch her three young children and also grows vegetables for the family to eat.  To supplement the family’s income, the other five children all have jobs.  One of her sons is a construction worker, while four of her daughters are garment workers at a nearby factory.  V. hopes to use this loan to repair their house, to protect it from leaking during the rainy season.

loans.use: To repair house to protect it from leaking in the rainy season

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en:
Ramiz is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region , settled in the Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli village. 
This 34-year-old man is married andhas 2 children. He has his own shop where he sells mobile phones. He has run this business for 4 years.
Now he needs a loan of  $1200 to expand his shop.

loans.use: To expand his shop

loans.name: Sorraya

texts.en:
Last year I took out a loan to start a door-to-door garment selling business. I purchase the goods from Faisalabad, the textile mecca of Pakistan, about a two-hour drive from my home city of Lahore. Though the business does well, it does not bring in a regular income because it is only a seasonal venture.

Therefore, I would like to expand my business and work in the summer months as well. I know this plan will work well because my customers keep asking me when I will start selling summer clothes. I am seeking a $350 loan to expand my business.

Sorraya K., Pakistan

loans.use: Expansion of garment business

loans.name: Ni Made Lina Rahayu

texts.id:
Living in Manistutu village (West Bali) made Ni Made Lina Rahayu to channel her hobby as pig farmer. Lina raised a mother pig and a fattening piglet. Lina is persistent in feeding her pigs at 8:00 AM and 4:00 PM, before feeding she bathe her pigs until clean, and also clean their stall. Capital needed by Lina is Rp1,300,000 (about US$143) and expected profit is Rp200,000 (about $22)/month. From that profit Lina could help her husband Gede Juan who works in a workshop. Lina has a young child, 2.5 years old. Lina is working hard, so that she could save for her child's education in the future. Lina's semi permanent home is owned in own land. Daily expenses are Rp25,000 (about US$2.75). Lina's hope is with the expected capital, her profit could increase and her life could be better.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Tinggal di Desa Manistutu ( Bali Barat ) membuat Ni Made Lina Rahayu bisa menyalurkan hobinya sebagi peternak babi . Lina memelihara 1 induk babi dan 1 babi penggemukan . Lina dengan tekun memberi makan babinya pada pagi hari jam 08.00 dan sore hari pukul 16.00 wita, sebelum diberi makan babi-babinya dimandikan sampai bersih dan juga Lina tak lupa membersihkan kandangnya. Modal yang Lina perlukan Rp.1.300.000.- dan keuntungan yang diperoleh Rp. 200.000.- perbulan. Dengan keuntungan yang diperoleh Lina bisa membantu suaminya Gede Juan yang bekerja sebagai bengkel. Lina mempunyai seorang anak yang masih kecil , umurnya 2,5 tahun. Lina dengan semangat bekerja agar bisa menabung untuk pendidikan anaknya kelak. Rumah Lina sudah milik sendiri ditanah sendiri dan bangunannya semi permanen. Biaya yang dibutuhkan untuk kebutuhan sehari-hari sebesar Rp. 25.000.- Harapan Lina dengan modal yang diperoleh keuntungan bisa bertambah dan hidupnya bisa jauh lebih baik.

loans.use:
To buy pig's feed

Membeli pakan ternak babi

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es:
For the past 4 years, Lupe has belonged to the "Las Almendras" communal bank. She lives in the Calleria district, in the department of Ucayali. She is 57 and the mother of 3 children. She was widowed 20 years ago, and for that reason decided to put up a mechanic workshop in her house, in partnership with her son.

In addition to the workshop, she also sells beauty products. She is both mother and father for her family.

With a loan from Manuela Ramos which she will pay back in 5 months, she plans to expand the workshop as well as buy a compressor, a filing machine, and an awning.

Lupe is happy to have 3 wonderful children who support her in her business. She thanks God she has the strength to help her family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lupe pertenece, desde hace 4 años, al Banco Comunal Las Almendras, ella vive en el Jr. Francisco Pizarro 147 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 57 años y es madre de 3 hijos, es viuda desde hace 20 años, por esa razón decidió poner, en sociedad con su hijo, un taller de mecánica en su casa.

En la actualidad cuenta con el taller de mecánica; pero también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. Ella es padre y madre para su hogar.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos el cual será pagado en 5 meses, ampliará el local y también comprará una compresora , un afilador y una carpa.

Lupe está muy contenta de tener a sus 3 hijos buenos, que la apoyan en el negocio y también agradece a Dios el tener mucha fuerza para sacar a su familia adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of machinery.  Purchase of awning.

loans.name: Juliet's Group

texts.en:
Juliet K. wants a loan in order to buy larger quantities of improved seeds for maize and sweet potatoes. This will help her to catch up with the season.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To buy more seeds

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita belongs to a communal bank and lives in Manantay, in the Ucayali region of Peru. She's 45 years old and has three young children. She's married, and her husband is a farmer. She started her banana-selling business with a small loan.

Margarita currently has a sales post for her fruit on the sidewalk in front of her home and has a motorcized rickshaw to help her business. She rises at 5 a.m. to make her way to the port and purchase bananas at wholesale and takes them home to sell to her customers. She spends the afternoons with her children.

With the $425 loan, which she plans to repay in five months, Margarita will purchase various bunches of bananas, green and ripened, but the majority of the money will go toward maintenance on her motorcoach. She is happy because her business is growing by the day thanks to her hard work and constant motivation, her three children. She is very grateful for all the support from Kiva partner Manuela Ramos and its lenders.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Margarita pertenece al banco comunal Nuestra Señora del Carmen, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Roca Fuerte Mz. 32 Lt. 5, del Distrito de Manantay del departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 45 años y es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad, es casada y su esposo es agricultor. Margarita, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles decidió invertir en compra y venta de plátano (fruta). En la actualidad ella cuenta con un puesto de venta de plátano en la vereda de su casa, y un motocarro, el mismo que también le genera ingresos. Se levanta a las 5 a.m. para dirigirse al puerto a comprar plátano al por mayor para así poder llevar a su hogar y venderlos a sus clientes y por las tardes se dedica a sus hijos. Con éste préstamo de S/. 1,200 soels, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, ella comprará varios racimos de plátanos entre verdes y maduros, pero la gran mayoría del préstamo lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su motocarro. Margarita esta feliz porque su negocio crece día a día gracias a todo el esfuerzo y las ganas que le pone y sobre todo por sus tres razones mas importantes que son sus hijos y está muy agradecida a todo el apoyo brindado por Manuela Ramos y a sus promotoras.

loans.use: Purchase bananas to sell and make repairs on motorized rickshaw.

loans.name: Abed El Nasser

texts.en: Abed El Nasser is a 37 year old father of 5. Abed El Nasser lives and works in southern Lebanon, in Saida. He is in the motorcycle business. He offers maintenance services. He needs a loan to buy motorcycle parts to sustain and grow his workshop.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle parts

loans.name: Mohammad Sadiq

texts.en: Mohammad Sadiq lives in district 13 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and he has a tailor shop. He has good experience in his work. He has a big shop with lots of workers, so he needs to complete his stock. For that purpose, he wants to take an individual loan to buy more new machines and expand his business. He is very happy that he can further his business with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more new machines for his tailor shop

loans.name: Khoun

texts.en: Khoun L. is a 37-year-old mother of four. She and her husband, Mom Doung, support their family by fermenting rice to produce Khmer rice wine, a traditional drink that is very popular in Kampong Cham due to its affordability and health-promoting qualities. They supplement their income by raising pigs, earning a total daily income of approximately $2.  Now Khoun L. would like to take out a loan to purchase additional pigs to breed so that she can increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase pigs for breeding

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Abla S. was born in 1958 in Batonou (Lacs prefecture). Currently, she lives in Adétikopé, a village located 15 km from Tsévié, with her two children and two others in her care. Her husband is a merchant and lives in the same place. With his meager income, he has a hard time covering all family expenses, which means that some household expenses are covered by Ms. Abla S.. An energetic and enterprising woman, she supports her family thanks to the income from her grocery shop. She found out how to manager well the previously obtained loans and to repay them appropriately.

Presently, she is requesting a loan for buying sacks of rice and drums of oil, boxes of canned food, and other items in order to bolster her business. And so she will be able participate more in improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame S. Abla est née 1958 à Batonou dans la préfecture des Lacs. Actuellement, elle vit à Adétikopé, un village situé à 15 km de Tsévié avec ses deux (02) enfants et deux (2) autres à charge. Son mari est un commerçant et vit dans la même localité. Avec son maigre revenu, il arrive difficilement à couvrir toutes les charges de la famille, ce qui fait qu’une partie des charges du foyer est prise par Madame S. Abla. Dynamique et entreprenante, elle subvient aux besoins de sa famille grâce aux revenus de sa boutique d’alimentation générale. Elle a su bien gérer les précédents crédits obtenus et les a remboursé convenablement.

A présent, elle sollicite un crédit qui servira à l’achat des sacs de riz et des bidons d’huile, des cartons des boites de conserves et autres pour renforcer son commerce. Ainsi pourra-t-elle participer davantage à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To stock up on food items

loans.name: Magreth N.

texts.en:
hello from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 39 year-old Magreth M..  She is widow who has two children aged 16 and 19. She has one other dependent, who lives with her because he is orphan. In 2005, Magreth established her hair salon business. Magreth has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more  cosmetics and different hair fashions. She thanks you for your support.  


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy more stock cosmetics and different hair fasion.

loans.name: Maja

texts.en:
Maja is a young woman from the town of Doboj. She is 24 years old, single, and working as a nurse at a local hospital to support herself. Her salary is less than US$ 300 a month, and this is not enough to cover all living expenses. Like many people in Bosnia, Maja grows vegetables & fruit that she uses for herself and to sell around her town.

Maja wants to earn some more income selling her vegetables this year, specifically corn, before the season ends. She will be busy planting in the next months and has requested a loan in the amount of 1200 KM (US$ 1,000) to help pay for seeds & other supplies to use for this.

loans.use: To buy seeds & supplies for farming

loans.name: Monica Indira

texts.es:
Monica belongs to the “Esmeralda” (emerald) community bank. She lives in the region and province of San Martin, district of Tarapoto. She sells clothes, phone cards, phone card reloads and phone call services, all from her home located at #374 Sinchi Roca Jr. Her clients are from around the neighborhood or people that need her services.

With the loan of $350 USD (S/.1000) to be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase merchandise such as: pants, polo shirts for women, man and children as well as phone cards, all with the purpose to satisfy her client needs.

Monica is 31 and lives with her mom, she works everyday to get ahead and achieve her goal of having a clothing store downtown.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Mónica pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, vive en la región y provincia San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica ala venta de ropas, venta de tarjetas telefónicas, recargas virtuales y servicio de locutorio en su misma casa Jr. Sinchi Roca Nº 374, a donde diariamente acuden sus clientes que son los moradores de su barrio y personas que requieran de su servicio.

Con el reciente crédito de S/. 1000.00 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprará mercadería como: pantalones, polos para damas, caballeros y niños para que surta su negocio y así satisfacer las exigencias de sus clientes, también comprará tarjetas telefónicas.

La señora Mónica tiene 31 años, vive con su mamá, trabaja todos los días para salir adelante y poder cumplir con su meta que es tener su propio local en el centro para que pueda vender sus prendas de vestir.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and phone cards for sale.

loans.name: Vot

texts.en:
This is the second time Mrs. Vot L. has asked for a loan to improve her business activity. She is a pig breeder in Pres Leu Village in Takeo Province. 

Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy three more pigs for breeding. Additionally, she would use the rest of the loan to buy pig food for her pigs.

 Aside from this business, she is a farmer and grocer. Mrs. Vot L. is a 54-year-old widow with a child who is employed in a garment factory. Her child can earn $87 per month, which it is sill too little income to support the household.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy three more pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Ul

texts.en: Ul C. is 45 years old and lives with her husband and their six children in Kampong Cham.  As a rice farmer, Ul earns less than $1 each day and often has to work extra hard with three of her children to make up for poor weather conditions and the lack of rain.  Inflation has also made it difficult for rice farmers in her area to turn a profit, because the price of fertilizer and rice seeds has increased drastically.  Although her husband works hard as a local teacher and manages a battery recharging business, the price of gas has also hurt his profits and he now earns only $5 each day.  In order to consolodate and improve her husband's battery recharging business, Ul is requesting a loan of $1200, which will be used to replace the motor on their battery recharger.Ul C. was unavailable for a photograph at the time of the interview, so her husband is pictured here above.

loans.use: To replace the motor on a batter recharger.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.en:
Lorenzo is a member of the Solidaridad ("Solidarity") Village Bank.

Lorenzo is 45 years old and married with one son. He works in a metal-working shop located in his home in the 16 de abril Association. He works every day and also makes doors and windows by special order.

Lorenzo needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy a compressor and materials.

Lorenzo dreams that his son will grow up to be a working professional. He would also like to switch businesses and open up a hardware store.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Lorenzo es socio del Banco Comunal Solidaridad.

Lorenzo es casado tiene 45 años y 1 hijo, Lorenzo tiene un taller en su casa ubicado en la Asoc. 16 de abril en donde se dedica a la carpintería metálica, fabrica puertas, ventanas, todos sus trabajos son a pedido, actividad que realiza todos los días.

Lorenzo necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una maquina compresora y materiales.

Lorenzo sueña con que su hijo sea profesional, cambiar de negocio y tener una ferretería.

loans.use: To buy a compressor and materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To restock a small grocery store and increase her income.

loans.name: Yosalin

texts.es: Yosalin tiene 18 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo. Desde muy pequeña ayudó a su madre en la crianza de sus animales, ahora, desde que se casó hace un año tiene sus propios animales, los cuales cuida y engorda para luego venderlos en los mercados, esta actividad le permite solventar los gastos de su casa, pero lo dificultoso es sembrar para el alimento que requieren sus animales, ya que no es fácil cortar los pastos y llevarlos a los corrales de sus animales, sin embargo esta actividad le ayuda a cooperar con su esposo en los gastos familiares, ya que son jóvenes, pero con muchas ganas de prosperar. Yosalin es nueva en MFP, y pretende seguir perteneciendo a este grupo por mucho tiempo, ella se caracteriza como una mujer entusiasta y trabajadora. Con el dinero que solicita comprará un becerrito para incrementar su ganado.
texts.en:
Yosalin is 18 years old, married, lives with her husband and a small son. Since she was little she helped her mother raising animals. Now that she is married she owns her own animals, which she takes care of and fattens to sell at the market. This activity helps her pay for her household expenses. However, the difficulty is dealing with the feed for her animals, since it isn't easy to cut the grasses and transport them to the animal pens. Nevertheless, this activity helps her assist her husband with the family expenses, since they are both young but eager to prosper. Yosalin is new to MFP, and she intends to continue to belong to this group for a very long time. She is enthusiastic and a very good worker. With the money obtained she will buy a small calf to increase her herd.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de un becerro

loans.name: Sieng

texts.en: D., 27, who lives Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, earns a living selling groceries from her house, selling items such as cooked food and sweets for kids. She has had experience in this business for a long time. D. is married and currently takes care of three children, all of whom are single and also attend school, whilst her husband is a local motorcycle taxi driver. D. works hard every day and is very responsible with regard to her family. Currently, the family is suffering from pollution surrounding their house, which is harmful to their health. Therefore, Mrs. D. is requesting a loan to purchase another piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase another piece of land

loans.name: Ela

texts.es: Ela de 33 años es una mujer soltera, que se dedica mucho al trabajo, vive en un cuarto alquilado, el cual ocupó cuando salió de la casa de sus padres para hacerse independiente, tiene muchas ganas de superarse y está dispuesta a lograrlo. Ela incursionó en el negocio de la venta de leña hace 10 años, con el pasar del tiempo su negocio ha ido en ascenso hasta convertirse en una de las vendedoras más solicitadas, vende en el cuarto que alquiló, hasta donde llegan sus clientes para comprar la leña de buena calidad que ofrece. Ella disfruta de ordenar la leña en pequeñas torres y hacer más presentable su negocio, tiene pensado alquilar una tienda más céntrica donde pueda almacenar su leña, ya que actualmente la tiene en la calle, donde cada vez que cae la lluvia se mojan y se hacen más difícil venderlas. Ela quiere formar una familia, pero sabe que antes debe tener una economía estable, para vivir tranquila y darle lo mejor de ella. Son ya 2 préstamos a los que a accedido en MFP y es muy puntual en sus pagos, siempre está pendiente de no atrasarse, en su banco comunal es muy alegre y le gusta conversar con el resto de las socias. Ela invertirá el dinero solicitado en incrementar su capital de trabajo, para así poder comprar más leña.
texts.en:
Ela is 33 years old, single and very dedicated to her work. She lives in a room she rented when she left her parents’ home in order to become more independent. She really wants to overcome her obstacles and she is ready to do it. Ten years ago she entered into the business of selling firewood. As time passed, her business has grown and she has become one of the most sought-after sellers. Her customers come to her home to buy the good-quality wood that she offers. She likes to organize the wood into small stacks to make her business more presentable. She is thinking of renting a storefront that is more centrally located to store her wood in. Right now she has to leave it on the street and every time it rains, the wood gets wet , which makes it more difficult to sell. She would like to start a family, but knows that she should have a stable financial situation first, so she can live in peace and give her family the best. She has already had two loans with MFP and was very punctual with her payments, always making sure not to get behind, Ela is very happy with her community bank and likes talking with the other members. She will invest this money by purchasing more firewood and increasing her work capital.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: firewood

loans.name: Spola

texts.en:
Spola has owned a small food vendor store in the Kihesa neighborhood of Dodoma for 10 years. She belongs to Mkibizi "A" east group loan (Group code 2015). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 90. Every day she works for 12 hours at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Spola is 58 years old, married, and has seven children: ages 40, 39, 34, 32, 31, 30 and 20. She also cares for six additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
ALFONSO es artesano en cuero y cuerina, tiene un taller donde realiza calzados para cholitas mismo que son comercializados por la esposa  por docenas en las ferias populares de la ciudad de El Alto, es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus tres pequeños hijos; viven en alquiler ubicado en la zona Villa Ingenio de la Ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito lo destinara para la compra de materia prima (Cuero) para incrementar su producción y subir sus ingresos familiares. 
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por ALFONSO
texts.en:
ALFONSO is an artisan in leather and faux leather. He has a studio where he makes footwear for "cholitas" (members of a Bolivian social and political indigenous movement), which are sold by his wife in dozens of the popular fairs in the city of El Alto. This is his principal source of income with which he supports his three small children. They live in a rental located in the Villa Ingenio area of the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase the raw material (Leather) to increase production and to increase his family's income. This is the first loan Impro, the evaluation conducted allows the approval of the loan requested by ALFONSO.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE OF RAW MATERIALS

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.en:
Mrs. Leoncia A. is a member of HSPFI. She is 52 years old and currently resides in Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City, Northern Mindanao, Philippines. With HSPFI's assistance, she was granted a loan of PHP 5,000. Leoncia used it to finance her food vending business. Together with her daughters, they manage her business well and right now she is building a food stall of her own.

Leoncia has one hectare of land that needs to be cultivated. She wants to cultivate this land and plant it with cassava and corn. She is in need of PHP 8,000 to finance the cultivation of her land and to buy cassava sticks, corn seeds, and fertilizers. Leoncia is already a widow and is now the one providing for the needs of her four children.

loans.use: To buy cassava stalks, corn seeds, and fertilizers for her farm.

location.town: Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La Señora Graciela de 43 años de edad es separada y vive con su hija Mirta de 20 años de edad.
 
Doña Graciela se hace 7 años decidió emprender su propio negocio de ventas de mercaderías varias.  Ella sale a vender sus mercaderías por el interior del país. Ya cuenta con una  clientela bien formada gracias a la buena atención que les da.

Como sueño personal desea ampliar su negocio y así poder ofrecer más variedades de productos a sus clientes. 

La clienta solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías para su posterior venta.
texts.en:
Graciela is 43, and she is separated. She lives with her 20 year old daughter, Mirta. For 7 years she has had her own business of selling varied merchandise. She goes to the interior of the country to sell her merchandise. She has a good customer base thanks to the good service she gives her customers. Her personal dream is to expand her business to be able to offer her customers a better variety of products. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise to later sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy brand name footwear to sell

loans.name: Zahra Group

texts.en:
Zahra is the group leader of Zahra group which has four members. Each of them wants to take a loan for expanding his or her business.

Zahra wants to take a loan for her tailoring business.

Jameila wants to take a loan for her husband who has a shoe shop.

Faruema wants to take a loan for her beauty salon.

Muhammad Harf wants to take a loan for his dry-fruit shop.

They are requested a group loan 56,000 Afghani. And they are made happy by this process of loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expanding her tailoring business

loans.name: Artemio

texts.es: Artemio tiene años 55 años, vive sólo con su esposa, ya que sus hijos son independientes. Desde hace 5 años que se viene dedicando a la venta de zapatos, iniciándose en este negocio motivado por un amigo que se dedicaba a viajar a otras ciudades y traer los zapatos para distribuir en los mercados de su localidad. Entonces Artemio se animó a trabajar así, resultándole un negocio muy rentable; pero no todo resulto bien, ya que este socio, pasado un tiempo, lo defraudó llevándose gran parte de las ganancias. Artemio no se amilanó y siguió adelante, convirtiéndose ahora en un próspero comerciante de zapatos, lo cual le gusta mucho y ha adquirido mucha experiencia, además su poder de convencimiento logra que la clientela sea muy asidua a su puesto. Su deseo es hacer crecer su negocio y espera pronto tener una gran tienda donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad, puesto que vender a la intemperie ocasiona que sus zapatos se empolven y no se vean atractivos. Este es su tercer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y está muy contento con su grupo, ya que todas sus compañeras son muy amigables y divertidas, pero sobre todo muy puntuales con sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado planea viajar a la ciudad de Trujillo, conocida por elaboración de zapatos novedosos y de muy buena calidad, abasteciéndose de una gran cantidad para incrementar el stock de su puesto.
texts.en:
Artemio is 55 years old, and lives alone with his wife, now that his children are independent. For 5 years he has been dedicated to the sale of shoes, motivated to initiate this business by a friend who used to travel to other cities and bring back shoes to distribute in the markets in their area. So, Artemio fancied working like this, resulting in a very profitable business. But, everything didn't work out well, as this associate, a while ago, defrauded him, taking a large part of the profits. Artemio wasn't daunted by this and continued moving forward, converting it into a prosperous shoe business, which he likes very much and has acquired much experience in, and also with his conviction has been able to attract an asiduous clientele to his stand. His wish is to grow his business and he hopes to soon have a large shop where he can sell with greater comfort, as his stand where he sells now, when there is occasional bad weather, means his shoes become powdery and don't look attractive. This is his third loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and now he is very content with his group, as all his companions are very friendly and fun, but above all, very punctual with their payments. With the money he is soliciting he plans to travel to the city of Trujillo, known for its innovative and excellent quality shoe production, supplying himself with a large quantity to increase the stock of his stand.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Glory

texts.en: Glory is 39 years old and is married with one child. She sells sarongs of various colors. She hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Alfredo R. le está haciendo falta los acabados del baño pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar los accesorios y el vitropiso.
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder terminar el baño que esta construyendo. 
Planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos que genera de su trabaja como chofer de una camión de carga.
texts.en:
The bathroom in Alfredo R.’ house is not finished. At this time he does not have the money to be able to pay for the accessories and the tile floor. That is why he is asking for a loan to be able to finish the bathroom that he is building. He plans to repay the loan with the income generated from his work as a truck driver.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish bathroom construction

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 21-year-old father of one, living and operating his music and movie store as well as a fruit and vegetable stand in the Mukuru slums. He also works as a pastor in a local church. He is asking for a loan of Ks. 20,000 to add to his inventory of music and movie CDs. He hopes that he will raise a successful family and offer quality education to his children. He describes himself as hard-working and also a leader.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Increase stock of music and movie CDs

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 33 years old and married to Marcelo. The couple manages their small businesses, which are farming and hog raising. Her husband manages their small farm while she manages their hogs. They live in the village of San Jose in Santiago City, Isabela. Lack of capital made her decide to borrow a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 5,000. She will use the loan to purchase feed for her hogs. 

Leticia is the mother of two children. The eldest is currently in college while the youngest is in the primary level. She hopes to provide the best education for her children, which is why she keeps doing what is best for her business.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her hogs

loans.name: Ankhtuya

texts.en: Ankhtuya is 35 years-old and lives with her husband and 13 year-old daughter in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. Her daughter currently attends a local secondary school and her husband works as a driver. Ankhtuya has a small dairy product trading business that she operates out of a rented stall at the local market in her town. She obtains her products by traveling to the countryside and buying from local herders. Ankhtuya started her dairy product trading business in 1996 with an investment of 50,000 tugrugs (~34 USD). Due to her hard work, friendly nature and good customer service, the business has been growing steadily and she has established a good reputation in her community. Today, her working capital exceeds 300,000 tugrugs (~200 USD). Ankhtuya hopes to use future profits from the business to save for her daughter's education. She is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~340 USD) loan to purchase more supplies for her dairy trade business

loans.use: to purchase more supplies for her dairy trade business

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 28-year-old married man and have one baby child. He has owned a maintenance shop since 2006 in his town. Today, Mohamad is applying for a loan of $1,200 in order to renovate his tools instead of the old ones to be updated and satisfy the need of the market.

loans.use: to renovate his tools

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es: María Auxiliadora de 47 años hace 15 años creó una pequeña pulpería que en un comienzo vendía solo chucherías pero con el tiempo ha invertido en otros productos. Actualmente vende granos básicos, productos para el hogar y medicamentos de uso común como antigripales, acetaminofe. Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de productos para el hogar.

loans.use: para comprar granos basicos, dulces y chiverias entre otros productos

loans.name: Orif

texts.en:
R. Orif is 47 years-old and married with three children. For the last 15 years, Orif has been providing transport services. As a rule he is working in his region only. At the same time, together with the help of his wife and children, he raises cattle at his house which gives additional income to his family. Currently Orif’s truck needs repairs and he is asking for a loan of $1,500 US. Orif promises to pay the loan on time and thanks everyone for their support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve agricultural production and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Truck repair.

loans.name: Hacia Adelante 4-6 Group

texts.en:
Luis, 53, is a borrower who lives near San Pedro D. Macorís, Dominican Republic. Luis is the coordinator for his group, Hacia Adelante (Onward), and his story is representative of the other borrowers in the group. Luis and the other borrowers in Hacia Adelante live in Boca Chica, a small town between San Pedro and Santo Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic. Boca Chica lacks potable drinking water, has unreliable electricity, and suffers from pollution because of its location between two large cities.

Despite these difficulties, Luis operates a colmado, which is a small corner store that sells anything from bread to batteries. Luis focuses on foods in his colmado, specifically those typical of the Dominican cuisine: rice, beans, meat, flour, oil, fruits and juices. He will use this loan to purchase more of these products to sell to his customers. Luis is a single father with two children living at home, where he both lives and runs his colmado. He has successfully repaid two loans with Esperanza International, and he is excited to be taking out his third. He looks forward to continuing the development and improvement of his colmado, and he was very steadfast in expressing his good experiences with Esperanza. Thank you for lending to Luis and the Hacia Adelante group!

loans.use: Rice, beans, meat, and drinks

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is a 35-year-old married woman with four children between the ages of four and 12 years.  All of her children go to school. 

She rents a three room house where she is staying with five people. Prossy takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water and gets three meals a day. 

She incurs transportation costs to and from shopping in Kikuubo, one of the busiest markets in the city of Kampala.  She works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. 

Prossy works seven days a week. She has a ladies salon in Kibuye on Kampala-Entebbe Highway. She receives an average of seven customers a day and works on all categories of people.  She also sells creams at retail price to any customer. Her major business challenges are thieves and the ever-increasing prices of hair conditioners and hair extensions. She has been in this business for over seven years and with MCDT for eight years and is servicing her twentieth loan. 

In addition to a banana business, she also sells beer at her home. 

Prossy joined MCDT because it was near her home and it was easy to work with.  She wants to use this loan to buy more hair extensions and conditioners.

loans.use: To buy more hair conditioners and extensions (weaves,braids)

loans.name: Khoeurn's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Khoeurn S. is a group leader of four members who all live in Krang Sbaek village in Takeo province. She is a salt middleman. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more salt to resell and earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Pang Phoeun, is a farmer who owns a 2-hectar field of land to cultivate rice. This couple do not have any children yet. Mrs. Chhroek Khan, is a group member and she also presented in the group loan.

loans.use: By purchasing more salt to resell to earn more income.

loans.name: Samalaulu

texts.en:
Samalaulu F. is 38 and married with 5 children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  Samalaulu has 6 years of experience in this business.  Samalaulu needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Samalaulu joined SPBD.    This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Samalaulu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Samalaulu F. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.4 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.8 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is thirty–eight years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to one child who is currently in school. She lives with her husband and child in a rented apartment in a commercial community. 

Mary is a trader. She trades in tomatoes, procuring them from nearby farming communities and supplying them to food vendors and retailers in her community. Mary sometimes treks to other towns to sell. She has been in business for twenty years and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Estela Benita

texts.es: Estela tiene 51 años, este no es el primer financiamiento que solicita a Fundación, por lo que es una excelente cliente. Su actividad económica es una pulpería, la necesidad de emprender su propio negocio fue la razón por la ella dio inicio a este humilde negocio que ahora es su medio de vida, y la necesidad de proporcionarle a sus 3 hijos lo necesario así fue que ella pudo sacar adelante sus hijos que actualmente trabajan de manera independiente. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de azúcar, jabón, detergentes, leche, jugos y refrescos naturales, a pesar de que tiene que levantarse muy temprano para ir al mercado para realizar las compras y recorrer los diferentes establecimientos donde le ofrezcan los productos más baratos siempre sonríe con mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Estela is 51 years old; this is by no means her first loan from the Foundation and she has been an excellent customer with her previous loans. She runs a small store which is her sole source of income. She was able to use her income from the store to provide for her 3 children who now are grown and work on their own. The loan is for working capital to purchase sugar, soap, detergent, milk, juice, and drinks. In spite of having to get up very early to go to the market to purchase her goods and running from store to store to get the cheapest items, she is always smiling as she works hard to improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Vicenta Ferminia

texts.es: La señora Vicenta Fermina T. T. cuenta con 20 años, casada, viven con su familia materna, en la actualidad ella tiene el oficio de Costurera “Costurar delantales Típicos” se acerco a la asociación ASDIR para  un pequeño préstamo para poder comprar más materia prima, ya que los encargos que se le hace  requiere de más materia prima para poder cubrir la demanda de su producto, brindándole esta pequeña ayuda ella podrá mejorar su producción, como también mejorará sus ingresos y así  podrá mejorar la  condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Vicenta Fermina T. T. is 20, married, lives with her mom's side of the family, she currently works as a seamstress making "typical aprons". She approached the ASDIR association for a small loan to be able to buy more materials, because the orders that are made require more material to be able to meet the demand of her product, with this small loan she will be able to increase production, as well as have better income and be able to improve her family's life.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to make aprons

loans.name: Maria De Cristo

texts.es:
La Sra. María P. vende huevos y ropa usada en su casa que está ubicada en el municipio del viejo.  
Ella va a usar el crédito para comprar varias cajillas de huevo y ropa usada y nueva para vender. 
Ella comenzó su negocio cuando la jubilaron de la escuela donde trabajaba, fue ahí entonces cuando puso su pequeño negocio en su casa. 
Ella vive sola ya que su marido falleció hace ya varios años e hijos nunca tuvo. 
Ella dice estar muy agradecida con CEPRODEL, por todo el tiempo que la ha ayudado a salir adelante y seguir luchando con su negocio.
texts.en:
María P. sells eggs and used clothing from her home, which is located in El Viejo. She will use the funds to buy several cases of eggs and new and used clothing to sell. She began this work when she was retired from the school she worked at; that was when she set up a small store in her home. She lives alone because her husband died several years ago and she never had any children. She says that she is very grateful to CEPRODEL because it has always helped her to get ahead and to continue struggling with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy eggs and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Mrs. P. and her husband are in the picture. P., 22, is an internal staff member in a Hotel, earning a salary $120 a month. In addition, her husband works as a security guard for a small firm. This couple has a young child who is enrolled in the public primary school. P. finds it difficult to get to her work location, because she has no vehicle. Because of this problem, P. requested a loan in order to purchase a motorcycle for commuting to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commuting to work.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila B. is from the village of Barina-ut, Iligan City. She is 46 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Leonila owns and operates a specialized retail business, selling a variety of dried seafood products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Leonila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Leonila plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

location.town: Barina-ut, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
don Daniel G. es una persona emprendedora,  se dedica a la venta de pan blanco y dulce en diferentes barrios y colonias de la ciudad de Choluteca. 
es padre de 3 hijos, el hace el trabajo de padre y madre ya que el solo esta al cuidado de sus hijos, los tiene en la escuela. es por lo cual Daniel trabaja duro para sacar adelante  a sus hijos y darle lo necesario.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas pan ya que su recorrido ahora es mas grande y a veces se queda sin producto antes de terminar sus ventas diarias.
texts.en:
Mr. Daniel G. is an entrepreneur, and he sells white and sweet bread in different neighborhoods and sections in the city of Choluteca. He is a father of three children, and he does the work of both mother and father as his in solely responsible for the children's care. He has them in school, and it is for this reason that Daniel works hard to raise his children and give them what they need. He will use the loan to buy more bread now that his route is larger, and at time he's run out of bread before finishing his daily sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase white and sweet bread

loans.name: Alou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Alou Diakité est un homme marié de 25 ans et père de 1 enfant qui vit avec sa femme et son enfant dans une famille élargie à Ouelessebougou (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Il a abandonné l’école pour des raisons sociales et très tôt  s’intéressa  aux  activités génératrices de revenus notamment  à l’achat et à la vente d’appareils électroniques.
 Avec plus  de 5 ans d’expériences, Monsieur Alou Diakité maîtrise son activité dans laquelle il est très sollicité et apprécié.
Dans le souci d’étoffer son fonds de roulement, il décide de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Il  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des appareils électroniques  à Bamako (capitale de république du Mali) et effectue sa vente à Ouelessebougou  à une clientèle composée de toutes les catégories sociales.
 Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000 FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice il envisage agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Alou Diakité is a 25-year-old married man, the father of one child. He lives with his wife and child in an extended family in Ouelessebougou (second administrative region in the Republic of Mali). He left school for social reasons and very early on became interested in income-generating activities, notably buying and selling electronic equipment. With more than five years of experience, Mr. Alou Diakité is proficient in his business and is very much in demand and appreciated. In order to increase his working capital, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso, with whom he is on his first individual loan. He plans to use his loan to buy electronic equipment in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). He sells in Ouelessebougou to customers from all social categories. With this loan, he plans to make a monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA. He would like to expand his business with these profits.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purcahse of electronic equipment

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 38 years old. He is married and has four children aged between 3½ and 19 years, all of whom are currently attending school.

Henry is a farmer in Eastern Kenya near Nkubu town. He has been farming for twenty-five years and he sells his bananas to the middlemen/brokers who later sell them to the local market. He also earns income from his current employment as a mason. His main challenges in farming are diseases which affects his farm produce.

Henry successfully completed his first loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES 20,000 which he used to start a poultry project. He has requested this new loan from Juhudi for KES 36,400 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income generated from this loan will assist him in educating his children.

Henry intends to expand his dairy farming by buying more cows and constructing a bigger zero-grazing shed (raising improved breeds of livestock under confined conditions in order to make better use of limited land area, feed and organic resources). He also plans to venture into a taxi business.

Henry says "Juhudi Kilimo loans are helping people to view farming as a business".

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Kadidiatou

texts.fr: Kadiatou BÂ est une femme de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINTHIANG COUNDARA depuis le 25 avril 2008, elle a été 4 fois de suite bénéficiaire de crédit et n’a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle est vendeuse de fruits, elle s’approvisionne hebdomadairement dans les marchés et fait du porte à porte dans le village pour revendre. Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité afin de prétendre à des bénéfices qui contribueront à la prise en charge des besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Kadiatou BÂ is 42 years old, married and the mother of five children, all under her care. She has been a member of the SINTHIANG COUNDARA « Banc Villageois » loan group since 25 April 2008, has been granted four successive loans, and has had no problems reimbursing them. She is a fruit vendor, gets her supplies from weekly markets, then resells door-to-door in the village. Her new loan will enable her to strengthen her activity and envision earnings she will use to help manage family needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her working capital and her level of activity

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 36-year-old mother of four children. As a single mother, she is responsible for the welfare of her children because she is the breadwinner for her family. Juliet sells used clothing in the market in Fort Portal, Uganda. Besides clothing sales, Juliet also has a beauty salon which enables her to supplement her income so as to make ends meet. 

Juliet says in her clothing business, she faces a challenge of transportation of her purchases which sometimes delays her expected time of selling to clients. She hopes to have every clothing material in future so as to be able to serve a wide variety of customers' needs. This is her fourth loan from HOFOKAM and she intends to purchase second-hand clothing for resale and a dryer and chairs for her beauty salon.

loans.use: purchasing second-hand clothing for resale and a dryer and chairs for her salon

loans.name: Florita

texts.en: Florita A. is from the village of Lower Tambo, Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 37 years old and is married with five adult children. Florita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-one years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Florita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Kubra's Group

texts.en:
Kubra lives in the city of Borewala in Punjab Pakistan. She is a very vigorous woman who works as a housewife and mother of two sons and two daughters. All of the children attend the local school in Borewala. She and her husband both want to give their children a better future so they spend their life without any difficulty.  

Kubra’s husband S. M. is in the animal selling business. He purchases young cows and goats, raises them, and sells them for a good profit. He has loyal customers because of his deep knowledge of animal breeding which was passed on from his father who was also in the same trade.  He has been in this field for over ten years.

Kubra has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband so he can buy more cows and goats to sell.  Kubra is hopeful that this investment will prove beneficial for her husband and he will be able to do very well with it.

loans.use: To purchase animals to raise and sell.

loans.name: Azizbuvu's Group

texts.en:
Azizbuvu H. is the leader of this group. She is 38 and married. She has three children, who are all in school.  Her older daughter is 16, and helps her parents by selling fruits at the market.  Azizbuvu takes orders and sews national cloth and dressmaking supplies.  Her husband works as a constructor.  Azizbuvu started this business ten years ago with the initial investment of 2000 soms and now she makes 6000 soms per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase fabrics and materials to sew.  In the future, she wants to expand her business, open a sewing workshop and save money to be able to give her children good education. 
Rahimahan M., 47, is married. She has four children. Her older daughter helps her mom to sell fruits and materials on the market, and her other children are in school. Two year ago Rahimahan’s mother-in-law gave her a sewing machine as a present, and since that moment, Rahimahan has sewn clothes and sells them on the market. In this way, she earns 8000 soms per month.  With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase fabrics and materials, as well as fruits and vegetables in order to increase the turnover of her businesses.
Sherali A., 23, is married.  He has a three-year-old child, and his wife stays at home to take care of him.  In order to make money, Sherali sells fruits and vegetables on the market. He has been doing this for five years. In this way he earns 5000 soms per month. With money received from the loan he wants to purchase fruits and vegetables, in order to resell them at a higher price. In the future, he wants to purchase a new house to live in with his family.
Cholponoi I. is the treasurer of the group. She is 39 and married. She has two children, both of whom are at school. Cholponoi is engaged in cattle breeding and her husband works in the police department.  She applied for this loan because she wants to increase the number of cattle and needs money to purchase a bull.
 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials, fruits and vegetables, and a bull

loans.name: Valens

texts.en:
Valens is 37 years old and married with four children who are 1, 4, 7 and 9 years old.  Valens owns a shop where he sells a variety of goods and he has been in this business for a long time.  The business hours are from 6 am to 6 pm every day.

Valens needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a.  With this loan, he will purchase a variety of goods including foodstuffs.  With this additional business, Valens will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow him to keep reinvesting for better financial stability in his future business and to improve the living style of his family.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of goods including foodstuffs

loans.name: Jovito

texts.en:
Jovito S. Sr., from the village of Baresbes Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya, is 55 years old, married, and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Jovito owns and operates a transportation business providing motorcycle transport to local community members. Engaged in his business for over nine years, he earns approximately 4500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jovito joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid his previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase equipment to improve the business, he is now requesting a new loan, his second, of 6000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Jovito plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Jean Nepo

texts.en:
Jean Nepo is 24 years old and is married with one child. He is well-known in the business of providing motorcycle transport and this is his fourth successful year in this business.

Although Jean Nepo has been in this business for about four years, his profits are still too low to provide all the basic needs of his family. To solve this problem, he needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase another motorcycle. This will increase his income and, in addition to that, he will create one more job for one of his community members.

loans.use: To purchase an additional motorcycle

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean C. is currently in the business of selling soap, sugar, bags of rice etc. in her retail shop. She is requesting a loan to stock more goods to sell in her shop. Jean is 39 years old and married to a staff member of an NGO. She has four children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more goods

loans.name: Meribeht

texts.es: Meribeht, de 22 años, vive en compañía de su esposo Henry de 33 años, que es comerciante,  y de sus 2 menores hijos, juntos cada día se esfuerzan por salir adelante en busca del progreso. Desde hace 2 años, empezó con el negocio de venta de relojes, accesorios para mujer y adornos para el hogar. Al principio no fue fácil porque sola buscaba a sus compradores, pero en la actualidad solo trae pedidos a sus clientes, les deja en sus casas o negocios y les brinda su mercadería a crédito, es por esta razón que obtiene regulares ganancias ya que ofrece a mayor precio del real. Esta muy satisfecha pues es un trabajo tranquilo que le permite continuar con las labores del hogar y no descuidar la crianza de sus hijos; lo que no le gusta es cuando sus clientes se atrasen en pagar en la fecha que quedaron y eso le genera atrasos en los pagos. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un negocio propio en algún mercado de la ciudad, pues quiere trabajar más estable. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete cumplir con sus pagos puntualmente, ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando, además esta muy satisfecha con el desempeño de los integrantes de su grupo pues son muy responsables y solidarios. Meribeht tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería, pues tiene varios pedidos por cumplir y quiere obtener mejores ganancias para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Maribeht, 22, lives with her husband, Henry, 33, who is a merchant, and their two minor children.  They struggle daily together to get ahead seeking progress.  Two years ago she started selling watches, women’s accessories and home decorations.

At the beginning it wasn’t easy because she would seek customers by herself but currently she fills orders for customers that she delivers to their homes or work places and that she sells on credit.  This is how she earns steady profits because she sells slightly higher than the real price.  She is very satisfied because it’s calm work that allows her to continue with her household chores and not neglect her children’s care.  What she dislikes is when customers lag behind in their payments.

Because she’s an enterprising woman she plans for the future to set up her own store in one of the city markets because she wants a more stable work environment.

This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to repay on time because she does not want to disappoint the people who made the loan possible that will allow her to continue working.  Besides, she is very satisfied with the work of her fellow group members because they are very responsible and mutually supportive.
