Maribeht plans to use the loan to buy larger amounts of merchandise because she has several pending order to fill and wants to obtain better profits to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like decorations and articles for the home.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es: Juan Bautista tiene 62 años, es un hombre casado. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de transporte  la cual surge como una nueva fuente de ingreso para su familia. Este le ha permitido mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y brindarle ingresos a su familia por, lo que tiene una ruta destinada en donde sus diferentes clientes disfrutan de su servicio. Y es por esto que solicita a Fundación León 2000 un financiamiento de manera que le permita comprar llantas, repuestos y otras reparaciones necesarias. Los deseos de Juan son aumentar sus ventas y mantener el núcleo familiar estable en todos los ámbitos.
texts.en: Juan Bautista is 62 years old.  He is a married man.  His business activity is providing transport services which is a new source of income for his family.  This has enabled him to improve his quality of life a little and provide his family with income.  He has a designated route where his customers enjoy his service.  He is requesting a loan from Fundación León 2000 to buy tires, spare parts and other necessary repairs.  Juan's wishes are to increase his sales and keep his family unit stable.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph N.  is a farmer residing in Murang’a in Central  Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years. He produces bananas, milk and cereals which he sells to the local market.

He has requested this loan of KES 60,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. He hopes to improve his dairy farming and buy 3 more dairy cows, producing at least 80 litres of milk per day. This loan will generate extra income for his household. His main challenge is unstable prices for the milk

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Bertrand

texts.fr:
Niveau universitaire, âgé de 29ans célibataire avec 1 enfant, ce  jeune homme a développé l’activité de vente des cartes prépayées et cabine téléphonique.
Il a commencé en 2006 avec un capital de 90.000f, après le premier prêt, il a renforcé avec l’achat des cartes Sim et cartes téléphoniques.

Ses ventes sont passées de 50.000f à75.000f jour. Le deuxième prêt va   lui permettre de s’abonner  aux différents réseaux nationaux tels que MTN, AIRTEL, WARID, AZUR, CONGO TELECOM.
Il  compte ouvrir une cabine plus moderne avec papeteries  et ventes des articles scolaires.
 Très ambitieux, il veut prendre soin de sa famille en améliorant leurs  conditions.
texts.en:
This single man with a university degree is 29 years old and has one child.  He has developed a business selling prepaid cards from his telephone kiosk.  He began in 2006 with a working capital of 90,000 francs.  After getting a first loan, he expanded with the purchase of SIM and phone cards.
His sales increased from 50,000 to 75,000 francs per day. The second loan will enable him to subscribe to the different national networks such as MTN, AIRTEL, WARID, AZUR, and CONGO TELECOM.  He plans to open a more modern kiosk with stationary and school supplies for sale.  He is a very ambitious man who wants to take care of his family while improving their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase rechargeable telephone cards

loans.name: Ramona Verónica

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres De Riobamba.

La señora Ramona tiene 40 años de edad,  está divorciada  y fruto de esa relación tiene dos hijas de 23 y 18 años, ambas estudian en la Universidad y viven con ella. Está en el Banco Comunal  hace cuatro ciclos y le agrada por sus facilidades de pago.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa. Trabaja cuatro días en la semana tres horas por dia, ella deja a  crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días, lo que más vende es ropa para damas.  Su mercadería  la compra en  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite.

Este crédito es para comprar  pantalones, camisetas, blusas, pero en especial ropa de mujer. Sus sueños tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the Mujeres De Riobamba Community Bank meet in Portoviejo, which has been known as the city of Royal Tamarinds since colonial times. 

Ramona is 40 years old and divorced. She has two daughters from this relationship who are 23 and 18 years of age. They both study at university and live with Ramona. Ramona has been with the Community Bank for four loan cycles and she is happy with the loan terms they offer. 

Ramona sells all types of clothing both from her house and door-to-door. She works for three hours a day, four days a week, selling clothes on credit to her customers and collecting the repayments each fortnight. She mostly sells women clothing which she purchases with the rest of her merchandise in Guayaquil on a fortnightly or monthly basis, depending on what she needs. 

Ramona will use this loan to purchase pants, t-shirts, shirts and especially clothes for women. Her dream is to have her own house, since she is currently renting.

loans.use: Purchase pants, t-shirts, shirts and especially clothes for women.

loans.name: Segundo Gregorio

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 43 años D. edad, es casado y resiD. junto a su esposa y a su hijo en el distrito D. Manuel Mesones Muro, una zona agrícoL. situada en L. provincia D. Ferreñafe, a más D. media hora D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en L. crianza y venta D. animales. El cría animales menores en diversos corrales situados en L. parte posterior D. su domicilio. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes D. L. zona y al público en general. 

Adicionalmente se encarga D. brindar servicio D. transporte D. carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar actividades D. transporte). El ya lleva trabajando en estas actividades por cinco años y se vale D. ellas para sacar adelante L. economía D. su familia.

Segundo desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar L. crianza D. sus animales, así como para realizar algunas mejoras en sus corrales. Con esta inversión el espera que sus animales se desarrollen D. mejor modo y pueda obtener mejores ingresos D. sus ventas. Para lograr su objetivo el se ha visto en L. necesidad D. solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Segundo is 43 years old, he is married and he lives together with his wife and their son in the district of Manuel Mesones Muro. It is an agricultural region in the province of Ferrenafe and it is located more than half an hour from the city of Chiclayo. 

He is a farmer who raises and sells livestock. He raises his livestock in several corrals located in the back portion of his property. When the livestock have reached a certain level of development he sells them to the merchants in the region and to the general public. 

In addition he also provides transportation services for both cargo and passengers with the use of a motorcycle rickshaw (a motorized vehicle consisting of a motorcycle and a cabin that is used for transportation). He has had his businesses for five years and he depends on them to proviD. for his family. 

Segundo wishes to purchase balanced feed to improve the quality of his livestock and he also needs to carry out some improvements to the corrals. With this investment he expects to see his livestock develop in a healthy way and he will see an improvement in his earnings. In order to meet his objective he has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To purchase balanced feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Flamboyan Group

texts.en: Flamboyan Group received a new loan on January 18, 2011 with the number of loans per member amounting to 1.4 million Indonesian rupiah (IDR). With the same purpose as the previous period, this loan will be used to buy pigs and feed. Although not all members can have a good business, the spirit of the members remains high. Some members suffered losses because pigs get sick and die even with treatment. With the realization of the loan, branch chief KSU MUK shed some light on pig farming – it is good and right. It is intended that members are reminded every time, so they can raise pigs properly and losses due to mortality can be reduced. KSU MUK is not only an institution that lends money, but is also responsible for the success of business borrowers. Information about Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) This loan is being serviced by Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK), a microfinance institution headquartered in Bali Indonesia. MUK follows a cooperative model offering microenterprise development services to its clients, including microloans, savings programs, and business consultation services to help small business owners and their families improve their everyday lives. MUK envisions a prosperous world free from poverty. It is dedicated to raising society’s awareness of environmental issues and to providing opportunities for people in chronic poverty to improve their lives. MUK provides services to all lower income people throughout Bali without consideration of race, religion or culture. Mitra Usaha Kecil is dedicated to empowering people, creating jobs, stimulating small businesses and strengthening communities. For more information about MUK, please visit our Kiva partner page and website. Also, consider supporting MUK and its borrowers by joining our Kiva lending team Friends of Mitra Usaha Kecil. .

loans.use: To buy pigs and feed

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Mrs. Yem S. was born in 1964. She is a villager who lives in Kaoh Prak village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses for growing vegetables to sell for family living. She faces a problem with money to grow her crop. So she would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticide for supporting her purpose. She wants uses the rest of the loan to purchase a hose for her water machine. Her husband, Mr. Top Sary, works as a construction worker where he is able to receive a little salary to support his family. This couple has two children who are both seamstresses in the garment factory. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticide for growing crops.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace C. is from the village of Buguac, Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 21 years old. Grace is single and has an infant. To make a living, Grace owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing upholstery services, like repairing sofas and sala (living room) sets to local community members. She also buys and sells firewood and bananas. Grace has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Grace is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide upholstery services. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Grace from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

location.town: Buguac, Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna B. is from the village of Catarman. She is 50 years old. Myrna is married and has four children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 1999, Myrna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 20th loan taken out by Myrna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Munhbat

texts.en:
Munhbat, 54, is married and lives with his wife and four children in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they've owned for seven years. His older son and daughter have their own jobs and his two younger daughters attend college in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. 

Munhbat began operating a retail trade in rawhides in 2004. He purchases animal rawhides from individuals and transports them by his own mini-truck. His wife sells meat at a rented stall at a local food market. There are a lot of competitors in this business and having a car is an advantage for their family-based business. They can go to the countryside and purchase meat, animal rawhides and livestock for cheaper prices from individuals and save money on transportation fees. Munhbat and his wife want to expand their meat trading business and increase their profit. Munhbat is a hardworking and active person who says, "I want to save some more money and help my son to build his own house in the future." He is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 tugriks to purchase more animal rawhides and meat for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more animal rawhides and meat.

loans.name: Verónica Johanna

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Valle Verde. Esta localidad se le conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Verónica, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 8 y 2  años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. El marido es agricultor y comerciante.
 
Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Ella comparte el crédito con su esposo, el se dedica a la agricultura y a la compra y venta de pollos y chanchos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, chanchos y pollos. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta todo del banco.
 
Sus sueños son tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the "Valle Verde" (Green Valley) community bank meet in the city of Charapoto.  This city is known for its traditional culture and for the fact that it is located only a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we meet 26 year-old Verónica who lives with her partner and has two children aged 8 and 2.  Her eldest child attends elementary school.  Her husband is a farmer and a salesman.

Verónica is a housewife who, in order to make her own income, sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She works three days a week, leaving her products on credit and collecting payment every week.  She will share her loan with her husband who farms and also buys and sells chickens and pigs.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, pigs and chickens.  This is Verónica's third loan cycle as a member of her community bank and she likes everything about her community bank.  Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, pigs and chickens

loans.name: Pol

texts.en:
Pol S. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. In addition, she also assists her husband to provide a rice-milling service to their neighbors. 

The couple has four children; one is already married and lives away from the family home while the other three are single. Two of their kids are working, one is a construction worker and the other is a bus driver. In order to earn extra income, Pol S. will be using the loan to buy more pig-feed and piglets to raise.

loans.use: to buy more pig-feed and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Esther Adelina

texts.es:
Adelina es una madre de familia de 30 años, vive con su esposo  y sus 4 hijos, tiene su casa propia con todos los servicios básicos (agua, luz y desagüe), la cual se ubica en el distrito de San José a unos 10 minutos de la provincia de Chiclayo.  San José es distrito muy bonito, tiene una playa tranquila para veranear, además cuentan con todos los platos a base de pescado y lo más importante sus pobladores se dedican a la pesca artesanal.
Adelina se dedica a la venta de pescado seco y salado, con una experiencia de 3 años, ésta actividad lo desarrolla en su vivienda, en la parte posterior a acondicionado unos palos de madera para el salado y posterior secado de su pescado a la intemperie (a la luz del sol), las cuales se encuentran a las orillas de la playa, una vez que está listo su producto lo vende en los mercados de la zona y tiene mucha clientela lo que le permite tener más ingresos para cubrir sus necesidades diarias.
El préstamo solicitado por Adelina a Edpyme Alternativa es de 2000 nuevos soles para implementar mejor el área donde realiza el salado y secado de su pescado, y su almacén para guardar su pescado listo, para poder atender a una mayor cantidad de clientela brindándoles un producto de calidad a un buen precio.
Adelina es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable, una madre que desea tener un negocio más grande para dales un buen futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Adelina is a 30-year-old mother who lives with her husband and four children. They own a home that receives all the basic services (water, electricity, and drainage). Adelina lives in the District of San José, which is approximately ten minutes from the Province of Chiclayo. San José is a beautiful area that has a quiet beach for spending the summer holiday. In addition, it is known for its seafood dishes since most of the residents engage in the fishing trade.

Adelina sells dried and salted fish. She has three years of experience managing her business, which she operates from her home. Adelina has an area behind her house that is set up with wooden posts for the salting process. Afterwards, the fish is taken to the shores of the beach where it is set out to dry in direct sunlight. Once the fish is ready, Adelina sells her products at the local markets where she has many customers. This business enables her to have more income to cover her daily needs.

The loan Adelina is requesting from Edpyme Alternativa is in the amount of 2000 PEN and will be used to improve the area where she salts and dries the fish by constructing a storage shed where she can keep the fish that is ready for sale. This will enable her to serve more customers by providing a high-quality product at a good price.

Adelina is a hardworking and responsible individual. This mother wants to have a larger business so that she can provide her children a good future.

loans.use: to build a storage shed for keeping dried and salted fish.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis de 34años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil zona caracterizada por sus caminos montañosos. Esta casado y su esposa se dedica en la venta de comesticos por catálogos tienen2 hijos menores de edad que estudian en colegio fiscales. Tiene un taller de soldadura (metales).

El aprendió con sus hermanos que tenían un taller y se independizo ya que por su casa era conocido y comenzó realizando trabajos a amigos como enderezando autos o metales o en las pintadas.. Labora solo todos los días en su casa y se queda hasta la 10H00 pm o mas si el tiempo lo amerita. Le dificulta en su trabajo son las pintura ya que también hace ese tiempo de trabajo en su taller y con el tiempo que va inhalando eso su salud le va a afectando. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere adecuar su taller hacerlo mas grande para asi poder realizar sus trabajos mas tranquilo. En un futuro quiere ver a sus hijos profesionales y que no pasen por el trabajo duro como el lo ha hecho.
texts.en:
Luis, age 34, lives in the periurban zone of Paraíso de Guayaquil, an area known for its mountainous roads. Luis is married and his wife works in catalog sales of cosmetics. He owns a metalworking shop. The couple has two young children who attend school at a public high school. 

Luis learned his trade from his brothers, who have their own workshop. He was able to branch off and start his own workshop, thanks to the good reputation of his family's work. He started with jobs from his friends, repairing automobile dents and paintwork. He works alone every day until 10:00 p.m. or later, if necessary. Paint jobs are the most difficult part of his work, since they take a lot of time and the paint fumes are harmful to his health. 

With the help of this loan, Luis hopes to expand his workshop space so that he can work more effectively. He hopes to one day see his children pursue professional careers rather than taking a job like his, which requires hard manual labor.

loans.use: To buy cement and concrete blocks for repair shop.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 2 sont  tous des femmes mariées  ayant  en moyenne 31  ans, 5 enfants et  vivant  dans des familles traditionnelles à MEMISSALA, un village situé à environ 30 km de la ville de NIENA région de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur cinquième cycle de prêt  de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin en moyen de production et intrant agricole. Les prêts antérieurs ont été remboursés avec satisfaction. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du maïs, du riz, d’arachide etc et leurs  ventes font l’objet d’activité rentable dans la zone.
DIATOU, qui est la présidente du groupe, debout au milieu avec une écharpe noire, compte acheter, 3 sacs d’urée 2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage.  Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50.000 à 55 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the group BENKADI 2 are all married women with an average age of 31 and on average five children. They live in traditional families in MEMISSALA, a village situated about 30 km from the town of NIENA, Sikasso region, third administrative region of Mali. 
 
These clients are on their fifth rural loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to satisfy their average need for agricultural supplies and intrants. Their prior loans have been reimbursed satisfactorily. 

This group of women grow maize, rice, and peanuts, etc. and it is profitable for them to sell these crops in their area. 

 DIATOU plans to buy three sacks of urea (fertilizer), two sacks of grain-complex, and use the rest to pay for plowing and weeding. She expects to make an average profit of 50,000 to 55,000 F CFA which will be used for everyday expenditures of her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural intrants and pay for plowing.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is an individual client from Ibanda. He is 24 years old and single with no child yet. He is into the business of dairy farming. He has been selling milk in bulk to milk vendors in Rushere for close to 10 years. 

At first, William says that this was a family business that he inherited and he is grateful for the inspiration from his family. He is also involved in cattle fattening for resale and this supplements his income. He is very hard-working and he needs a loan to be able to buy more cows for an expanded herd.

loans.use: To buy more cows for an expanded herd.

loans.name: Elia Maria

texts.es: Elia Maria tiene 69 años, ella tiene muchas experiencias de trabajar con financiamientos, pues ha demostrado ser una mujer muy capaz, siempre ha realizado el pago de sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. Hace más de 33 años que se dedica a este negocio y ha logrado crecer pues ella está muy agradecida por esta oportunidad que le han brindado. Su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de tortillas, ella se levanta temprano desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, todos los días sus tortillas son muy famosas por sus clientes que siempre llegan a comprar este producto. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de maíz, cal, leña, comal, bolsas y carbón. Su deseo es ampliar su local y brindar mejoras para su vivienda.
texts.en: Elia Maria is 69 years old and she has much experience in working with loans. She has demonstrated herself to be a capable woman, always having made her payments on time and in form. She has been in business for more than 33 years and she has managed to develop it. She is very thankful for this opportunity which is presented to her. Her business activity is the sale and production of tortillas. She starts her day very early, working from 5 in the morning until 6 in the evening, every day. Her tortillas are very famous and her clients always come to purchase her product. The loan which she requests is to purchase corn, lime, firewood, a grill, plastic bags, and charcoal. Her goal is to expand her store and to make some home improvements.

loans.use: to purchase corn, lime, firewood, a grill, plastic bags, and charcoal.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 5 children. 

Mercy has a retail shop that sells dried fish.  She has had this business for 3 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy dried fish to sell.
Mercy is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Mercy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell

loans.name: Biiz Kwetungura Group

texts.en: Justus, with hand raised, is 27. The last four years have been mixed for his retail business, but this good-natured and assiduous father of four has shown his enterprising and unrelenting work ethic during this time. He began his business with savings from his farming business. Weekly Justus says his gross earnings total Ugandan shillings 140,000. He sells a variety of general merchandise such as maize flour, soap, beans, plastics, and bread. These commodities sell well because they are essential. His four years' experience in this trade has taught him a lot as regards the efficient running of a business, crisis management, and the proper management of finances. This is the first time Justus's group is accessing a loan from Pearl micro finance. Most, if not all, the group members are in business which means repaying this loan will not pause a problem. Justus is requesting this loan to purchase more retail commodities such as maize flour, rice, cooking oil, beans, sugar, and bread to sell in his store.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities such as maize flour, rice, cooking oil, beans, sugar, and bread to sell

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr:
Âgé de 27 ans, célibataire et père d’un enfant, Monsieur Oumar vit  chez parents dans le quartier Médina coura de la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
Oumar, pour des raisons sociales n’a pas pu continuer les  études primaires, et très vite embrassa les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de son père. Depuis maintenant 3 ans  Oumar est installé à son propre compte.  Il est très sollicité et apprécié par ses clients, car le téléphone portable est de nos jours une nécessité majeure pour la population Malienne. 
Dans le souci de satisfaction de sa clientèle, Monsieur Oumar a fait recours à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il n’ y a que 2 ans. Il est à son troisième prêt  individuel et les deux prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté.  Avec ce financement  il compte acheter, 10 téléphones portables et des pièces de rechange à Bamako, il effectue sa vente dans son kiosque situé à Médina coura aux abords de route goudronnée, à une clientèle mixte au comptant. 
Avec ce financement, il compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qu’il utilisera pour subvenir à ses besoins et investir le reste dans son activité. 
Dans les jours à venir, il ambitionne d’agrandir son activité pour attirer plus de clients.
texts.en:
Oumar is 27 years old, single and a father of one, living with his parents in the Médina Coura district of the city of Koutiala (Sikasso region).

Due to social circumstances, Oumar wasn’t able to continue past elementary school, and he was quick to pursue other income-generating activities with his father.  For three years, Oumar has been self-employed.  He is very sought-out and appreciated by his customers, because cell phones are a major necessity for people in Mali today.

Oumar turned to the Soro Yiriwaso MFI only two years ago, hoping to better satisfy his customers.  He is currently on his third individual loan, and his previous two loans were paid back without any problems.  With this loan, he plans on purchasing 10 cell phones, as well as spare parts, in Bamako.  He sells for cash to a varied clientele from his stall in Médina Coura, along the paved road.

With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 100,000 CFA francs.  He will use this to cover his needs, and invest any remaining funds back into his business.

In the future, he hopes to grow his business to attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase cell phones and spare parts

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 33 year-old Mohamed.  He is married, and has 3 children, aged 9, 3 and 2 years. He has an additional dependent who lives with him because he is his sales agent.  In 2009, Mohamed established his provisions and "Top up" business. He began his business because he believed it to be a possible way to earn money and support his family.  Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000.  He needs this loan in order to buy milk, sardines, luncheon meat and Top up (mobile phone) cards. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000.  In the future, Mohamed plans to own a bigger shop, to establish a branch at Ahmadiya junction, and to build a house for his family.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy milk, sardines, luncheon meat and Top up cards

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Francisco Antonio se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajador debido a que ha sabido llevar el bien estar de su casa y ha logrado mantener a su familia que tanto ama en mejores condiciones de vida. Él se caracteriza por ser una excelente trabajador y con buenos valores y principio morales ha hecho que se gane el aprecio de muchas personas de su municipio. 
 Actual mente a acudido a Ceprodel El Sauce, con el fin de solicitar un crédito para Reparar las condiciones de su vivienda, para ello está solicitando el crédito, para la compra de materiales, tales como: Arena, Sementó, y pago de Mono de obra, así obtener mejores Condiciones en su familia. Con esto empezara a las mejoras de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco Antonio is known for being a hardworking person who is able to provide for the welfare of his household and has managed to maintain good living conditions for his family.  Francisco is known as an excellent worker with good values, thus enabling him to earn the respect of many people in his town. 

He came to the CEPRODEL branch in El Sauce to request a loan so that he could make repairs to his home. The loan he requested will be used to buy materials such as sand and cement.  He will also pay for labor so that he can obtain better conditions for his family.  With this loan, the improvements to his home can begin.

loans.use: to pay for materials and labor in order to make home improvements.

loans.name: Mwanapili

texts.en:
Mwanapili is a married woman with six children, three boys and three girls. She owns a house that has neither  electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.  For the past two years, she has operated a local brew selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase coconuts to make a local brew for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase coconuts to make a local brew for sale.

loans.name: Safi

texts.en:
Safi is a 50-year-old married man and father of two children.  He started a new business a year ago to make a better living for his family.  Safi opened a small shop where he sells fresh chicken, which are healthier and more requested in his region than frozen ones.  He previously worked in construction, specializing in painting.   Safi did not stop this business, but added the new business to provide more income for his family.  He is an expert in both fields.

Safi is requesting a loan from Kiva partner A. Majmoua to increase his capitA. for his chicken business.  He aims to sell the chickens at a competitive price.  This loan is his first experience with a Kiva partner.  He hopes the loan will help him expand his business further to open a small sandwich shop that he will make into a big restaurant in the future.

loans.use: To increase capital for his chicken business so he can sell at a competitive price.

loans.name: Lemayian

texts.en:
Lemayian is 32 years old and married to Hadija. Together they have two children aged three and two years old. He operates a butchery shop. He has been in the business for the past 15 years and he makes a monthly income of 5,000 Kenyan shillings. 

This is his third loan from KADET LTD after he repaid his previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to buy more meat for sale. 



The anticipated profits will be used to buy a cow and a plot. His dream is to be a successful business man.

loans.use: to buy more meat for sale.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto tiene 57 años de edad, reside con su esposa en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural que tiene como actividad principal a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra en el distrito de Paijan que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace mas de varios años, el suele sembrar maiz en un terreno de cultivo con el que cuenta, el cual una vez que cosecha lo ofrece en el mercado de la zona a sus clientes y con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar sus obligaciones de su casa.

Roberto desea adquirir fertilizantes y pesticidas para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de maíz, con esta acción el espera obtener una buena cosecha. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles.  Al tener mejoras económicas podra brindarle más comodidades a su esposa.
texts.en:
Roberto is 57 years old, and resides with his wife in their own house where the only basic service they have is electricity. He lives in the rural agricultural and cattle farming zone in the Paijan district of La Libertad department. He has done agricultural work for many years, usually planting corn in his field. Once he harvests the corn, he offers it for sale to his customers in the market. With the income he makes, he can meet his obligations for his home. 

Roberto wants to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for maintaining his corn crop, and he hopes this will enable him to get a good harvest. Therefore he has seen the need for requesting a loan of 3000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. With an improved economic situation, he will be able to offer his wife more comforts and conveniences.

loans.use: to acquire fertilizers and pesticides to help maintain his corn crop

loans.name: Estefita

texts.es: Estefita tiene 37 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su pareja y de sus dos hijos en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Estefita es la venta de plátanos, que desde muy temprano se levanta para dirigirse a su puesto que tiene en un mercado de su ciudad. Estando ahí recibe los plátanos que le trae un productor. Tiene seis años de dicándose a esta actividad, y hasta el momento lo ha hecho sola. Lo que gusta de su actividad es que puede tener un ingreso económico con el cual apoyar a su pareja en los gastos de su hogar, además cubrir la educación de sus hijos. Se siente cómoda con la actividad que realiza, pues lo considera rentable ya que tiene una clientela regular que le compran sus productos, de esta manera logra vender todo lo que oferta en su puesto de venta. Tiene ideas de poder hacer crecer su negocio, comprar en mayores cantidades, sabiendo que así tendrá mayores ganancias. Este sería el crédito número diez con MFP. Ella espera contar con su ayuda para continuar con su trabajo. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra plátanos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Estefita is 37 years old.  She is a cheerful and hard-working woman who lives together with her partner and two children in her own home.  Her business is selling bananas.  She gets up very early in the morning and heads for her stall in the town market.  There she receives bananas which a farmer brings to her.  She has been in this business for six years and, up to now, she has worked alone.  What she enjoys about her business is that it makes her an income which allows her to support her partner with their household expenses and also cover their children's education expenses.  She feels comfortable with the work that she does as she considers it to be profitable.  She has regular customers who buy her products.  In this way, she manages to sell everything that she offers on her stall.

Estefita has ideas of growing her business and buying in larger quantities, knowing that this will make her more profits.  This will be her tenth loan from MFP.  She hopes to be able to count on your help so that she can continue in her work.  She will invest the sum she has requested in buying bananas wholesale.

loans.use: to buy bananas wholesale

loans.name: Los Andes (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Andes está formado por 13 socias y 2 socios, se reúne cada quince días en un sector conocido como El Guabito de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar de gente amable,  trabajadora y dedicada  a sus familias.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les va a servir de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos pueden mejorar sus pequeños negocios que tienen. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

En este lugar vive la señora Gloria, tiene 37 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 16, 13 y 10 años de edad los mismos que aun viven en sus casa a pesar de que la mayor ya está comprometida, los menores estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es guardia de seguridad.
 
Ella para obtener sus propios recursos y con estos ayudar a su esposo se dedica a la venta de productos Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los  días de tres a cuatro horas por dia, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. Tiene cinco  años que se dedica a la venta de estos productos y lo que más vende son los perfumes ya que son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Este es el primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal, es la presidenta del grupo y espera cumplir para seguir recibiendo los créditos y beneficios que ofrece la fundación.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran almacén en el centro de la ciudad.

En la foto del grupo faltan el Señor Danny y la Señora Mayra que por motivos de trabajo no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo. En la foto están dos niños que son hijos de 2 socias.
texts.en:
Los Andes Communal Bank is made up of 13 women and 2 men. They meet every two weeks in an area of the city of Portoviejo known as El Guabito, a place of hard-working, peaceful people dedicated to their families.  This is a group of people who decided to get together and form this communal bank that is going to be useful to them, since with the loans they can improve their small businesses.  They work in various activities such as business, service, food sales, and others.

Gloria lives in this place.  She is 37 years old and has a common-law relationship from which she has three children, ages 16, 13, and 10.  All of them still live at home even though the oldest daughter is engaged; the younger ones are in high school and elementary school.  Her husband is a security guard.
 
She works selling Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories) to have her own resources and with them help her husband.  She works every day for three or four hours, leaving the products on credit and collecting the payments every weekend.  She has been selling these products for five years and what she sells most are the perfumes, since they are very good.

This loan is to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics, and costume jewelry.  This is her first cycle in the communal bank.  She is the president of the group and she hopes to perform, to continue receiving loans and the benefits that the foundation offers.

Her dream is to have a big store downtown in the city.

Danny and Mayra are missing from the photo since they were at work when it was taken. There are two children of two of the women in the picture.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Men is 29 years old. She lives in Trung Ban village and has two children who are going to school. Men has a workshop and her husband works there producing wood furniture. Men makes tofu and earns a monthly income of about 6,000,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA since 2007 and has punctually repaid her previous loan of 7,392,000 VND.

Men is requesting a 9,632,000 VND loan to buy wood for her workshop.

loans.use: to buy wood for her workshop

loans.name: Marvin Alexis

texts.es: El señor Marvin tiene 29 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de san marcos de colon, ahi vive con su madre, Marvin  se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva para dama y caballero, esta actividad la realiza desde hace un año,  el es una persona luchadora y tiene una gran clientela, los productos que les vende son de muy buena calidad y a precios buenos, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa al por mayor, se aproxima la epoca de navidad y ya tiene muchos pedidos de sus clientes,  trabaja muy fuerte para crecer con su negocio y lograr tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Marvin is 29 years old. He lives in the city of San Marcos de Colon. There he lives with his mother. Marvin is dedicated to selling new men's and women's clothing. He has performed this activity for a year. He is a hard-working person and he has great customers. The products that he sells them are of very good quality and good prices. He will use the loan to purchase clothing at wholesale. The Christmas season is approaching and he already has a lot of orders from his customers. He works hard to grow his business and to obtain a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase new men's and women's clothing.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is married and has three children ranging from eleven to eighteen years of age. She describes herself as a God-fearing person and an optimistic woman. She has been selling handbags in a good and busy market for six years. Her business challenge is inadequate funds for adding to her stock of bags. She will use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more handbags. In the future, Mary hopes to venture into a new business of providing transportation services using a bus.

loans.use: To buy more handbags.

loans.name: Jenny-Vi

texts.en:
Jenny-vi is 38 years old and has three children. Unluckily, she and her spouse separated due to personal reasons. Jenny-vi needs to be strong and acquire an income so that she can provide sustenance for her family, especially a good education for her children. She established a business selling clothes, accessories, gift items and bags for almost two years. She operates her business everyday from 8 am to 7 pm.

Jenny-vi would like to further expand her business so that she can continuously provide a good education for her children. In this matter, she would like to ask for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy more items to sell such as t-shirts, bags, accessories, and other gift items.

In the future, Jenny-vi hopes to have good financial management so that someday she can upgrade her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, bags, accessories, and other gift items to sell.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She is borrowing 29,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell.
Antonieta has been in this business for 12 years. She earns additional income from farming rice. Antonieta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Gemma has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for two years. She has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Gemma has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Nyanluak

texts.en:
Nyanluak lives in bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 35 years old, married, and has five children; four of them are still in school. 

Nyanluak heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans, sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of her children

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar for sale.

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand 3 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIEU EST GRAND 3 est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Rufine Carine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Rufine Carine est âgée de 31 ans et vit au Bénin. Rufine Carine ne vit plus avec son mari. Rufine Carine est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Rufine Carine vit avec ses enfants et assure leurs différents besoins grâce aux revenus de son activité. En effet, depuis une quinzaine d'année, Rufine Carine vend des tissus hollandais par le système de distribution. Rufine Carine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Rufine Carine désire satisfaire un plus grand nombre de clients par ses produits, mais Rufine Carine ne dispose pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pouvant lui permettre de rehausser le niveau de son activité. C’est pour ce faire que Rufine Carine sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DIEU EST GRAND 3. Le crédit reçu précédemment a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus;

loans.name: Sasunik

texts.en: Sasunik lives in Ddmashen village of Gegharkunik region with his large family. He lives with his wife, son and two daughters. Sasunik for many years used to work as a driver, now he is employed at the private company and he is also engaged in farming and potato cultivation. Sasunik’s wife is unemployed and she greatly helps her husband in their farming works especially cattle care. They work hard as it is the main and the constant source of income for their large family needs. Sasunik’s elder son works at the police station, second daughter Amalya is unemployed, the smallest daughter is a student an in future she is psychologist. The family is a worried of the Amalya’s health state since she has some claims connected with her health. Sasunik hopes so much that Kiva lenders will help him with loan amount of 1.400.000 Armenian drams which he will use to for his smallest daughter’s proper medical exam at the hospital, with great hope that there will be nothing serious with her.

loans.use: to pay for his smallest daughter’s proper medical exam at the hospital, with great hope that there will be nothing serious with her

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock more phones and accessories.

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Latifa is 46 years old and a mother of 4 children. She lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan

Latifa took a 1st cycle loan for her son who has 3 years experience in taxi driving in the local area. His car is useless unless he gets new tires so she decided to take a loan. She hopes that by becoming a good client for AFSG she can take a 2nd cycle loan to start her own tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy tires

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en: Elnur is a resident of the town of Beylagan. He is 27 years old and is not yet married. He rents a booth at the market and sells clothing of different kinds. He started renting the booth in 2006 and his business is quite new. At the beginning, he borrowed $750 from Normicro Beylagan Branch as initial capital to buy the stock to be sold at the booth. Now, he has successfully started the business and repaid the first loan.  He asks for a subsequent loan for the amount of $1000 to increase the variety of clothes he sells.

loans.use: To increase the variety of inventory.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 26 years old has two children. He has a small shop in the Kirkuk market. This is his first loan from AL-Aman. He wants to buy up more goods for his shop and increase his income and enhance his living standard.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase more goods

loans.name: Tara Devi

texts.en:
Mrs. Tara Devi L., 58 years old, lives in Bagdhol, Lalitpur.  She opened her small hotel 2 years ago.  She is selling Newari food in the hotel.

Four years ago, her husband, Dhan Bahadur L., died and now she has to take the whole responsibility for her family.  Her economic condition is poor and not adequate to fulfill the basic needs of her family.  She needs a loan to expand her business to earn more and fulfill her family's basic needs.

She plans to use the loan to buy a refrigerator to sell cold drinks like Coke and juice, as well as cold snacks.

She is living with her daughter and a six month old granddaughter.  She wants to provide quality education for her granddaughter.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for her shop

loans.name: Augustina De La Cruz

texts.en:
Augustina, 22, sells groceries out of a small shed next to her house. She lives with her partner and they have three children. Her partner has a nursery where he sells houseplants. Augustina sells goods like tomatoes, aubergines (eggplant), hot peppers, eggs, vegetable oil, rice, salt and so forth. She started that business very recently.

Now, Augustina needs a loan so as to purchase more goods in order to expand her business and increase her sales volume. This way, Augustina can be sure she´ll improve her family´s situation.

loans.use: To purchase goods like hot pepper, eggplant, rice, and salt in order to increase her income

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina sells men’s and women’s clothing. She started her business eight years ago. Paulina is 43 years old and has six children, four boys and two girls. Four of them are grown and are working in Santo Domingo. The two youngest attend school.

Paulina says she’s very proud to have worked hard in order to provide good education for her children. But her major satisfaction is to run her business and not depend on others to have food to eat. She hopes her business can get better and better.

With her loan, she will buy clothing in bulk and shoes to introduce into the business. That way she hopes she will increase her sales volume and attract new clients.

loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk and shoes for her business

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana and her husband and son are from Melitopol, a city in the southern part of Ukraine near the Black Sea. Tatyana has a successful business selling women’s lingerie from a little outdoor kiosk at the busy Central market in Melitopol. She has been in business for about five years. With hard work and the help of loans from Nadiya Ukraine she has been able to grow and develop her business into a profitable enterprise.

Tatyana would like to continue growing her business in the future. She has requested a loan of $1200 to purchase new inventory so that she can meet customer demand and make a good profit.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: Zufar

texts.en:
A. Zufar is 53 years old. He has very large family. Together with his wife, Zufar is raising seven children.

For more than 20 years, Zufar has been engaged in the processing of agricultural products. He cracks and cleans the walnuts, almonds and pistachio. This is extremely labor-intensive and time-consuming; that is why the entire family helps Zufar. The nuts are delivered by Zufar from Kyrgyzstan. After cleaning all the nuts, they are ready for sales. As a rule, Zufar sells them to people who export the product to Russia and other countries.

Now, Zufar wants to arrange the export of the nuts by himself. With this purpose in mind, he requests 2400.00 Somoni (700.00US Dollars) to pay all the necessary fees for arranging this. The term of the loan is 12 months. This is the second loan for Zufar, and he had already recommended himself as a reliable client.

loans.use: To pay the fee for export of cracked and cleaned walnuts, almond, and pistachio

loans.name: Junior

texts.es:
Junior Alarcón lives with his father in the Pasankeri area, ladera oeste of the city of La Paz. Junior works as a security guard for a company in that industry. His father is handing him over part of his land so that Junior can build his own house. The loan he is requesting will be used to build a new room on the aforementioned land.

This is the first time he requests a loan. The socio-economic analysis performed was favorable and qualifies him to obtain the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Junior Alarcón vive en casa de su padre en la zona de Pasankeri ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz. El señor Junior trabaja como empleado de seguridad en una empresa del ramo. Su padre le esta cediendo parte de su terreno para que el señor Junior pueda construir su vivienda propia. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de una habitación nueva en el terreno de su padre.

Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: To build a room on land that his father is handing him over.

loans.name: Ghulam's Group

texts.en: Ghulam S., the leader of this group, is married with six children.  She has been married for 23 years and for that time has lived in the small city of Depalpur, Pakistan, where her husband runs a pharmacy.  They have already successfully borrowed two loans from a microfinance institution called Asasah in Pakistan, which were both used to improve their pharmacy. These loans helped to increase their income substantially. In this group are several other women who are also in need of loans: Anwer B., whose husband farms a rented piece of agricultural land; Zahida B., who wants a loan for her husband who is a builder; and Khursheed B., whose husband runs a grocery store.  Altogether, they are requesting a loan of $1,000.00 which will be divided between them.

loans.use: To expand a pharmacy.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn N., a 68-year-old widow with six children, works as a farmer, earning about $1.50 a day. Three children are married and live away from home and the other three are garment factory workers, earning $50 each per month.

Sorn is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase a cow to assist with the farm work; the remainder will be used to buy another plot of farmland to grow more rice.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and another plot of farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a small business selling precooked beans

loans.name: Morn

texts.en: Mr. Morn N. is 49 years-old. He makes and sells Cambodian noodles from his house, earning approximately $2.93 per day. His wife, Mrs. Dy Yan is 50 years-old. She farms and raises pigs, earning $1.33 per day. The couple has four children. Two of their children are married and the other two attend school. They request a loan of $300 to buy a motorcycle. This motorcycle will support their businesses by making transportation faster and more convenient. The motorcycle will also be helpful for family use. (The picture is N.'s wife)

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Larisa

texts.ru:
Larisa Konstantinovna T. lives in the Gissar region. She is 35 years old and has one child. She has secondary education and is in the retail business of selling basic, every day needs goods. She has more than twelve years of experience in this field. This business is the main source of income for her family. At this time Larisa wants to increase the variety of items offered at her store. This is why she decided to apply for a loan with a 10 month repayment plan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Царева Лариса Констатиновна жительница района Гиссар. Возраст 35 лет , имеет 1 ребенка. Образование среднее . Лариса занимается куплей продажей товаров повседневного спроса . Имеет опыт в этой деятельности более 12 лет .Этот вид деятельности является основным источником дохода ее семьи. В данный момент Лариса хочет увеличить ассортимент своей торговой очки. Для чего она решила взять кредит сроком на 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy inventory

loans.name: Delia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Delia is married to Roberto Contreras, who is an employee in a company. They have three children. Their oldest daughter is thirteen, and she helps Delia with her business. She started her business to help her children get ahead and because her husband was unemployed. Because of economic need, she had to look for a source of income. This is why she started her small general store a year ago that she has grown little by little.

She needs a loan of $250, which she will repay in 3 months, to purchase merchandise and supply her store. With your help, Delia will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Delia es casada su esposo se llama Roberto Contreras es empleado en la empresa tienen tres hijos su hija la mas grande de 13 años le ayuda en el negocio. Ella inicio el negocio para sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que su esposo estaba desempleado y ante las necesidades económicas tuvo que buscar alguna fuente de ingresos y es así como hace un año inicio con una pequeña tienda de abarrotes que poco a poco ha hecho crecer.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y asi poder tener surtida su tienda. Con tu ayuda Delia saldrá adelante.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Umrijon

texts.en:
Umrijon R. is a very hardworking woman. She is married with two children. She knows that each day she has to give her best effort and all her courage. Umrijon cultivates rice to sell at the market. She also raises animals for sale. These activities have given her feelings of satisfaction because they allow her to provide for a considerable portion of the household income.

Her husband is a construction worker and his salary helps cover the family expenses. But his work requires him to be on site, away from home, so Umrijon has to take care of everything. She has to wisely manage the money she earns from rice and cattle sales to cover the increasing expenses of her family. She also makes sure not to neglect her role as a mother. She’s very dedicated to lovingly raising her two children, who help care for the animals and land during their free time.

Umrijon is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni ($900) for the term of twelve months to buy small cattle in order to expand her business. Please support this woman who is determined to change the course of her life through dedication and hard work.

loans.use: To purchase small cattle to expand her business.

loans.name: Nun

texts.en: Nun S., 42, is married and lives with eleven of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$4 each day and are supported by four children working in a garment factory. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Nun S. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase fertilizer and a water pump. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family. (Her husband is pictured).

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and a water pump.

loans.name: Aridjetou

texts.fr: Aridjetou T. est une commerçante de « gari », une farine obtenue à base des tubercules de manioc, depuis 7 ans au grand marché d’Atakpamé, une ville à 170 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 51 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle aimerait avec ce crédit, redonner de la teneur à son activité en faisant plus de stock pour éviter les ruptures.
texts.en:
Aridjetou T. is a merchant dealing in "gari", a flour obtained from cassava tubers. She has been in this business for seven years at the grand marketplace of Atakpamé, a city located 170 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Married, 51 years old, and the mother of five. She would like to use this loan to reinvigorate her business by having more inventory for avoiding shortages.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of "gari" for resale

loans.name: Sek

texts.en:
Mr. Sek S., age 44, is the father of six children, all in school. They live together in Pursat Province. He is a rice farmer who has been farming for over 20 years, making an income of approximately US$ 2 each day. His wife, Mrs. Koam Hun, 44, is a vegetable farmer who grows cabbages and morning glories behind her home.

In order to earn additional income and make progress in their businesses, S. has requested a loan to purchase a piglet and a cow. (Mr. S.'s wife and his two daughter are pictured because he was not available.)

loans.use: to purchase a piglet and a cow

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Tuyết năm nay 52 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1999. Gia đình chị có 2 trong đó có một con đã trưởng thành. Hiện tại gia đình chị Tuyết đang chăn nuôi, trồng trọt theo mô hình trang trại.  Với việc chăn nuôi lợn, gà, cá và trồng cây ăn quả hàng năm thu nhập của gia đình chị đạt 80.000.000đ .Vòng vốn tới chị Tuyết mong muốn được vay thêm 15.000.000 đ để đầu tư mua cá giống và thức ăn phục vụ chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Tuyet is 52 yrs old, and joined TYM fund since 1999. Her family has 2 children and 1 is grown. Currently Ms. Tuyet's family raises animals, and grow fruit trees. With her business of raising pigs, chickens, fish and growing fruit trees, her family's annual income is 4,667 USD. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 875 USD to buy additional fish to raise, and feed for the animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising animals, tree farming

loans.name: Zainura

texts.ru: Хайруллоева Зайнура проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст 45 лет, замужем и имеет четверых детей. В центре района имеет свой магазин. Торгует продуктами питания. Опыт работы в данной сфере составляет 15 лет. К нам обратилась за кредитом , для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zainura H. lives in Varzob. She is a 45 year old mother of four children. For the past five years she has sold groceries in her store in the city center. Zainura is applying for a loan that would allow her to increase cash flow. She would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora de 34 años es una joven madre, que quiere el bienestar de su único hijo Marco de 7 años, vive en la casa de sus padres de manera independiente y anhela poderle dar una buena profesión a su amado hijo. Nora vende sus CDs de manera ambulante en le mercado Tupac Amaru (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), en una pequeña carretilla traslada toda su mercadería, recorriendo todo el mercado en busca de clientes que compren CDs, tiene precios más bajos que los que ofrecen los otros puestos, es por eso que prefieren comprarle a ella. Nora anhela tener un puestito en el mercado, donde pueda vender su producto sin necesidad de caminar tanto, ya que eso es lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo, tiene ya 10 años en este negocio y le gusta mucho conversar con sus clientes, a los cuales recibe muy amablemente y siempre convence de llevarse un CD. Nora tiene ya 5 préstamos con MFP, siempre ha pagado sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que quiere seguir obteniendo créditos, en su banco comunal es muy respetada puesto que es una de las socias más antiguas. Con el dinero que solicita planea comprar más CDs para incrementar su mercadería, lo cual le costará cerca de 500 soles, con el resto del dinero mejorará su carretilla y comprará algunos artefactos que le ayuden a vender mejor.
texts.en:
Nora is a young 34-year-old mother who wants only the best for her only son Marco, aged 7. She lives independently in her parents' home and longs to be able to give her beloved son a good occupation. Nora walks around the Tupac Amaru market (an important market in the city of Juliaca) selling CDs from a small cart she transports all her stock, covering the entire market in search of customers to buy her CDs. She has lower prices than other vendors and because of this many people prefer to buy from her. Nora longs to have a little stall in the market where she can sell her goods without having to walk so much as that is what she likes the least about her work. She has been in this business for 10 years and she enjoys speaking with her clients whom she always treats pleasantly and always convinces to buy a CD. Nora has already had five loans from MFP and has repaid all of them on time because she wants to continue to receive loans. She is well respected by her community bank because she is one of the members of longest standing. She will use the loan to buy more CDs to increase her stock, which will cost her roughly 500 soles; with the rest of the monies she will make improvements to her cart and buy some items to help her sell better.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her stock of CDs

loans.name: Rin

texts.en: Rin R. is 39 years old and resides with her husband in Siem Reap, Cambodia. She stays at home raising pigs and making rice wine. This business has been around for five years and she is able to make US$3 per day, while her husband sells wood and works as a farmer making US$3 per day as well. This couple has two school-aged children. Rin R. would like to take out a loan to purchase land so that her husband can expand his cultivation.

loans.use: To purchase land for farming

loans.name: Pedro José

texts.es:
El señor Pedro B. se dedica a su actividad de servicio de Molino el cual posee en su propia casa donde a diario labora arduamente recibiendo a sus clientes que llegan a utilizar el servicio de molino ya sea para moler cacao, maíz, entre otros.

Actualmente, comprometido con el bienestar de sus tres hijos, ha decidido mejorar su situación y para ello ha decidido invertir en la compra de un molino para así brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y de esta forma salir adelante en su negocio que requiere de su inversión instantaneamiente.
texts.en:
Pedro Molino dedicates himself to providing a mill service, which he has in his own house where he works arduously each and every day. He receives customers who come to him to grind items such as cacao, corn, and others. Currently, having committed to improve the standard of living for his three children, he has decided to improve his situation. To do this, he has determined to invest in the purchase of a mill in order to provide a better service for his customers. In this way, he can get his business to move ahead as it requires an immediate investment.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a mill.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is a cosmetics and clothes seller in the Jang’ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar . She belongs to Mkorofi si mwenzetu group loan (Group code 2071). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. Every day she works at her business for six hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more cosmetics and clothes for her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Mwajuma is 30 years old, married, and has two children: ages 6 and 3.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and clothes for her business

loans.name: Lelia Goretti

texts.es:
La señora Lelia  es socia del Banco Manuela Ramos  del Distrito de Mazocruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 22 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 1 hijo, vive en el Jr. José Antonio Chambilla y cuenta con estudios de 5to de segundaria.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años e inició su préstamo con la suma de 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su negocio de venta de prendas de vestir.
En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo, el cual solicitará por el monto de 1200.00 Nuevos Soles, con el cual comprará mayor de mercadería (ropa).  Además comprará un juegos de pinbooll.  Su mayor anhelo es comprarse una casa en Puno. Lo que más le gusta de su  Banco Comunal son las reuniones.
texts.en:
Lelia is a member of the Manuela Ramos Bank in the district of Mazocruz, in the province of Collao, in the region of Puno. She is 22 years old, has 1 son, and lives with the father of her son, José Antonio Chambilla. She studied until the fifth year of high school. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 2 years, and she started her first loan with the sum of 500 Nuevos Soles [the Peruvian currency], which allowed her to expand her business of selling garments. Currently, she needs a new loan, for which she is asking for 1200 Nuevos Soles, with which she will buy more clothing. She will also buy pinball machines. Her greatest wish is to buy herself a house in Puno. What she likes best about her community bank are the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and pinball machines.

loans.name: Omara Khan

texts.en:
Omara Khan is the son of A. A.. He lives in district 9 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is a young man of 30 and is still single. He is very hardworking and feels responsible towards his parents.

He has the business of painting cars. He owns a shop where he has all the equipment for his business. He has painted cars since 1999 and has full experience in the business. He would like to receive an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani to progress and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more materials for his business

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita A. is from the town of Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old,  married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Lucita owns & operates a vegetable business; her main source of income comes from planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale. Lucita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6500 PHP a month.

In 2005, Lucita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her business.  Lucita repaid previous loans from PMPC. Lucita is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP, her 12th from PMPC, which she will use to expand her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Izzat

texts.en:
Izzat is a 52-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their seven children. Izzat has been working as a car painter since 1988. Izzat has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase tools for his garage. This is his second loan cycle and he has always been on time. 

His previous loans helped him improve his garage. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Izzat decided on this business because he has experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his garage

loans.name: Heroinas Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Heroínas inicia su cuarto ciclo con 13 socias. Las socias son D. la comunidad D. Yanama que se ubica a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. ayacucho.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. frutas, comidas, cereales, abarrotes en general, leña.

Como es el caso D. Rufina que es casada, tiene 50 años y 6 hijos, Rufina venD. comida D. manera ambulatoria en su comunidad, en algunas oportunidades viaja a las ferias en donD. venD. frutas y D. las ferias compra cebada, papa. Rufina tiene proyectado vender verduras en las ferias.

Mientras que Daria es casada, tiene 38 años y 4 hijos, Daria venD. comida en el paradero D. una empresa D. transporte, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. sus hijos. Además Daria junto a su esposo tienen cultivos en la selva ayacuchana D. producción D. café y cacao.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, 1000 soles, haciendo un total D. 8,800 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. verduras, arroz, azúcar, aceite, frutas, leñan, trigo, cebada.

Los sueños D. las socias son mejorar sus negocios, tener una tienda estable, que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y apoyar en todo lo posible a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Heroínas communal bank is starting it's 4th loan cycle with 13 female members. The members are from the Yanama community that is located in the city of Ayacucho. The members have different businesses, such as selling fruit, food, grains, groceries and firewood. The case of Rufina is an example. She is 50 years old and has 6 children. Rufina is a street vendor selling food in her community. Sometimes, she travels to markets where she sells fruit and buys barley and potatoes to sell later. Rufina is planning on selling vegetables at the markets in the future. Other member is Daria, who is 38 years old and has 4 children. Daria sells food near a local transportation company, which she does everyday with the help of her children. In addition, Daria, along with her husband, has farmland in the jungle of Ayacucho that produces coffee and cocoa. The members need different loan amounts such as 300, 600, 900, and 1,000 Nuevos Soles, with a total of 8,800 Nuevos Soles. Their loans will be invested in the purchase of vegetables, rice, sugar, oil, fruit, firewood, wheat and barley. Their dreams are to improve their businesses so that they are stable and that their children complete their education as well as supporting them in everything that they need.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables, rice, sugar, oil, fruit, firewood, wheat and barley

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 26-year-old who operates a tailoring and design business. He has requested a first loan of Ksh. 25,000 to buy an additional sewing machine and add to his stock of materials. He believes that the loan and an expanded business will allow him to prosper, marry, buy a house and become a designer. He describes himself as God-fearing, diligent, and kind.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions.
