Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Buy an additional sewing machine and add to his stock of materials

loans.name: Amelyn

texts.en:
Amelyn has been a good client of Kiva loans. With the help of the lenders from her first loan, she was able to provide for the needs of her children and is very thankful for the financial support given to her. She is asking to again borrow PHP 5,000.00 in order to further improve her vegetable vending business.

Amelyn is 27-years old and married to Oscar, a driver. They have three children and two are studying. Princess Joy, seven-years old, is the eldest. Precious May is six-years old and both of the girls are in elementary school. The youngest, Clarence Jay, is eight months old. Amelyn hopes to improve their standard of living by patiently helping her husband through her small business. She hopes that the loan will be granted in order to help her business grow.

loans.use: To improve vegetable selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four cattle

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia D. is currently in the business of selling bread and pastries and is requesting a loan to open up a bakery. Cecilia is 29 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has three children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent.

About BRAC: BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a bakery

loans.name: Zabana

texts.en: Zabana S. sells cosmetics such as hair color, perfume and souvenirs. She is married and has thee children. Zabana has been selling groceries since 1999. She is responsible for paying for the food for the family and the payment of their utility bills. Her loan will be used to add to her capital to increase her grocery inventory in her store. Zabana hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in a building project that she has started with her husband.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetic supplies for sale

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is 35-years old and the mother ofthree children. Her children are currently in school. To support her household, she sells cereals, beans, and groundnuts to loyal customers in the community market. She buys her stock from farming communities, and she has fifteen years of experience in this business. Amina is requesting a loan of $700 to expand her inventory which will help her to improve her income and support her children's education.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cereals, beans, and groundnuts

loans.name: María Marlene

texts.es:
María tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y madre de dos niños de 9 años y 9 meses. Vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace tres años se dedica a la venta de salchipollos y hamburguesas en un carrito sanguchero. Ella nos comenta que adquirió el carrito con la ayuda de su esposo y que con este negocio apoya al sostenimiento de su familia. También vende bebidas gaseosas.

Todas las mañanas compra los ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración de su producto y sale a venderlo frente a su casa a partir de las cinco de la tarde hasta las nueve o diez de la noche. Ella es muy conocida debido a la buena sazón con la que prepara sus comidas.

María está solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra de más ingredientes con los que pueda ampliar su negocio de venta de hamburguesas así como en la  compra de un andamio para mostrar sus bebidas.

Ella ya ha trabajado con nosotros anteriormente y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos. Su más grande anhelo es tener una pollería para adegurarle a sus hijos una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
María is 32, married, and has two children. One is nine years old and the other is 9 months old. She lives with her husband in the Paiján district, Ascope province, in the La Libertad region. It is located three hours from the city of Chiclayo. For three years she has been selling “salchipollos” (food made from fried chicken and fried potatoes) and hamburgers from a vending cart. She tells us that she got the cart with help from her husband. The business helps support her family. She also sells soft drinks. Every morning she buys the ingredients she needs to make her product. She leaves to sell her product in front of her house from five in the afternoon until nine or ten at night. She is very well known for the good seasoning she uses to prepare her food. María is asking Edpyme Alternative for a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy more ingredients, which she will use to increase her hamburger business. She will buy a stand to display her drinks. She has worked with us previously, and she has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with her payments. Her biggest desire is to have a poultry shop in order to assure her children of a quality education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and a fixture to increase her hamburger business

loans.name: Varduhi

texts.en:
Varduhi S. lives in Yerevan with her husband and two school-aged daughters. Varduhi graduated from the teachers training college and worked at the Nalbandyan School for about 10 years.

5 years ago she rented a shop where she creates flower arrangements and wedding baskets and offers accessories for sale. Varduhi’s husband works in the soft drinks and alcohol trade at the trade fair. Varduhi is requesting a $3,000 loan to expand her business, so she can rent evening dresses in her shop.

loans.use: Offer evening dresses for rent in her shop

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena P., from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City, is 45 years old, married and has three adult children. To make a living, Lucena owns and operates a specialized retail store whose main income is derived from buying and selling rice in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lucena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 8000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her store.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Solotua

texts.en:
Solotua T. is 31 and married with 6 children (ages 9 - 13).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting ava (kava). Solotua has 4 years of experience in this business. Solotua needs a loan of WST $750 to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 tala or US $188 per week) to supplement her family's income.

In 2006, Solotua joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Solotua's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Solotua T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.4 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.3 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.4 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.4 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk.

loans.name: Mariana Lucia

texts.es: Doña Mariana  tiene la edad de 57 años, es una mujer trabajadora comprometida a su trabajo ella se desempeña como Responsable de un programa social familiar desde hace nueve años, en donde llevan los programas y consejos a familias a los barrios mas pobre, lo cual le trabaja a los Españole, que son los que hacen posible estos proyectos. Procreo dos hijos, casada, su esposo es ingeniero civil. Y junto han logrado hacer su casa, la necesidad que tiene es que quiere comprar un lavandero nuevo ya que esta rajado el que tiene, repellar las paredes, y embaldosar la parte en donde lava lo cual comprara: arena, cemento, piedrin y comenzar para estar en mejores condiciones como mejor higiene. Sus planes es poder ir mejorando las necesidades de su hogar poco a poco ya que todo ha incrementado y solo mediante este medio de financiamiento se puede avanzar por los meses y plan de pago. Con el crédito anterior logro terminar el caraje,  lo cual esta feliz por poder hacer las mejora a su vivienda, como poder ayudar a sus hijos en lo necesario.
texts.en:
Mariana is 57 years old and is a very hard-working woman who is committed to her work. For the past 9 years, she has been responsible for a family social program where they take programs and counsels to families in the poorest neighborhoods; these projects are put on by Españole. She has two children, is married, and her husband is a civil engineer. With him, they have been able to build their home; however, currently they need to buy a new washer, plaster the walls, and tile the area where they wash clothing. In order to do this, they will need sand, cement, and gravel. One they finish, their home will be in better conditions and more hygienic. She plans to improve her home little by little and only through loans like this can she accomplish her goals. With her previous loan, she was able to finish her garage which made her very happy as she improved her home and better provided for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sand, cement, gravel to plaster the walls and tile the floor; also purchase a new washer

loans.name: Suy

texts.en: Mr. Suy D. is 53 years old and lives in Pech Changva Village, Takeo Province. He and his wife, Mrs. Pin Aom, are farmers. Although they try to work hard on the farm they still earn less income than they need to support the family. Thus, Mr. Suy D. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase ten pigs and some pig feed for pig breeding. With this loan, their income will increase and the family will benefit too. The couple has four children. One of them is a farmer who supports the parents' farm, another is a pig breeder, while the other two are students at the local school. His wife is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To purchase ten pigs and a supply of pig feed.

loans.name: Blanca Guillermina

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Paraíso se encuentra en la parroquia Cumbe al sureste de la ciudad de Cuenca, es conocida por su producción ganadera y lechera, también su gente adulta se dedica a la agricultura ya que gran parte de los jovenes han migrado a las grandes ciudades del país y al extranjero para brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida, en esta region encontramos muchas mujeres solas que se han agrupado para salir a adelante con sus hijos en su terruño.  

La señora Blanca P. es socia del banco comunal El Paraíso es una socia muy carismática y amable, vive en el sector la Floresta, tiene 52 años de edad, se encuentra casada y en su unión ha procreado 4 hijos que se encuentran de 26, 24, 20 y 18 años todos ya casados, su ultimo hijo vive en suca y comparte con ella los gastos del hogar,  su esposo trabaja en la ciudad de Machala en una bananera, siendo la recompensa de muchos años de sacrificio el tener su casa propia.

Blanca es empleada en una casa labora  en ella ya 18 años de lunes a viernes de 8 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m., también se dedica a la cría de gallinas, cuyes y chanchos, que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica y tambien es para el consumo en su hogar. Se encuentra trabajando con  los créditos de la fundación hace un año y éstos le han permitido solventar algunos apuros en su hogar, con el nuevo crédito va a comprar  dos  terneras ya que tiene hierba en unos potreros que recibió de herencia de sus padres, su sueño es poder construir otra casa para ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The community bank "El Paraíso" can be found in the parish of Cumbe to the southeast of the city of Cuenca. It is know for its meat and dairy farming, and the adults of Cumbe work as farmers as a large number of the young people have migrated to the big cities of the country and abroad in order to offer their families a better quality of life. In this region we find many many women who are without their husbands and who have banded together in order to get by successfully with their children in their homeland.

Blanca is a member of the community bank El Paraíso, and is a very charismatic and kind woman. She lives in the "La Floresta" neighborhood, is 52 years old, is married, and has 4 children who are 26, 24, 20, and 18 years old. They are all married, and her youngest child lives in her house and shares the household expenses with her. Her husband works in the city of Machala in a banana plantation. As the reward of many years of sacrifice, they now own their home.

Blanca is a domestic employee and has worked in the same home for 18 years, working from Monday to Friday, 8:00am to 5:00pm. She also works breeding chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs, which she sells when they have any financial needs and which they also eat at home. She has been working with loans from the Foundation for one year and these have enabled her to solve some difficulties in her home. With the new loan she is going to buy two calves as she has grass in some pastures that she was left by her parents. Her dream is to build a house in order to help her children.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Hasena Group

texts.en: Hasena leads a loan group which is also called Hasena. She lives in Afghanistan, in Kabul's 11th district, is married and has four children. She is a tailor and works hard to earn enough money to meet her family’s needs. Hasena is applying for a loan to buy a new sewing machine for her shop because her old one is in very poor shape. She would also like to hire a student to work for her. To achieve these goals, she has applied for a loan of 15,000 Afghani. She is excited by the prospect of expanding her small business, and extends sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders for their willingness to help the poor people of Afghanistan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz A., from the village of Upper Luinab, Iligan City, is a 48-year-old widowed mother of eight adult-aged children. To make a living, Paz owns and operates a business selling firewood in the local community. Engaged in her business for over a year, she earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Paz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, she is now requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Paz plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Upper Luinad, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Johanna

texts.en:
Johanna runs her business out of Limón, located in the Caribbean region of Costa Rica. She has managed to strike a balance between performing her domestic responsibilities and running her sales business. She plans to use this loan to invest in catalogue merchandise in order to increase her inventory of products for sale. This loan will help Johanna to take advantage of product offers and sales by enabling her to invest in the purchase of items such as cosmetics, clothing and kitchen appliances.

Johanna´s goal is to expand her business in order to increase her income and improve her standard of living (and that of her family). She plans to increase her sales by seeking out new clients and hopes to one day open her own small store. Johanna cites her main obstacle as a lack of working capital, necessary for investments in merchandise that she can sell.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, clothing and kitchen appliances.

loans.name: Mwanamvua

texts.en: Mwanamvua P. is a married businesswoman.  This entrepreneur runs a food shop in Buguruni ward, Dar es Salaam. She purchases her business goods from the food market, shopping center and wholesale food shops. She also purchases goods from the food crop product suppliers in wholesale. Her business income enabled her to open another business, selling jewelry, at Kariakoo. She is requesting a loan of 1,600,000 TZS to boost her businesses.

loans.use: To buy more business goods to expand her businesses

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a single mother of five children and four of her children go to school. Sarah doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She sells local gin to all categories of people. She buys this local gin from suppliers on Mengo Kisenyi Kafumbe Mukasa Road and those suppliers get it from the villages of Kyenjojo, Fort Portal and Kasese. Sarah doesn’t pay rent for her business because she works from her home. She wants to use this loan of 1,000,000/= to buy more jerrycans of local gin.  She works seven days a week.  Her business challenges include transportation and defaulters.  She aspires to own a fully stocked bar. Sarah joined MCDT because she wanted to boost her business by getting more capital. She resides in and rents a two-room house where she stays with her children. Her monthly expenses include rent, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local gIn

loans.name: Daysi Dominga

texts.es:
La señora Daysi Dominga L. G., tiene la edad de 49 años es madre soltera de 3 hijos y sobrevive gracias a sus trabajos de costura quien inicio sus trabajos en esta actividad gracias a su propio esfuerzo debido a que aprendió estos oficios reparando en primera instancia prendas y posteriormente ahorro para la compra de  una máquina de coser overlook que realiza costuras industriales.

Es para su propio negocio que ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de telas con la intensión de realizar las ofertas de trabajo y aumentar su producción que favorezca a la economía personal en beneficio de su pequeña familia. Ella ha sido una mujer sola que ha salido adelante y mejorado sus condiciones económicas en pro de su familia, espera se le brinde un apoyo para continuar con las mejoras en su vida.
texts.en:
Señora Daysi Dominga L. G. is 49 years old and is the single mother of 3 children. She survives thanks to her sewing work. She began this work through her own efforts. First she learned how to sew by repairing garments, and later she saved to buy an overlock sewing machine which is used for sewing in factories. She is applying for a loan for her own business so that she can purchase fabrics with the intention of making items to offer for sale and increasing her production, which will improve her personal economic situation and benefit her little family. She has been a single woman who has advanced herself and improved her economic conditions for the benefit of her family. She hopes that support will be offered to her to continue with the improvements in her life.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabrics to make items for sale

loans.name: Juana Elena

texts.es:
Doña Juana vive en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, madre de cuatro hijos, es una mujer aun con deseo de seguir trabajando, tiene 61 años de edad,  y su negocio es la costura, vende fritanga por las tardes, y los fines de semana hace nacatamales para lograr vender y obtener mejores ingresos.
Durantes años ha trabajado en fabrica de ropa, al jubilarla fue que comenzó a trabajar en su pequeña casa, muy sencilla, y lo que desea hacer es cambiar el techo ya que esta en mal estado. Que cuando llueve se moja y se le hace muy incomodo.
Comprara zinc, clavos y madera para hacer el cambio del techo  y poder lograr vivir en mejores condiciones. Que gracias a los financiamientos ha logrado poder invertir en su negocio como mejorar su pequeña casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood, she is a mother to four children and she wishes to continue working, she is 61 years old. She works as a seamstress and sells fried foods in the evenings and during the weekends she makes tamales to keep selling and have better earnings.

For some years she worked in a clothing factory and once retired she began working in her small home. Her house is very plain and she wants to change the roof since it is in a bad state, when it rains she gets wet and it is very uncomfortable.

She will buy zinc, nails and lumber to change the roof and to be able to live in better conditions. Thanks to the loans she has been able to invest in her business as well as improve her small home.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy zinc, nails and lumber to change the roof since it is in a bad state, and wants to live better.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa A. is from the village of Lower Tambo, Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 28 years old, married and has 2 infants. Teresa owns and operates a mini-restaurant, serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Teresa has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Teresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Teresa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

location.town: Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Chanroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanroeun M. has been married since 1993 and has one son and one daughter. Both of them are in school. The family lives on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chanroeun and her husband are silk weavers. They sell their finished products to the middlemen in the village. Chanroeun is requesting another loan of $200 to help her cousin purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To help her cousin to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin A. is currently in the business of selling bread, groundnut paste and cooking oil. She is requesting a loan to stock more jerrycans of cooking oil to sell.  

Martin is 21 years old and single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: Stock more jerrycans of cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Aghavni

texts.en: Aghavni A. lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Arapy.  She is especially proud of her three children – 2 daughters (15 and 19 years old) and her 17 year old son.  Over the past ten years Aghavni has been engaged in raising livestock and growing vegetables and wheat.  She chose this business because agricultural production is the main economic opportunity in Arapy.  She wants a loan to purchase fuel for the wheat harvest and for cattle feed.  Aghavni expects this expansion of her business to increase the family income by 25%.  With these funds she will be able to pay the tuition fees for her children’s education.  Aghavni really enjoys living in Arapy and is fortunate to have many friends and family as neighbors.  With success she intends to continue growing her business.

loans.use: fuel and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her courses at the university

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe DEMBAGNOUMA (4 femmes mariées  et 2 veuves) avec une moyenne d’âge de 42  ans,  3 enfants, vivent dans des  familles polygames à MEDINE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur quatrième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et tous les prêts antérieurs se  sont  bien dénoués. Ce groupe de femmes fait  des activités  diverses et variées telles que la  restauration avec MARIAM K., la vente de condiments, la teinture, la vente de savon etc.
MARIAM K.  compte acheter avec son  prêt  200kg de riz +  6 paquets de condiments + 1 chargement de charrette en bois de chauffe pour faire la restauration.
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché et  dans les villages voisins .
Les plats sont vendus au  grand marché de Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 70.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Dembagnouma group (four married women and two widows), average 42 years of age and have on average three children each. They live in polygamous families in Medine, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso (Mali's third administrative region).

They are on their fourth loan from the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the goal of satisfying customer demand. All their previous loans have been repaid in full. This group of women have a variety of activities, such as restauration in the case of Mariam K., the sale of condiments, dyeing, the sale of soaps and so on. 

With her loan Mariam K. is planning on buying 200kg of rice, six packets of condiments and one barrowload of firewood for her restauration business. She gets her supplies at the large market and in neighboring villages. Her dishes are sold for cash, at Sikasso's large market and  within her family to a customer base made up of men and women. 

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 70,000FCFA, of which part will be used to help her husband out with the daily expenses and the rest invested in her business.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for restauration

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
At the age of 55, Fely is already a widow, but continues to live and be productive for her six children: Alberto, 30, an electrician; Al Vinant, 24; Ruby Christine, 23; Al Jerald, 19; Al John, 17; and Maria, 14. Fely’s children describe her as a hardworking and tough mother. The thing that is always kept in her mind is that she will work as long as she can for herself and for her family.

Fely owns and operates an embroidery business. This became the main source of their income to use for their expenses and to buy things that they need. It continued to grow after Fely joined and got her first loan from Kiva field partner, Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI). Now she has asked for a loan for the improvement again of her business to have a better output. Specifically, the loan will be used to purchase raw materials needed for her embroidery business. She hopes soon to build a booth to sell her finished products. 

Fely is really hoping right now that her business will become stable for them to be able to live a sumptuous but simple life. Her long-term goals are for her last five children to complete college and to have stable jobs that will help her family move away from under the umbrella of poverty.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials needed for her embroidery business

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda B. lives in the Lubaga neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed, has six children and also cares for her brother's daughters. For the last 10 years, she has made a living by running a restaurant, where she works six days a week. She supplements her income by renting rooms and selling food in her home. Imelda is applying for a loan for 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy food for her restaurant, including rice, bananas, beef and chicken. The main challenge she faces is transportation, especially during the rainy season. In the future, she hopes to open a second restaurant. Imelda owns her home and has access to electricity and water.  Her major monthly expenses include medicines and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her restaurant, including bananas, rice, beef, chicken and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es: Beatriz Elena B. habitante en Costa Hermosa, un barrio ubicado en Soledad, vende mercancías variadas como electrodomésticos calzados y ropa; Inicio su negocio cuando trabajaba en una fabrica de calzado hace aproximadamente 25 años y con ello ayudó a sus hermanos y compró su casa, la cual mantiene arrendada. Su negocio lo desarrolla en compañía de su hermana quien es la gestora principal de sus ventas, ellas compran en Maicao, municipio de la Guajira al que viajan dos veces al mes compran electrodomésticos y todo lo que es calzado, ropa lo compran en el centro de Barranquilla donde tiene unos proveedores que les dan unos precios especiales por su compra de contado. Este es su octavo financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con él planea comprar electrodomésticos menores, que tiene encargados por sus clientes y ropa que va a promocionar, pues se acerca el mes de Diciembre y debe estar preparada para la gran demanda de productos que se avecina. Beatriz Elena cuenta que estar vinculada a los programas de la Fundación le representa no solo la posibilidad de acceder a un crédito, sino también la oportunidad de vincularse a procesos de formación empresarial,  que le ayudan a entender su negocio y sacarlo adelante. Su gran sueño es apoyar a su hermana en la compra de un carro,  para darse unas merecidas vacaciones.
texts.en:
Beatriz Elena B. lives in Costa Hermosa, a neighborhood of Soledad where she sells various goods such as electrical appliances, footwear and clothes.  She set up her business when she was working in a footwear factory approximately 25 years ago.  Through her business she has helped her siblings and bought her own home which she rents out.  She carries out her business together with her sister who is her principal sales manager.  They buy their products in Maicao, a town in la Guajira to which they travel twice a month to buy electrical appliances, footwear and clothes.  They buy their goods in the center of Barranquilla where there are providers who give them special prices because they buy in cash.

This is her eighth loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to use it to buy small electrical appliances which her customers have ordered from her and clothes which she is going to promote since the month of December is approaching and she must be prepared for the great demand for products which is getting closer.  Beatriz Elena tells us that being a part of the programs of the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo doesn't only mean that she can access loans but also that she has the opportunity to undertake business training which helps her to understand her business and make progress in it.  Her great dream is to support her sister in the purchase of a car so that she can have a well deserved vacation.

loans.use: To buy small electrical appliances which her customers have ordered and clothes to promote

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. smokes fish and then sells the smoked fish in Abura. She is a widow who cares for five dependants. Esi has been selling smoked fish for ten years. She is responsible for the well-being of her family. Her loan will be used to buy different kinds of fish to smoke so she can supply an increasing number of customers. She hopes to reinvest the new profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of fish to smoke

loans.name: Marcos Tomas

texts.es: Marcos Tomas tiene 37 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de chatarra. Hace más de 2 años que tiene este medio de vida. Este hombre hábil y emprendedor; trabajaba en esta labor que le genera  dinero. Su oficio lo inicio desde hace 2 años. Hoy posee su propio negocio, siendo sus principales fuente de ingresos los que gracias a su dedicación y creatividad, le generan ganancias necesarias para su hogar. Ahora desea invertir en la compra de chatarra que será para su negocio.
texts.en:
Marcos Tomas is 37 years old and has a business buying and selling scrap. He has operated this business for more than two years. He is an able and enterprising man who now has his own business. Thanks to his dedication and creativity, the business is now his main source of income, covering the needs of his household.

This loan will be used to invest in scrap for the business.

loans.use: Buy scrap for scrap business.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar tiene 48 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en el sector Diego Ferré, una zona urbano -  marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Una de las ciudades más comerciales del norte peruano, es la capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace cinco años a la elaboración y venta de bebidas como soja y avena, el adquiere sus insumos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo y las vende por litros en los diversos barrios de la ciudad de Chiclayo, para ello se vale de una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar labores de transporte de carga y pasajeros).

Julio Cesar desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más insumos de modo que pueda ampliar su nivel de ventas y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is 48 years old, single, and lives with his family in Diego Ferré, an urban area on the outskirts of the city of Chiclayo.  One of the most commercialized cities in northern Peru, it is the capital of the Lambayeque region.

He has been making and selling soy- and oat-based drinks for five years.  He buys his ingredients at the main wholesale market in Chiclayo and sells them by the liter in different neighborhoods of Chiclayo.  He does this using a mototaxi (a motorized vehicle that consists of a motorcycle with a cabin attached for carrying cargo or passengers).

Julio Cesar would like to expand his business by buying more ingredients so that he can increase his level of sales and bring in more profits.  This is why he decided to request a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for expanding his business of selling soy- and oat-based beverages

loans.name: Suhayli

texts.ru: Асламов Сухайли житель города Куляб. Ему 26 лет. Женат. Имеет одного ребенка. Живет вместе с родителями. Мать работает уборщицей. Сам Cухайли занимается торговлей на рынке Саховат. У него собственная торговая точка. В основном он продает нижнее белье, платки и многое другое. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже два года. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. Он намерен расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Suhayli A., 26, lives in Qulyab. He is married with one child. The young couple lives with his parents. His mother works as a cleaning lady. Suhayli has a retail stand at the Sahovat market where he sells underwear, handkerchiefs, and so forth. Having been in this business for two years, he is applying for a loan that would allow him to expand his business.

loans.use: to increase turnover

loans.name: Phun

texts.en: Phun S., 22, is married and resides with her family in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. sells electric equipment, earning an income of USD 3.50 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 80 on food and USD 30 on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase more electrical equipment to resell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more electrical equipment to resell

loans.name: Elonita's Group

texts.en:
Elonita S. is from the village of Villa Sur Maddela, Quirino. She is 53 years old. Elonita is the leader of a seven-member group asking for a loan from ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Elonita S. group.

Elonita is single. To make a living, Elonita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elonita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elonita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elonita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elonita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Elonita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell in a retail store

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita D. C. is from the village of Brgy. Sto.Domingo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 53 years old. Emelita is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Emelita owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling fruit and vegetables in the local community. Emelita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Emelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Emelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Charline

texts.en:
Charline B., age 29, is engaged in a fishing business. She harvests ocean-caught fish and sells these in the local community. Charline has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. She and her husband live in the village of Danao and have three school-aged children. 

In 2003, Charline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Charline has successfully repaid her most recent previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. Charline is now requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Charline from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena, 39 years old, is a married woman with six children. Her oldest child is 24 years old. Her husband works in the Philippine Army.

Rowena has a backyard piggery. She fattens the pigs, then sells them to the market. She also owns and manages a sari-sari store where she sells chips and other products. She also offers mobile phone credit loads. Rowena works hard to have a stable business.

This loan will be used to purchase feeds and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma A. is from the village of Langcataon, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Elma is married and has 9 school-aged children. To make a living, Elma owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap & bread in the local community. Elma has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Elma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital. 

Elma is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & beverages to sell. This loan will be her 7th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from this investment to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & beverages to resell

loans.name: Vahan

texts.en:
Vahan H. is 54 years old. He lives in Vanadzor city with his wife and his school-aged son. Vahan’s daughter is married and lives separately. 

Twelve years ago, Vahan re-equipped his garage into a workshop where he runs his business: Vahan makes windscreens to order.  He purchases glass and other necessary materials from wholesale importers.  With his business income Vahan is able to provide for his family.

Vahan is seeking a loan of 800,000 AMD to buy glass and plastic films for his business.

loans.use: buy glass and plastic films for his business

loans.name: Constancio

texts.es: El señor  Constancio es cliente antiguo que ingreso  el año 2004 con el grupo solidario "unión la portada" por motivo de viaje se independizo y solicito crédito individual trabajando  durante  9 secuencias  demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad  en sus pagos. El esta muy contento de que se le haya elegido para el programa Kiva debido a que  se siente beneficiado de gran manera con el préstamo que se le otorga, el es  tornero y necesita  el dinero para comprar  paquete de muelles, para su tornería su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona del Tejar,  el  se levanta muy temprano para  trabajar   en su taller de tornería y muelleria y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Constancio is a long time client who joined the Unión La Portada Communal Bank in 2004.  Due to travel, he became independent and requested an individual loan.  He has worked during nine cycles demonstrating punctuality and responsibility with his payments.

He is very happy that he was selected for the Kiva program.  He feels greatly benefitted by the loan he was granted.  He is a lathe operator, and he needs the money to buy a package of springs for his metal shop.

His home is located in the Tejar zone.  He gets up very early in order to work in his metal and spare parts shop.  That way he improves his income.  

He is grateful to the institution for the support they have given him.

loans.use: to buy packages of springs

loans.name: Marecel

texts.en:
Marecel is from the village of Kulasihan, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 30 years old. Marecel is married and has five school-aged children. 

To make a living, Marecel owns and operates a business venture providing karaoke or videoke services to local community members. Marecel has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Marecel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Marecel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools and utilities needed for the maintenance of the service. This will be the first loan taken out by Marecel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools and utilities needed for the maintenance of her karaoke service.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 32  ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. EIles vivent chez eux avec leurs maries et leurs nombreux enfants à MEMISSALA, un situé à environ 30 km de la ville de NIENA région de Sikasso, 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur cinquième cycle de prêt  de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin en moyen de production et intrant agricole. Les prêts antérieurs ont été remboursés avec satisfaction. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du maïs, du riz, et d’arachide.
AMINATA compte acheter, 3 sacs d’urée, 2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage.  Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50.000 à 55 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
These members of the BENKADI 3 group are married women with an  average age of 32 and on average three children. They live at their homes with their husbands and their many children in MEMISSALA, a village situated about 30 km from the town of NIENA , Sikasso region, third administrative region of Mali. 
 
These clients are on their fifth seasonal loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy their needs in terms of production materials and agricultural entrants. Their former loans have been reimbursed satisfactorily. 

This group of women grow maize, rice, and peanuts.

AMINATA intends to buy three sacks of urea (fertilizer), two sacks of cereal-complex, and use the rest of the loan for plowing and weeding costs. She expects to make an average profit of 50,000 to 55,000 F CFA which will be used for the everyday expenditures of her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural entrants and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Nineth

texts.es: Nineth trabaja vendiendo zapatos en un puesto de venta de su propiedad. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una movilidad así podrá traer mayor cantidad de mercadería y bajara el costo de transporte, pues ella viaja a la frontera con Chile para comprar los calzados que vende. Vive en alquiler la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Villa Nueva Potosí en la ciudad de La Paz, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en:
Nineth works selling shoes from a sales stall that she owns.  She needs this loan to buy a vehicle that she can use to transport a larger quantity of merchandise and thereby lower her transport costs as she travels to the Chilean border to buy the footwear that she sells.  

Nineth rents her accommodation in Villa Nueva Potosí district, in the city of La Paz.  She is single and doesn't have any children.  This is the first time that she has had a loan from IMPRO

loans.use: to buy a vehicle to use when going to buy shoes so that she can save on transport costs

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor  es un agricultor muy conocido  de la zona de Pérez Zeledón.
El se dedica especialmente a la cria y engorde de cerdos, y en este momento el esta solicitando un préstamo de  ₡600 000 (Seiscientos mil colones) para la compra de medicamentos y alimentos para sus cerdos. El desea tener  las mejores recursos que poder darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
El es socio de la Empresa De Crédito  Comunal de Bancruce una de las 110 empresas de crédito socias de EDESA  en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Victor is a very well-known farmer in the zone of Pérez Zeledón.

He specializes in raising and fattening pigs, and at this time he is requesting a loan for ₡600,000 (six hundred thousand colones) to buy medicines and feed for his pigs. He wants to have these improved resources so that he can provide better service to his customers. 

He is a member of the Bancruce communal bank, one of the 110 credit organizations which are partners with EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for his pigs.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia, a 57-year-old married mother of eight, works hard to provide for her family. She has operated a sari sari store in the Philippines for two  years and also earns an income from a computer shop. 

Emelia, who has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF, is now requesting a PHP 15000 loan to purchase additional items to sell in her store. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 42 years old, married and has two children.  To earn a living, he does motorbike ("boda boda") transport.  He has been in the business for three years and has employed one person to assist him.  Besides, he is employed.

John has benefited from Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management.  This has helped him to run his business well.  He has requested 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 39 years old and married to John. They have five school-going children. She has practiced farming for the last seven years.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her fifth loan. She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, she hopes to become a leading farmer in her area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Elizabet

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS DE BELLA MARIA ” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Ocongate, en la Provincia de Quispicanchis y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Elizabet 22años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 2 hijos, la socia trabaja en agricultura y ganadería y crianza de animales menores como chanchos, cuyes, aves de corral; la socia  engorda a sus ganados para la venta de estos en cuando alcancen la época de vender, la socia también compra cuyes los cría y los vende, ella desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de una vaca y cuyes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una vaca y 20 cuyes.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en: Elizabet belongs to "Las Triunfadoras de Bella Maria" community bank in the district of Ocongate, province of Quispicanchis, department of Cusco, Peru. She is 22 years old, married and has two children. She works in agriculture and livestock, raising small animals such as pigs, guinea pigs and poultry. She also raises cattle to sell when the time is right. She also buys guinea pigs to raise and then sell. She plans to use the loan to purchase a cow and 20 guinea pigs. She is grateful for the support and promises to be disciplined in making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and 20 guinea pigs.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 38 years old and lives in upper Salug Daku, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with four  children.
  
 Mercy  has a general store to earn a living and has had this business for fifteen years. Each month she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 4,000.00 to purchase more products for her general store.

 Mercy has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Mercy hopes to provide for the needs and wants of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her general store.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is 37 years old, married, and has four children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been running a retail shop for five years. Alex started with 100,000 shillings and now has 3,500,000 shillings as his working capital. His hardship is price fluctuations and his dream is to own a wholesale shop in addition to educating his children. Alex is requesting a loan to buy sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to  purchase sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Gilbert Christophe

texts.fr:
Gilbert est  un homme âgé de 41 ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse. Il a 03 enfants. 
Gilbert travaille comme éleveur de porcs et autres depuis 2004. Il élève ses porcs dans un quartier de la place et achète à Kpalimé et Vogan.
Gilbert a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des porcs.
texts.en:
Gilbert is 41 years old and is married to a saleswoman. He has 3 children.

Since 2004 Gilbert has been raising pigs and other animals. He keeps his pigs locally and buys them in Kpalimé and Vogan. He is requesting his first loan from Wages so that he can buy pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samuel is 40 years old. He is married to Esther, who operates the shop. They both support a family of three children. 

He has applied for a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs) with which he intends to buy sugar, washing detergents and soft drinks for his business. He earns a monthly income of Kshs 20,000. He has been in this business for a period of 10 years.

The anticipated profit will be used to buy and sell goods in his shop.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, washing detergents and soft drinks for sale.

loans.name: Rosa Hermelinda

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal El Arenal, vive por la comunidad de San Joaquian en la ciudad de Cuenca, este lugar que nos regalan hermosos paisajes, su clima es frió, su gente es amable y mantienen la  cultura y tradiciones de su pueblo, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades regresando a sus hogares en la noche.

La Señora. Rosa tiene 53 años, es casada y en su matrimonio ha concebido 7 hijos de los que cuatro son casados e independientes, sus hijos solteros son de 25, 18 y 17 años de edad, su hijo de 25 años trabaja y estudia en la universidad y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en el colegio. Su esposo es carpintero y labora en su negocio propio, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad. 

Doña Rosa se dedica a la agricultura, ella  siembra verduras y cría animales como  pollos y cerdos, sus productos son para su consumo y para la venta.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su tercer crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de semillas y abono para continuar con sus cultivos.

Su meta es crecer en la cría de animales y tener más cultivos.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the El Arenal community bank in Sayausi, a neighborhood of Cuenca.  The city is surrounded by mountains, the outstanding feature of an already-beautiful countryside.  The climate is cold. The local people are friendly and committed to preserving their culture and traditions.  Most earn their livings from commerce, raising animals and farming.  Some work in the city and live in the country.

Our member, Dona Rosa, 53, is married and has 7 children, four of whom are married and living away.  Her other children are 25-, 18- and 17-years old, respectively.  Her 25-year old son works and goes to the local university.  Her two youngest children are still in high school.  Her husband is a carpenter and owns his own business.  They own the house where they live.  

Rosa makes a living growing vegetables and raising chickens and pigs.  She uses some of what she produces and sells the rest.

Rosa has borrowed from the community bank twice before and she will use this loan to buy sees and manure for her next vegetable crop.

Her goal is expand her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her vegetable-growing business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda cuenta con 42 años de edad, está casada con el señor Faustino quien es maestro, tienen 4 hijos abimael, margarita, Cristian y Juan de los cuales solo 2 estudian, uno esta cursando el primer año de secundaria y el menos sexto año de primaria, ya que los demás están casados, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace  20 años.
Dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, para así apoyar un poco a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y a sus hijos con sus estudios, también así hacerse de una mejor solvencia económica y  calidad de vida, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas ropa como: pantalones, faldas, shorts, blusas, camisas, playeras, y ropa interior.
 Ella dice que una de las metas que tiene para su negocio, es la de hacerlo crecer muchísimo, ya que quiere construir un local, para poner su tienda de ropa, así mismo mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias, y poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios, para que puedan tener una carrera.
Esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y los donadores de kiva por todo el apoyo que les están brindando, ya que gracias a eso ahora cuenta con un mejor negocio y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 42 years old, married to Faustino who is a teacher, and has 4 children called Abimael, Margarita, Cristian and Juan. Two of them are in school. One is in his first year of secondary school and the younger in 6th grade at primary school. The others are married.

She has been in the business of selling clothing for 20 years. She says that she decided to start this business in order to help her husband with the household expenses and her children with school expenses, and also she wanted to have a better economic position and quality of life. She is going to use the money from this loan to buy more clothing such as: pants, skirts, shorts, blouses, shirts, T-shirts, and underwear.

She says that one of her goals for her business is to make it grow quite a bit, and she would like to build a facility for the clothing store and in this way improve and increase her earnings, and to be able to continue helping her children with their school expenses so that they can have a career.

She is very grateful to the community bank and to the Kiva loaners for all the help they are providing, and thanks to that she now has a better business and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pants, skirts, shorts, blouses, shirts, T-shirts, and underwear for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy lumber, varnish, paint, glue, nails, etc.

loans.name: Halima's Group

texts.en:
Halima is 46 years old and sells clothes to financially support her husband. She purchases clothes from a wholesale market and then sells them to her local clients for a profit. She knows fashion trends very well and offers her customers quality clothes at low prices.

Her husband is a mason who constructs buildings and houses on order. Halima is the mother of two sons. Her elder son is also a mason while her youngest son is only three years of age. She is a great mother and takes care of her children very well.

Halima is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothes-selling business. With the loan investment, she will purchase winter clothes in bulk quantities to offer more variety to her clients and increase her sales. She has been operating her business for many years, and she is very confident about the continued success of her business as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Mavie Patrina

texts.en:
Mavie Patrina is a 42-year-old woman living in the town of Faletagaloa.  She is married and has six adult-aged children.  To make a living, Mavie Patrina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Mavie Patrina has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 1000 WST a month from these activities.

In 2010, Mavie Patrina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Mavie Patrina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  Mavie Patrina is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST, which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozones.  Mavie Patrina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozones.

loans.name: Jumaboi

texts.ru: Джумабой женат и имеет четверых детей. Он более 15 лет является бригадиром в колхозе. Имеет 3,8 гектар арендованной земли, на который выращивает  кукурузу, пшеницу, помидоры и другие сельхозпродукции. Кроме этого он перерабатывает абрикосы, а также дома занимается разведением и откормом скота. В бизнесе помогают его семья, и они вместе дружно работают. Джумабой хочет приобрести минеральные удобрения для обработки земли, с этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 5000 Сомони. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам за поддержку.
texts.en: Jumaboi is married and has four children.  He has been a foreman at a collective farm for over 15 years.  He leases 3.8 hectares of land, where he grows corn, wheat, tomatoes and other agricultural crops.  Besides this, he also processes apricots, and is involved in breeding and fattening up livestock at home.  His family helps him with the business, and they work well together.  Jumaboi wants to purchase mineral fertilizers for treating the land, and is requesting a loan in the sum of 5000 Somoni for this purpose.  He hopes to receive your help and thanks you in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van is 38-years-old with 2 children who are at school age. She sells bamboo for making artificial goods  and makes dry rice noodle. Her business started 2 years ago. Participating in our credit program in 2008, she used loans for the bamboo selling service  and she  wants to have a loan of 8,736,000 Vietnam dong to  buy more bamboo for sale.

loans.use: to  buy more bamboo for sale.

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita is 49 years old and married with nine children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.
Enriquita has borrowed and paid back 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from food vending.
Enriquita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is single. 

Janeth has a shop that sells clothing products like shirts, blouses and underwear.  She has had this business for 5 years.  She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of clothing like t-shirts and blouses to sell.

Janeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Janeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy stocks of clothing like t-shirts and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Profetisa

texts.en:
Profetisa is widowed, with three children. Profetisa is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines.                    

Profetisa is a farmer and grows palay to earn a living. She has been doing this for ten years. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer.

Profetisa has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for five years. In the future, Profetisa hopes to harvest more palay during every cropping.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Don Manuel de 40 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol vive con su familia en casa propia, es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a su familia con las ganacias que obtiene de sus evntas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas y herramientas para su cultivo de maiz y frijol y tambien para mejorar su terreno que muestra la fotografia que es donde siembra sus cultivos. para poder tener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en: Manuel is 40 years old and he lives with his family in a house of his own. He is a farmer planting corn and beans. He is a hardworking person and he is very responsible with his household's obligations, and offering the best to his family is his main characteristic. By selling his products he earns an income he uses to pay for his household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, weed-killers and tools he needs for his corn and beans crops; he also wants to make improvements to his land that is shown in the picture and where he plants his crops, in order to earn a better income and to grant his family a better economic stability.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, weed-killers and tools.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is a married man. He describes himself to be polite. He operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for 11 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved living  standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 24 years old single with no children.She has been in this business for 3 years and employs 2 casual workers. She prepares chips and traditional foods such as Ugali, mixed vegetables-Sukuma week, and porridge. Chips move very fast and she experiences shortage during peak hours at lunch time. Currently the existing cooker can not allow her meet the demand during these hours.

loans.use: She needs money to purchase a higher capacity cooker that would be able to increase the output of chips two folds.

loans.name: Vodu

texts.en: Vodu is a trader in livestock such as fowls, ducks and sheep. She has been trained on the need to keep proper records on her business by the TEACH lending promoters - Kraban Support Foundation. Maame Vodu, as she is affectinately called, wants a capital loan of $600 from KIVA to enable her buy more animals to breed and sell.

loans.use: Woring CAPITAL

loans.name: San Juana

texts.en:
Mrs. P. has 7 years' experience in sales. Every time she moves she puts up a convenience store. "I depend solely on my little store and don't know how to do anything else. I just moved and would like some help, $1,200 to fill every corner of my store with products."

Translated from Spanish by Ari Vilhjalmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. P. tiene una experiencia de 7 años como comerciante, cada vez que se muda de domicilio instala su negocio de abarrotes. "Dependo de mi tiendita al 100 % no se hacer otra cosa mas que vender acabo de cambiarme de domicilio y me gustaría que me ayudaran con $1,200.00 dlls para llenar de productos todos los rincones de mi negocio".

loans.use: To buy convenience store items

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: N. T. T. Hoa is 38 years old. Her husband is N. Thu Thuy, and he is 39 years old. They have 3 children (12, 10, and 7 years old) who are in 7th, 5th, and 2nd class. He works as a daily labor, and she sells fruit at the Muong Man market. Their average income is 11$US/month/person. She wants to borrow 50$US to increase her capital.

loans.use: Sells fruit

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Three years ago, Galina started a small business selling personal manicure sets and grooming supplies at one of the busy outdoor markets in Zaporoshye, Ukraine. She tries to maintain an excellent selection of manicure sets and currently has a virtual monopoly for them in the market. Galina is single and has one grown son. Her business, from which she makes around $200-$300 a month in profit, is a very important source of income for her.

Galina would like to see her business continue to expand. She recently was able to purchase her own sales kiosk and eventually hopes to have it remodeled. She has requested a short term loan of $300 to add to her working capital and allow her to purchase additional inventory, expanding the price range of products she has available. Galina has been a good client in the past with Nadiya Ukraine and we look forward to continuing to assist her in the future.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Assaad

texts.en: Assaad is a 33-year-old father of three children. He lives with his family in the region of Tyre, where he grows vegetables. He needs $1,200 to fumigate the greenhouses he works in so as to control the emergence of weeds. Assaad needs to generate more revenue in order to take care of his nine-month-old daughter, who suffers from a chest allergy.

loans.use: Fumigation of greenhouses

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. E. Srey was married in 1984 and has three children, two sons and one daughter. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor in 1992 and began her silk weaving business in the same year. She is also buying and reselling fish in the village in the morning, and continues weaving silk in the afternoon. Her husband, Mr. Kheng Khoeun, is a construction contractor. He used to work for a neighbor and started a contracting construction business by himself in 1990. Two of her sons are also working; one is a security guard and other one is working as construction worker with her husband.

After borrowing money from MAXIMA several times, her living condition is getting better. She has a chance to set up a new loom for her daughter.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times already. Now she is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom and buying and reselling fish.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom and buying and reselling fish.

loans.name: Mariane's Group

texts.en:
Mariane S. currently rents her retail space. With a loan, Mariane wants to build her own shop to save money.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To build a shop

loans.name: Rosa Esmeralda Da Co

texts.pt:
Rosa Esmeralda da Conceição teodósio L. is a resident of the Infulene district. She is a single mother of 1 daughter. She is in her second loan cycle and is asking for $425.00US for 6 months to purchase goods. She works at the Republic Attorney's office of the Province of Maputo.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Rosa Esmeralda da Conceição teodósio L., residente no bairro de infulene Solteira mãe de 1 filha esta no 2º ciclo vai tomar o valor de 10000 a pagar em 6 meses, para comprar bens é trabalhadora da Procuradoria da República da Provincia de Maputo.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Esperanza's Group

texts.en:
This committee of fifteen women was formed recently by a group of women entrepreneurs. They work independently from one another in different businesses selling food, drinks, clothing, and items for the house. Although they have their independent businesses, they come together to ask for loans, support one another in their business plans, and also to make payments on their loans.

Today they are asking for a small loan to continue increasing their business ventures. All of the women will get a portion of the loan that they need and with it, they will buy things like food, refreshments, clothing, and goods for the home.

loans.use: To buy food, refreshments, clothing, and goods for the home to sell.

loans.name: Punkhan

texts.en:
